plj45Z6by11je6Ap48GSqQ.review_text: This little corner bar was fantastic! the atmosphere was unique and interesting. It was a little too crowded to stay for a long period time, but I highly recommend the safe sex on the beach.  The bartenders are fantastic and friendly.  Lost one star due to the multiple times I split my drink because people were bumping into me.

5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: There might not be a bar I like better in the city.

cMNmCqKzUpQ7MTTyM-C1FQ.review_text: It's a pretty tiny place to lounge around and hang out...if you have concerns about people invading your personal space (like I do)....you don't want to hang out here for longer than an hour.  The walls are cluttered with photos and weird decorations and it's dark inside. I liked my little corner and pretty much hung out there the whole time I was inside. Parking kinda sucks, too!  If you have good company with you, you would enjoy being at Lush. I got distracted with all the clutter and people invading my space.

IFYkRXw4DwrXqPyLptOaAA.review_text: It reminds me of those local bars friends go to for years. There are two levels, a large open space downstairs and smaller upstairs areas with more tables/booths. There are many drink specials and are great. Bring cash!

m47_RxS0o2gGmb0HNxQNVQ.review_text: This place rocks! Me and my bro go there for happy hour all the time. What can I say, great cocktails, awesome old movies and tons of atmosphere. Be careful with your money tho, the streetlife has been known to wander in and steal money you leave as a tip when you're not paying attention.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text:
i happened to stumble across this place. its 30 ft from re:fresh day spa where i get my deep tissue massages from and is on a corner where theres motocycle parking. i walked in one day, THEY GOT CHAMAY ON TAP. 
  its a nice lil spot. id easily recommend just for the pbr and chimay on tap, but they gots one of the craziest mixed drinks list iver seen. AND TRUST ME I KNOW MY ALCHYMOHOL.

gRM4kM_SFzRMngd5YDimmw.review_text: This place is a hoot. The bartender was an ass but in the sense you can only laugh back about it. The drinks were not bad but nothing to rave about. The decor was funky in a Applebee's sorta way. Then when its last call, they turn on these H U G E  flood lights to get everyone out. Leave it to my girls to ignore it, put on their oversized shades, and finish their drinks and conversation while the bartender counted his tips.

uAa2Hu6XtuUPxX_B3uS8Aw.review_text: Great place to come to pre-party, hang out with friends or if you want more of a intimate setting, you can go upstairs and suck drunken faces with your date.  Lush isn't super pretentious; it doesn't need to be. The workers are themselves; nice, friendly, polite just like any other normal human being and I appreciate that. The decor is seems almost feels almost western speak easy-esque; with it's distressed wooden shelves filled with liquor on one wall and a rustic brick wall on the other. (Minus the TV) The fireplace is a plus on a cold evening, but for a person who runs warm, like me, it can be a nuisance. It's all about being comfortable folks. And when the place fills up with human bodies + fireplace = GET ME OUT OF HERE MY ARMPITS ARE DRIPPING THROUGH MY SHIRT.(Not hot) Luckily, the ventilation seemed pretty decent so I didn't have that problem here.  The drinks are reasonably priced too. Bartenders are quick, and attentive.  Minus -1 'cause it's a cash bar only. I always run out of cash. =(

QBLFfhGvmmmAZHJpITNa3g.review_text: Came here a few weeks ago to watch Brett Favre and the Vikings blow it against the Saints, and while the game was totally depressing, I really enjoyed Lush Lounge.  After stopping by a different bar on Polk Street that didn't have any more seating, my friends and I found a place here in the loft area to sit down and enjoy a drink while watching the game.  The space was nice and stylish, and comfortably populated on this particular Sunday afternoon -- not too empty, not too crowded.  They had some good drink specials.  I'd definitely come back here to check out their happy hour.

LILzX_U_z-1RDsY63UNiow.review_text: The cocktails here are DELICIOUS. Really. I used to be a, do a shot, chase it w/a beer kind of girl because I didn't understand prolonging the awful taste of getting nice and boozed up by adding some crappy fruity flavors and sugar.... the harder most people seem to try to spruce up a drink, the worst it ended up tasting. Now I love Bellinis, Grasshoppers and even the cliche Lemon Drop, oh my. The Oatmeal Cookie is off the hook! Rimmed w/brown sugar it's one on the top of my list. A close second is some Chocotini which they shave a Hersheys bar to garnish the top. This place actually makes these drinks taste as good as they try to make them look. Because of them 2 years ago, I can now appreciate "bitch drinks".  BUT you must get the right bartender, or they WILL taste like crap! Wish I could remember dudes name, all I know is he was there Mon-Thu nights. He's a real short guy, but he owns the bar when he's behind it so it should be easy to spot him... and hopefully he doesn't read this and have a height complex or else I'm not sure if he'll be serving me again. Ha.

KRoCu_g3tiXhJANzo1J57A.review_text: I came here on a Saturday night and it was PACKED to the rim, literally bodies grazing bodies.  But that's what you'll need to expect if you go to Polk Street during the busiest time of the week.  Although I'm not a fan of collecting someone else's sweat on my clothes, I fell in love with the music and the drinks.  They were playing music from the 90's and 00's, which made me feel very nostalgic.  All the drinks were good and decently priced; I especially liked my cucumber ginger gimlet.  Head on upstairs and you will find additional seating and it's much more calm up there compared to the shenanigans going on downstairs.  No cover? Heck yea!

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: Lush has swung it's doors open once more, new doors, but Lush Lounge's doors none the less. You'll find the new and improved Lush a block up from it's old location, right in the thick of the Polk St. bar scene, with more room for your lushing and lounging pleasure.  The most important thing here is that they're back with same squad of bartenders because lets face it, good bartenders are what makes a good bar. You can have the fanciest, hippest location in the city and if your team sucks ass you won't last long.  It will take me awhile to get used to as I'm sure it will for many of us who remember the old, much smaller digs. I'm no old man though, I embrace change, and I have to say while completely different I'm very impressed with the new setup. Much more room, longer bar, more tables, more lushing.  Did I mention the fireplace? Cozy. I asked if I could bring my own materials for smores and while I didn't get an explicit "no" I could tell the idea wasn't really embraced, I may have to hold off.  Next time you're wandering Polk, check it out. New spot, new interior, new setup, same great staff and customers. I enjoy being a lush at Lush.

NtllNRgTxVPTy4R2UKsblw.review_text: I almost feel like they should start a new review list for the new lush- its really a different bar.  Yes, the same awesome bartenders are there, but the bar itself is a lot different.  It has a lodge-type feel with a fireplace and an upper story with tables and benches.  The restroom situation is a bit odd- they have separate bathrooms for men and women but a common sink room.  For those women who feel compelled to fix makeup that might be not cool.  Fortunately, I'm not one of those women.  On the plus side, it allows us to verify that the menfolk are washing their hands.  Dirty boys.

_MON_UgnHo6aBTskVn4rwg.review_text: Stumbled in here after the Giants parade on a Wednesday afternoon.  The place was full of Giants fans playing hooky and the City Hall ceremonies were live on all the TV screens, plus there was still room to grab a spot to sit.  Big glass of cold beer on tap $5 and well worth it. The bartenders were fast and efficient and super nice to boot.  It was a great vibe inside and lots of fun decor to look at behind the bar.   I remember the 'old' Lush Lounge fondly and while this new version is different, its still lots of fun and worth checking out.  Score on all accounts!

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: $3 drink specials, friendly bartender and patrons, and very eclectic decorating make this a nice change of pace. The frozen martinis are a little bit too fruity for me, but the $3 Newcastles will do just fine...

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Love the new location of Lush.  Honestly, I had probably only been to the old location less than a handful of times, but I looooove the new place. It's about 3 times as big, the bathroom situation is a lot better, and they even have an upstairs.  The music selection consisted of a little bit of everything, from B Spears to MGMT, to the Yeah Yeah Yeah, and even some oldies were thrown into the mix!  The bartenders (all four of them) were attentive, didn't make you wait long at all, and were all HOT, in very different ways.  My g/f and I walk in after an extended happy hour and burritos and became angered when we find it's cash only!!! WTF! Why are most of the bars on lower Polk cash only? Super annoying.  So we walk outside, and one of the adorable bartenders follows us outside, tells us to take cash out of their ATM and he'll charge us a $1 less per drink. Pull my arm, OK done.  My friend and I were drunk and he was cute, so we went back in and took him up on his offer.

mvK1pv-x0Z5rP4Hz9cWBWw.review_text: **FRIENDLY BAR WITH FRIENDLY PRICES**  CASH ONLY.  No stupid VIP lines. No stupid front men.   My girlfriend and I squealed in delight upon discovering their offering of BLOOD and SAND, our signature drink of the month.  2 cocktails = $17 3 shots = $17  All in all, reasonable drink prices.  Ambiance was pleasant. Cozy fireplace with exposed brick wall.   20 seat bar along with table seating and standing room for the weekend crowds.   The combination of great cocktails and nice decor meant we had a good time.  RECOMMEND.

V6n7b90ijL6PhCGvfDt43Q.review_text: how can anyone not LOVE this place?  sorry to spoil it for you gay boys out there who just wish us breeder hipsters would just go away but this place is so much fun and we're not leaving!  it's a great mix of straight, gay, marina, mission, and everyone else in between all intermingling amidst the fruity signature cocktails and classic movies on the tv and cheesy music (was that phil collins i heard?).  i have never had a bad time here...perhaps it is because i've also downed a few too many of those $3 blueberry martinins?

2twfOpOzul0ggUgFpdDqaQ.review_text: Friendly, friendly and more friendly...this place has it down. Strong drinks, cute (straight) owners, good looking bartenders (both gay & straight), casual and comfortable feel and really friendly patrons. How can you top that!?

02OOfqubhSq72s4Tq2mBdQ.review_text: Lush, Lushy, Lushes, 3 drinks in... Luscious... This is my neighborhood bar, but I am not giving it 5 stars for convenience or even the strong drinks.... Bartenders are not only extremely talented at mixing drinks, but incredibly friendly, professional, funny, and attentive- oh and tolerant. This is the only bar I order mixed drinks at, typically I'm a bourbon on the rocks kind of girl- however like I mentioned earlier they are that dang good. They are also great at maintaining a non-riffraffyrowdy bar. The only negative thing is that since they are so damn good, I find myself here on a nearly daily basis. BTW their happy hour starts earlier than any other bar on the block- 3PM! Steve the owner is a amazing host and adds a personal touch and has amazing taste in bartenders. Svetlana (butchered your name- sorry) works on Monday and Friday Happy Hours, and Tuesday, Saturday, and Sunday evenings is skilled, quick, makes delish delish concoctions and is quick &amp; witty. Jack is the latest addition to the Lush family and recently declared the favorite aside from Svetlana works Happy Hours on Saturday, Sunday and evenings on Friday and Monday. He is an uber-amazing-mixologist. But honestly anytime you decide to go you will be served by a very attentive and professional staff.

JPVT0UE1dFmub1qh6uuhVg.review_text: Last night was my first time at Lush.  I've only recently moved to this neighborhood, and I've been auditioning local hangouts...this may just be it!  The bartenders were cute, the drag-spotting was fun, and the drinks were good enough that I didn't even notice the decor!  Ok, maybe that's cuz the guy I was with was a hottie conversationalist, but I'm giving credit to the bar anyway :p

5pBi1CSpm9467jh7PSBDkA.review_text: Some of the best cocktails and bartenders are in this tiny bar.  The all male bartenders are always sweet, charming, and welcoming.   I think it used to be a gay bar, but it's mixed now.  Our "Girl's Night Out" tend to start at the Lush, great place to kick off the night or end it. :)  The room is warm and cozy and the variety of people in this bar is fun for people watching.  The age range is huge and the aura of comfort it gives off is great to vibe off of.   It's easy place to meet natives or travelers and striking up conversation seems easy.

DUAsclvxPOacwCzZupj6tQ.review_text: Some friends took me to Lush Lounge for my first Saturday night out since moving to San Francisco a few weeks ago. Not too familiar with the area (except Tenderloin in general from traveling to San Francisco so much for my previous job), but it didn't feel shady at all. That could have been because of the hundreds of people milling about between bars and clubs on a Saturday at 12:30 am, but who knows.  Lush Lounge is small and gets crowded quickly, but the doormen were friendly. Two of the bartenders that served me were very courteous, prompt, and appreciative, but one of the bartenders - a tall, thin woman with long brown hair in a braid down her back - could have been a little more pleasant when I handed her my credit card and asked to open a tab. The Lush Lounge is *cash only,* and I didn't see the very small sign above the bar that read that, so I didn't know. She said they were cash only, pointed at the sign, and looked at me like there was something wrong with my face. I asked her if there was an ATM nearby, she pointed to the one by the door, and walked away. That, my dear girl, if you're reading this, is why you didn't get a tip, and the other two did.  Anyway, the review.  The Good: Great location; stiff drinks with loose pours; young, cool crowd. A good/bad combo: it's cash only, but apparently cash-only bars cost less. I bought the first round for my friends, which was three gin and tonics. I expected to pay upwards of $30, but it only cost me $18! There was good music playing, which wasn't too loud, but was loud enough you could still enjoy it if you were there for the music.  The Bad: I can't really write a bad review from one bad bartender, since she was probably having an off night and would normally be a fine conversationalist. The bathrooms are TINY, there's no stall (there's a toilet, it's just not in a stall, so if you have to relieve yourself it's going to be prison-style), and the line to get in was long.  The Bottom Line: I like this place, and I'm going back next weekend.

IB_DGJwb6s0P5M40t-wfDg.review_text: REMEMBER TO BRING CASH!  I really love this place.  Singles ready to mingle, good alcohol selection (Chimay beer!), nice decorations.  It is always an interesting interaction in the bathroom though when the boys and girls doors are right next to each other and you share a sink.  Funny though.  Definitely go check it out.  And if you don't like it there is a larger bar next door that is also super fun (I found myself at a dog fashion show there one night.. literally people modeling down a runway with dogs).

G9J2uWRrPltfq2rHxSCC8A.review_text: Not a huge fan of the going out on Polk st. scene, but I have to admit I generally have enjoyed my times at Lush. I never plan to go here, but it always has a good vibe, the there is a good variety in the drinks and drink specials which aren't too expensive, and the atmosphere is always pretty fun and lively. It's got a bit of a divey feel to it without making you feel gross. It's got a fun vibe without being a rager crazy place. Would recommend.

pZZw7NqDFUxIg0YT0vls8g.review_text: If I'm going out around the area, Lush Lounge is definitely my first stop of the night. It's relaxed, cool, and they have fabulous drinks! I love all their champagne cocktails- I haven't ordered a bad one yet!   Always a mixed crowd, but that's the fun part about San Francisco!   **cash only!

sa4mcYLJqQQ7y1yBRyWkdQ.review_text:
Ive been here before but could never remember the name.  Went last night and it all came back to me...great cocktails, excellent (friendly, knowledgeable and cool) bartenders, fresh squeezed juice, good beats and reasonable prices...
  The atmosphere is great - although all the random plants are a bit weird.
  If you dont mind braving the TenderNob...get to Lush Lounge...its worth the trip.

4mjnkd8oJVCfBKN3i4rB-g.review_text: Found you on Yelp, Lush!  The protocol is to order your drinks at the bar and find some seats/a table.  They have a mean beer selection and even meaner chocolate martini.  I cut myself off after that sucker.  Mixed drinks run $7-8.   Solid.

tEWswN4AD9jGQNNCcmgP6w.review_text: Can get crowded, good margaritas and vodka mixes. (good cocktails in general).  They had this weird watermelon shot, which was horrible.

t9OAdJcdL3suwm0jsAzQEw.review_text: You know, this place isn't bad! I stopped by for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night. The crowd is pretty casual, varying from girls in stilettos dressed to the nines to hipsters who haven't seen soap and water for a week. The bar is cash only, but the drinks are actually reasonably priced. The bartenders are quick and generous with their pours. I actually got a nice buzz off of a single drink! Also, no cover!

vDzJZHf1uF63LoG0DFZn2w.review_text: Great happy hour space under 80s music with very cheap drinks, dutiful, friendly bartenders who are, yes, cute and flirty and keep the free popcorn salted and ever ready.

muWo0gd3xEZHpq7Xty1-Dw.review_text: nice polk spot to grab a drink.  the decor is interesting, with statues of the virgin mary and buddha, and flat screen tvs.  big open windows in front for some semi-outdoor feeling seats.  nothing really special about this place, so i would normally give a place like this a 3 stars.  BUT, $2 PBRs and $6 shots of patron?!  now i know where i'm going next time i want to black out in record time.  they are pretty stingy about their happy hour though.  2 minutes after happy hour was over, i went to grab another PBR, and was charged $3!  crazy, i know.

YFG_qsnCwHTxgPAYYW-YQQ.review_text: Do you like chocolate martinis?  Do you find yourself asking bartenders  to "make me something fun and coconutty"? Have you had a white russian within the last month?  When you hear the words "key lime pie",  do you immediately think of the drink rather than the dessert?  If so, you should call me and we should go to Lush Lounge together.

earHe_Zs8X7LsabQXj1xpw.review_text: I don't do slushees, slurpees, frozen margaritas,  or even frozen yogurt, but  I have yet to pass thru the doors of the Lush Lounge and NOT partake in a frozen watermelon icee thing.  Delish, pretty and potent(ish) and  when accompanied by a bowl of popcorn during happy hour, makes a very respectable drunk girl's dinner.  Respectable was the adjective for  dinner, not girl.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: I stopped in here one night for a drink with a friend. I ordered the blood orange cocktail. it was strong (which I appreciate) but it tasted like the wax on the outside of the orange. Pretty disappointing. I have not been back since, I would be willing to try it again because it seems like a fun place to hang out, but I would stick to beer not mixed drinks.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: This is a fun little place to check out if you find yourself in the Tender-Nob; it's pretty close to AMC Van Ness as well as bars like Vertigo and Hemlock Tavern. I guess Lush is in theory a gay bar, but everytime I've gone everyone's been more than welcome. Last night, stopped in with good friend to catch up a little. Our bartender suggested a Hangar One Lime straight, and he served it perfectly chilled in a  martini glass - my buddy went for a mojito, which was also mixed to perfection, and served in a pint glass. They also had a Barbra Streisand movie showing, nice touch!

isPtPrKsP-4EILQyOvMIFQ.review_text: This is a pretty cool dive bar. One of favorites for happy hour with plenty of drink specials. The music is usually a mix of rock, pop and rap... and the crowd is pretty chill. It gets kinda loud inside but that's probably from ppl trying to talk over the music. Only downside about this place is it's CASH ONLY. There's an ATM near the door, so it's not too much of an inconvenience.

Tlh0k7Br73mAhC0fOdZinQ.review_text: What is the essence of intelligence? Some say that the moment you here or see something, another related piece of memory flashes in your mind. The better the quality of the related piece of memory(association), the better the intelligence.  Let me explain further. When I first heard about Lush Lounge, I saw a picture of a lush, green forest in my mind's eye. Then I got reminded of  "grrrl friendly" parties like Lush and Pleasurezone and fond memories filled me with happiness. Hence, when I saw Jill's invitation to lounge at Lush post movie, I decided to trek couple of blocks from Franklin and land up at Lush.  Our experiences not only widen our capacity for forming mental associations, but also "assimilates" into our neural networks and deepen our intelligence. After my experiences at Lush on Friday, if I hear the word Lush Lounge, the picture of attractive women, drinking amazing fruit-based cocktails, competing for men's attention with the Divas across the street or the delicious taste of $ 3 frozen mango martinis tingling my taste buds or the smell of lingering pot or the touch of   promising promiscuity towards the end stamps on my mind a rich multi sensory aroma of   memories and I feel I have taken a strong small step in my journey of evolution and change.

E2o9hfFV0PlI3sS2hMShGA.review_text: lush is definitely reccomended if you like sipping on frou frou drinks you're almost too embarassed to order while listening to feel good 80's music (bowie, talking heads rather than the obvious bar soundtrack of journey and lynard skynard). nearly every time i've come here, mommie dearest is on, which means lots of laughs over child abuse and too thick eyebrows. if john the bartender is working, you know you're in for a good time. last night three drunk trashy date rapist australian dudes staggered in and looked suspiciously close to vomiting. when the aforementioned super nice bartender suddenly turned serious and threated to kick their asses out, one of the paunchy three with his shirt unbuttoned to past his nipples declared loudly "australians don't hurl!" for the entire bar to hear then stumbled out. highly reccomended if you don't want to see people you know and want to meet people you don't want to know.

rKhZlF7W7YZT7gUSKHY5NA.review_text: One of my fav bars on Polk St.  I love going here with friends after work.  The Sour Cherry Martini they sometimes have is one of my fav drinks of all time!  Plus I love looking at Barbara Streisand posters and watching Audrey Hepburn movies while drinking.

-VMmi-tMcMO7bR90aCg_iA.review_text: An evening that started with a b-day party at seven and ended with walking a slightly intoxicated friend home across town at three had it's first after-dinner pit-stop here. Beware of the larger than normal Jaeger shots and the Long Island Ice Tea. Goood stuff. Relaxed and laid back place, too. This Martini fan's only caveat: the $3 watermelon Martinis. Tasted a friend's one and wasn't too convinced.

jipgimnSNp3qdK2dKUQvBg.review_text: Bumpin on a Saturday night for sure.  I haven't done a run on Polk since my 21st.  My friend chose this place because she was having dinner nearby.  Place gets crowded but the birthday girl managed to snag a table.  Good drinks specials like $9 Patron shots & $5 Watermelon Shooters.  Surprised that the space it's bigger than the pictures make it out to be.    It's a chill place and I usually go for a more "dressy" lounge but it's not a bad place at all.  And the birthday girl had a good time so that's all that really matters right?  Only minuses: Cash only & parking was horrible!  We ended up parking at the garage a block away for a decent rate for a little over an hour, but they're closed on Sundays, meaning we had to get back to the garage before 12AM.  3.5 rounded up.

2_GAj82-yhgAe1hYoWF8OQ.review_text: This is THE perfect bar:  1.    Near my workplace, perfect for kicking back after a tough day 2.    $4 frozen mango margaritas - you can feel the alcohol in it 3.    Free popcorn during happy hour 4.    Great music - usually 80's stuff 5.    Cute bartenders (and they're nice and generous!) 6.    Old movies played on the TV 7.    Live plants in the window - how can that NOT make you happy? 8.    Good mix of patrons 9.    Interesting window watching - somethin' always going on outside on Polk + Post 10.  Perfect for meeting up with a group of friends, on a date or even by yourself.  Go check this place out now!  You'll find me there on Thursdays.

7XvUlAuIRF9IhWAvlr5U7Q.review_text: Maybe it was the beer goggles talking but wow, the new space that lush moved to is absolutely GORGEOUS.  It had beautiful exposed brick walls, a nice fireplace, a loft, and the bars are made out of full cross sections of tree trunks.  Even the shitter was nice.  So good for these guys.  With this economy, being able to upsize is a pretty impressive feat.  It seems like this strip of Polk street is really getting to be a happening place.  And to any idiot that complains about gentrification... SHOVE IT, this is much better than crackheads and empty storefronts.

qF9KzuBRunwru18NEFc8EQ.review_text: Well considering I'm still tired from my visit here last night, I'd say I had a good time. I've passed by this place a lot and never went inside. I'm glad I finally did, as they have a nice happy hour, a good atmosphere inside and really nice bartenders. I enjoyed the frozen strawberry Martini and the "award wining" Lemon Drop Martinis (maybe a little too much, should have tried more food than just the popcorn perhaps, haha).  I would definitely go here again!

3xrb0LpbaJ24Pkdyd55U8Q.review_text: I went to Lush Lounge simply because all of the other bars in the area had lines down the block. I used to live in the area and had walked past it many times but never gave it much thought.   It was much bigger inside than I expected, and had a pretty good crowd. The drinks were great, especially the Alabama something or other, which had sweet tea vodka, my favorite! Highly recommend this place if you're looking for somewhere new and different.

TZExGajxC02oetl7iQ77eg.review_text: Great place to get a nice big cocktail from a cute bartender.  More fun to come in drag, or just watch the drag queens...

Rzjbl7-yV5anedZmJbbavg.review_text: While home for Thanksgiving Travis and I met up with some friends here.  This place is super chill, and has $3 PBR, so it already fit most of my needs.  It did get a little crowded, but they also were playing old movies (one of which being The Maltese Falcon) on the TVs above the bar, and playing lots of fun music, so clearly the slight crowding wasn't that bothersome.  In fact, it was never so crowded that I felt uncomfortable, but it did get a little noisy at times.    Minus one star for parking being kind of a bitch (welcome to San Francisco), and in a bit of a shady area.  We got lucky and parked on Hemlock, but I wouldn't count on being that lucky on a regular basis.

8ygOqCWjvm_6X1Uf3reIXw.review_text: Friendly staff, and a local watering hole during the week.  It can get hopping Friday and Saturday nights.

DB5mItq8csnRAMkdCEgTow.review_text: Happy Hour: Tecate in a can for $2, what can get better than that?  Tecate in a salt-rimmed can with lime for $2!  The new space can actually accommodate the work happy hour chenes crew, seats and all.

W-sq3lr18TNcfAwKjzU5Jw.review_text: I liked this bar a lot! I liked the jukebox and music selections, clean, good seating where you don't feel crammed in, good bartenders and delicious drinks. I will be back here again!

mwJEd2Pp9bFfNGo1rZ9NvA.review_text: It's like the flamboyant version of Cheers...where everyone knows your name! The bartenders are so friendly, the drinks are cheap (and strong) and the location is great. There was a  good mix of regulars, tourists and people of all age groups, backgrounds, etc. when I went there on a Friday night. Plus, they give out free popcorn. Yay!

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: This is definitely a hidden gem during happy hours.  Beyond the large, medieval doors, you'll find a cool place to chill by the fire place with barrels as tables and stools to grab a few drinks.  The place is hip with a rustic feel that gives it its charm.  More importantly, the service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  The bartender can find a drink or create a cocktail that works for just about anyone.  Parking is tough on the street.

ByUbhhZmwA01UUbfQsh1FQ.review_text: I love this place on a weeknight - it's quiet, I can have a fancy cocktail, my pick from a nice selection of scotch, or a decent beer on tap, like a Matilda which reminds me of the good ol' days drinking Goose Island in Chicago.  There's always a spot to sit and catch up with a friend or noodle in a sketchbook.  On a nice day the front windows are open, and the crowd is a bit eclectic and older.    On the weekends, I find it to be terrifying, packed to the gills with younger, hotter, clubbier people, they switch to plastic cups, and I have to shout to have a fair chance at being heard, all of which reminds me how "un-fun" I've become.

OUg0pv88vEU_5TYIprAQhQ.review_text: This place just has a great ambiance. And not until I read these reviews did I realize it was supposed to be a gay bar - whatever the crowd is, there just always seems to be a great mix of friendly people. I've taken out of town guests here to get drunk off of their AMAZING chocolate martinis and even managed to have fun there on a pretty bad date. Maybe the hot bartender helped ;)

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: Maybe it's because I've been called a lush before, but I really like the new Lush Lounge digs.  Granted, I can't recall ever going to the old digs (hence the lush name-calling), but with cool decor, a fireplace, an upstairs, and good friends, I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  Great happy hour prices, interesting happy hour drinks, and happy times with friends?  Me happy.    One suggestion?  I got the happy hour fruit bubbly drink, and it always wasn't consistent.  At one point very sweet, at one point very champagne.  I'm a fan of both, but these were dramatically different.    Consistency is easier to recommend.  I've also heard that it (specifically the music) can get incredibly loud on the weekends past a certain time.  As someone who is fast approaching my geriatric years, I like my places to have a chill vibe.  The frat sounds should remain in the marina.

vCyvUmbQkCYct6JXlmXRaQ.review_text: Chill, bring your dog and friends kind of place. Only down side... cash only. Their HH specials are decent and just remember... CASH!

SPsPMk6Q46IHFmWZbToB_Q.review_text: My friends (San Fran locals) warned me not to go in here because of the notoriously rude bartenders, but it look relatively non-crowded inside and I was looking for something a little more chill.  I should have just listened to them because sure enough one of the bartenders was straight up MEAN to me. He was taller, and thin and a brunette, I really wish I had gotten his name so I could have informed management. I ordered several rounds of shots and tipped well over 20% so I don't know where his animosity was coming from when I asked him for a Sprite to chase another round of shots with. I waited and waited and finally he grimaced at me & literally shouted in my face "DID YOU NOT SEE ME POUR THE SOAD, DID YOU NOT SEE ME, SERIOUSLY? WHY ARE YOU STANDING HERE?" I've never been spoken to like that, especially not from someone who virtually lives off tips. His rudeness ruined the entire experience. I still tipped him well though, I pitied him, honestly.

zvf5LPM7kzAd-oR31g0xxg.review_text: Amazing! Love the decor and atmosphere of this place. Dropped my id here on Friday and they mailed it back! Thanks Lush!!

3Ttx_EwurF4tVRn723SIjw.review_text: I came here for the first time yesterday during the day and I was totally digging this place!    It has lots of great energy; loud music, crazy,funky, decor dripping from every wall and hanging from every party of the ceiling, plus I liked all of the plants everywhere...I have thing for indoor foliage and I'm still trying to figure out why?  The place was pretty crowded for being the middle of the day...but then again it was 80 degrees in SF, so everywhere was pretty packed. My friend warned me of the usual clientle of older gay men that frequent this place, but if they were around, I totally didn't notice them.  Plus, I like older gay men -- they're usually quite entertaining.    We had Bellinis and Mojitos and everyone enjoyed their drinks.  Lush Lounge gets an extra star for the bartender who carded me and then with an extra-wide smile, told me I looked great for my age.  Thank you for making my day hot bartender!  Nothing like a little mid-day flirting to compliment a little mid-day drinking.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: Delicious drinks!  the thing i like about this bar is that they put time, effort, and love into their drinks. and you most likely will get some freshly squeezed juice in a drink too.

3yw_-8bYSvzm9qHcuAPyZw.review_text: Gasp!    Lush Lounge, what happened?  You have a great new space but your new clientele have been chased away by hordes of zombie clones from some marketing department.   What happened to your old clientele of the locals who live in the hood?  Polk Gulch has lost a really great bar...  And no more Apple Pie Martinis?  Why?  Those were great!  I will stop by again to chat with Artie, but it will be on a Thursday night when you are not hosting some AIG type awards banquet.  (sob)

Hbapx3tSkJc6BKH69gJzXQ.review_text: Another great night out. Can't wait to go back!

wzG6X6z0wrGGg5o__Dq8Pg.review_text: It's Sunday, 4pm - my cousin spent most of the day on the phone fighting with her man and sobbing. Finally we leave the house to search for some good eats and other general distractions in the TenderLoin. We come to the corner of Post and Polk where the jungle of indoor plants adorn the window of this small but lively TenderNob tradition. It's now 5pm and we are in need of some drinks to pass the time and heal the heart of my sad cousin. The handsome Dutch bartender fixes us the most incredible watermelon martinis at the price of $3 each, with some snacking corn too! After a round of these sweet adult slushies we are laughing and things feel normal again. Maybe it was the cheap but strong melontinis that did the trick or maybe it was the warm and inviting atmosphere of this Polk Street gem.

wG277JXe9QTuphABxnloaA.review_text: Pretty cool, i liked it.  Happy Hour is clearly posted. Wasn't too crowded on a Thursday.  The only thing holding me back from the 5 star rating is the drink selection for Happy Hour- I feel like they need another mixed drink.

zsHhLrbMCGs7PtIwgshasg.review_text: I was an attendee at the previous location. The superior lounge was the best purveyor of superior cocktails on the hill. It was not a regular stop for me as it had two primary problems, the space was very small and the clientele was a bit FIDI and low brow.     The new LUSH location has remedied both of these problems. First the location is just up the street but the size has been increased by 500%. I am quite taken with the new space. Beginning with the citadel strength doors that bar the entry portal to the two story open main room, a loft level located towards the back, a fireplace directly across from the bar. A perfect ambient level of light, dark but not so dark. The size of the room does a good job at mitigating the din.     The clientele now is a lovely mix of local color. A comfortable and welcoming balance of every gender, orientation, creed and profession. I believe the Gulch has finally found the all encompassing social hall. I fear that it will be short lived as it will no doubt be invaded by the unsavory Marina sorts, hipsters and their ilk, so I advise to enjoy while it lasts.    The cocktails remain superior, mandating fresh squeezed juices and the cocktails be hand made with craftsmanship. Considering the quality the prices are most reasonable. It pains me to write a review as I hate to put it on the map, but seeing that I no longer reside in the neighborhood and am infrequently in the hood( regrettably) I shall hope this recommendation will find its way to the eyes and ears of the sophisticated and happy socializers. Enjoy.

WxwHJRntzBg3VumBYfVhZA.review_text: Not really impressed with this place, but then again, I went on a busy Saturday night with a group of people. Just your typical "lounge"...except there really wasn't much lounging? Hardly a place to stand at the bar, let alone sit. Good beers on tap, nothing too crazy, not sure what the prices are as I did not pay. I may be back to check out happy hour but I won't be making an effort otherwise! Clean bathrooms were good...but only one handwashing sink?   GTL dude GTL

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: enter and first table at entrance a group of hipsters....skinny jeans, big oversized glasses, shirts too small, etc...hipsters, right?...fairly empty early evening...standard and wooden bar....enter a flash mob of twenty plus with a mission...a mission to drink and be foolish....pbr cheap before seven pm...hence a pbr boat race...a lush!...some spillage, human totem poles up to the second floor loft area, dancing, shots and more...bartenders cool with smirks...non-fancy great happy hour bar 'til seven pm...

kwiyfnGA7JEcl5qp2Bzqsg.review_text: I miss the trannies and older gay men and the piano area of the old location.  But I was glad to hear that the wonderful owner (who is originally from Florida, hence the groovy tropical drinks) was still the owner (at the old location he made me the best mojito I've ever had, he puts a splash of coconut milk it in!)  Somehow at this new location it's gone loud hetros on pussy/dick patrol.  One tranny in the entire bar, and I gave her a sympathy wink and smile.  A handful of aging queens, and the rest of the patrons were a bit too Marina for my taste.  But the cocktails still reign supreme.  And they are generous with the booze.  Shit wine (come on, step it up!) and some mediocre Australian faux champagne (come on, get something better!)   A few of the bar tenders were attitudinal and I'm not impressed (she says longing for the old queens from the old location)  The guy at the door was cool, yakked with him a bit, he's the apex of diplomacy which is so vital for a job like that.  I wish the owner's presence & vibe could have been felt more.  The art work in the very back, near the bathrooms is a sort of reminder of the old Lush Lounge   . . . .

TEtzbpgA2BFBrC0y0sCbfw.review_text: Polk Street has changed over the past few years and the not-so-secret word is "lines."  Lines for bars, lines for drinks and, given the influx of a particular breed of clientele, probably lines of coke off dirty toilet seats.   But hey, I don't judge.  It's only when such lines come between me and my doing of things-that-I-like-to-do-for-fun-whatever-they-­may-be do I feel a certain level of impatience. And when even local dive favorites like Hemlock start holding lines out the door, I grow a little disheartened.  Then there's Lush Lounge. With its tropical fans and pretty green plants, the bar's decor appropriately exemplifies its status to me as an oasis in Polk Street's new sea of oontz-oontz and drunken frat kids who can't let go of college. That's not to say Lush Lounge isn't packed with the occasional bro on peak nights. It is. But I never really have to wait to get inside and, once inside, I never really have to wait long to get a drink.  A bar is only as good as its staff, and, like my other local favorite bar, Koko Cocktails, Lush Lounge's expert drink crew are professional and friendly. Svetlana, in particular, is always wonderful to chat with. (Some of you may remember her as the friendly bartender from past Yelp Elite Events.) If you don't know what to order, I suggest you ask her. There is always a list of specials and she makes great recommendations.  So there you go. Decently priced drinks, a tolerable crowd and Svetlana. The faux-lush inside will thank you for it.

J52_6MJ_a9v0n2y3qv4zYA.review_text: My premise. A date. At one point I'm asked, "Well dear, what do you think of kids?" - arbitrary and benevolent I respond in force, "Sometimes when they scream, I just want to shake them till the noise falls out." And this is where I'll let you in on a hoot - three hours later we're sitting on the steps to city hall, prim and proper. "I have a kid..." she decries. Good god, I'm a boy in his late-twenties who simply didn't see this coming (incidentally it's not mine, we just met).  Rewind. We walk into this bar, tacky with decline - it's flamboyance matched only by my margarita. It was magnificent and morbid all at once... a feisty martini glass donned with an assortment of brightly coloured fruit. Her with the beer and tatted demeanor, me with the dreams of a large gay population in the tender of my grip. Sipping without a straw I make comment on the weather; polite and delusional - this is my vice. A girl to my left strikes up an unexpected conversation - an interlude to my event, I'm lost in the moment. Words are flying unabated and I can't let go of this stranger of mine.  Rude, wretched am I - the fluster reaches it's boil and I lean in for my Castro'd delight, but my mind's a mess and the bloody thing topples over with flashy decline. A crotch soaked in Casadoras, a red cherry nestled merrily below my belt buckle.  The date proper reaches over and picks it up; the b-rate movie rerun as it curls across her lips. The teeth to a bite and my arbitrary stranger became contrite. Oh, we men are a cheap delight.

D0NFmWiCFhPOiLWQmCW8MQ.review_text: I love this place.  I go there intermittently with various friends.  They are very nice.  They have free popcorn at happy hour.  If you like girly drinks, and aren't a cocktail snob, it's fab.  I love the cheap frozen fruit martinis.  I also love their mojitos which are made with love and very nice, not too sweet.  It's sort of a drag bar in that drag queens would be very comfy sipping colorful libations, and they are always showing a melodramatic movie or musical on the tvs.  If you are looking for uber trendy drinks or are a real butch manly man, this might not be the place for you.  Also the owner now has a taqueria across the street so you can order food from there.  They still weren't upset when my friend and I had burritos from someplace else.  Loves them.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: Fun stop on your night out along Polk gulch. Bring cash, cause that's what they take. Can't go wrong with a tangerine martini! Lots of plants and kitchy decor. Bar tender was friendly. Easy crowd. Looks like they're moving though...

04KTwRYw1cFu0L4EfaYajw.review_text: sometimes (ok most of the time) when i'm drunk and out with my boyfriend, i get other people's opinions on our latest fight/disagreement/relationship problem/etc. my boyfriend is not a fan of this. he hates it, actually... and usually gives me the stern "not right now" staredown. i usually cower in fright... but i was on a GOOD one when we reached the Lush Lounge the other night. subject of the night: how much my boyfriend hates the fact that i don't get home after closing the bar until 3, 4 or sometimes 5am... depending on the fact that i may go to some late night eatery to sober up.  i was with my other bartenderess and we were getting hammered as usual. all of a sudden the big, burly, black, but oh so sweet, doorman pulled up a stool next to me. i engage him into my discussion about the boyfriend hating my late hours. his simple solution to the problem to my boyfriend??? "dude, all you gotta do is lie naked in bed when she comes home. problem solved." four stars for you, big man, four stars.

76_cAOrnqPZIZKxgh19BAQ.review_text: 2 things make me really happy when it comes to bars: 1) 90s hip hop and 2) cool,specialty drinks that are not overpriced.  Lush Lounge, while a pretty small space, nails it. They play the down and dirty 90s hip hop I love and grew up listening to. Yes, the kind where you can't help but belt out the lyrics at the top of your lungs. Awesome.  Plus, they have really cool drinks. I had a blood orange cosmo and some lemon-raspberry concoction, both of which were delicious and only $7 each. You really can't beat that price.   Only downside is that you have to pay with cash, which I never seem to have on me.

NDH7N_TqW7uZPqLBuGTWqA.review_text: Strong drinks.  I recommened the bellini!  You can never go wrong with a bellini, except at Trigger.  I also had the blueberry martini, superb.  The chocolate martini was a tad too strong for me.  But great atmosphere and overall fun crowd and good looking people!

XlmXxJAd6f2H-nphBKcJmA.review_text: After starting the night at Kimo's down the street, this is the next stop!  This is a very trendy and stylish bar with great music.  It is always packed and the drinks are quite good and not too expensive.

vIdE8ehliYnu3QmH0errhg.review_text: This is a great great bar.  The mojitos are super sweet,  just the way i like them!  Fun cocktails, yummy bellinis, kitschy decor.  What more can you ask for?  I'm a fan.

ZeiM3Uspn6CUThUBt03JSw.review_text: This place was good. It was good because it wasnt completely mobbed. It was good because it felt friendly and welcoming. It was good because there was even a little eye candy. It was good because the barmen were slick, efficient, no nonsense - they poured a mean pint of Guinness. Wham. Bam. Thankyou Ma'am. Its hard to describe the clientele in here. A real mish mash. And really international. How often do you get accosted by a brummie in the toilets?  ...Talking of the male toilets, why not put the light switch in an altogether more reasonable place for a semi drunk dude to find?  [Bar #3, 8 pints down]

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: We met up with some friends here and it seemed like a nice, chill bar. I think it's a prerequisite for bars in the city to play the weirdest movies. Lush is no exception. While we were waiting for our friends to arrive, they were playing some pornographic foreign films with some added violence for good measure. Needless to say, it provided material for some interesting conversation. We didn't try any of the drinks but they did look good and they seemed reasonably priced. If you're a single guy, this would be a good place for you. We noticed the ratio of male to female was pretty unbalanced. They play decent music here too which is always a plus. Parking in the area is pretty tricky but it's definitely not a bad place to meet a few friends and enjoy some conversation. I even ran into an old friend here so it's one of those sort of neighborhood bars.

s15PZ6Wbiku18tHW3Nm8Fw.review_text: Hands up for the Lush Lounge! Definitely one of the best spots on Polk Street for bar hopping!   My friends and I started our night with a couple... er, a handful of blood orange cosmos at the Lush Lounge. Never had one before, but it was quite delish! The beautiful bartender started my tab and fixed my drink within a couple of minutes despite the crowd on a Saturday night. Love!   Half of our group was able to sit and chat while the other half crowded around the bar/dance floor for shots and to mingle. Good atmosphere! Met some really kind strangers.  Absolutely no trouble whatsoever. Love!  Caught up in the festivities, I forgot to close my tab! Luckily, the doorman and bartenders were kind enough to open the door for me and allow me up close my tab! Such a friendly staff! I was greeted with smiles and witty banter! Love!   Would definitely come back the next time I'm in town again! :)

1ajfyNyf41CxS8doHEzmfw.review_text: K: How far is this place?  D: Just three more blocks.  K: I gotta pee.  D: Me too. Let's duck in here, I've always wondered what it was like.  K: Okay.  they enter The Lush Lounge.  fun ensues. laughter is had. new castle is drank. there are not-trying-too-hard-to-be-hip-late-twenty-­somethings within. there is an equal ratio of girls to boys. the bathrooms are clean.  and their bladders were happy.

E9dFQ1qWXHXPSnyXBhJHZA.review_text: AHHH! I love you LUSH LOUNGE!!!!!  so hot so fierrrceeee just like that golden mannequin hanging from the ceiling.  fabulous bellinis, and fabulous bartenders.  Interesting crowd too.  my guy friend got invited to the bathroom around 10 times by a sauced gentleman.  we were also offered a ride on a motorcycle.    it was a good night.

V_Y2e30CvavAaA_Y63vhUw.review_text: Their drinks were quite good. But the bartender was not friendly at all. She seemed pretty arrogant. She checked our ID twice !!! Come on, there were literally under 10 people at the bar at that time, and you already forgot that we're old enough.

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: I love this place. Great mojito's and campy movies and music.  Foul play was playing when I walked into the bar to have a mojito with the Frenchman. Bartender was friendly and fun, low key place that can get crowded. But it's a fun crowd. The Frenchman insisted I order a mojito. I did and it was  refreshing. A goto  place to go after work and have a conversation. Bar is Cash only but they have an ATM there.

vk0cYG8kF1GZlMo4HQzecA.review_text: Oh, how I have spent many an afternoon and evening at the Lush Lounge. Sure, the location is kinda seedy, but it just adds character to the bar. The staff is very cool and the people are nice. I always end up meeting new and interesting people. Definitely try the frozen drinks, for usually only $6! And don't forget to ask for more popcorn!

e-Bh0XDCOgYMaC-BmdxkAQ.review_text: On a lazy Sunday afternoon this place is perfect for sipping on a Pimm's  Cup or three, pinkee finger out of course.  Muddled mint, cucumbers and orange in a tall glass of Pimm's liqueur and ginger beer.  Refreshment perfection.  Lots of raw wood, a fire place, some zen-like deco and we've got a chill spot in the hizzouse.  It's clean and cool, kinda Rat Pack meets Clint Eastwood.  If I lived in the area, I would most def be a regular.

ekaQsTZ_PlxR88xtHgZtcA.review_text: I know it's a good night when I step outside for a breath of fresh air (gets toasty inside), immediately get involved in a conversation with a cross-dresser named Alicia who, for some reason, keeps calling me Twiggy & asking if she can borrow my boobs for 20 minutes, during which time she swears she'll earn my rent and hers.  [Breathe]  Of course she follows me back inside where I introduce her to my friends, like we're the best of friends.  We drink more of the fabulous cocktails they serve here, but as usual, I can't remember most of what I tried because, well, the drinks are *really* good.  I do recall the lychee martini being excellent: not too sweet as I expected, but with a tart aftertaste.  [Insert dirty pun about cross-dressers here.]    Drinks are pricey, but delicious and strong.  Space is narrow and can get crowded.  Bathrooms smell like urine, but are otherwise decent.  Local eccentrics are friendly and gropey.  Hey Alicia!  Where's my rent $$?  You didn't borrow my boobs, but you did grab mine and my friend's.  Dunno what the going rate for that is, but it should be good for at least another drink for us to share!

0LpK7j6ToXnttE6bJKwXmA.review_text: My friend and I were lured into this cute little place last night. Of all the bars on the strip, Lush caught our eyes with its funky outside decor and frozen martini signs. Lush is small, but cozy and comfy. The decorating is excellent - black and white photos adorn the walls, and a silent film plays on the screen at top. The music was pretty nice, too -a little retro but definitley refreshing amidst the ever popular "club beatz" down the street.   It was pretty dead inside. A few regular- types, and an old man that talked our ears off about his gambling addiction and close ties with Madonna, Jack Nicholson, etc. (I'm still wondering how much of that was BS). He was eventually what got us out of the place, but we probably would have stayed. The drinks were good. Not amazing, but good. We ordered some cosmos and then some sort of vodka/lemon shot. As the bartender explained, it literally was lemons soaking in vodka. Next time, I'd like to try some of their specialty drinks.   The best part about this place was its non-threatening atmosphere. The two waiters - Chris and Jake (yes we got their names!)  - were so friendly and sweet. After we went to this bar down the street and a chick fight broke out (broken beer bottles, blood), we came back to Lush for some end-of-night comfort after the chaos. The bartenders were sweet and offered us water.  I give this place an A- for its friendly and warm atmosphere.

229wh2r28DbFsiIPm7cGuA.review_text: This bar was cool and accommodated our need for beverages on a late Monday/early Tuesday morning.  Around midnight, we wanted to find a spot to have some drinks and kick it...well Lush Lounge delivered.  The first thing that caught my fancy was this: when we stood at the bar to order drinks, the bartender looked us in the eyes and he DIDN'T IGNORE US.  Say what now?!  He won my heart.  And he made the best darn Strawberry Bourbon.  The drink was outstanding, reasonably priced, and packed a punch.  So much so, I ordered 2.  Lush also has an upper seating area, which was qqqquuuute.  Unfortunately It was roped off, but we sat near the window and had a great time.  Lemme tell you....Polk street is much more entertaining than any reality show on the market!!!  The downside: the bar only accepts cash.  But, in this day and age of bank gouging, I understand!  The upside: there is an ATM inside the bar, so you don't have to walk outside.  I heard some folks making negative comments about the area and the homeless people hanging outside of the bar.  Here's the thing: its Polk street, its Fillmore, its San Francisco...it's the world we live in.  So, tuck your gangsta' face & don't fool with me card in your coat/purse and flash them when necessary.  Go out and have a good time.  Otherwise, don't bother. #thatisall.

g7Hf2ogv4Ts6HWrR91xCNw.review_text: Great bar! Tons of random stuff on the walls, really eclectic crowd and the bartenders are cute. Overall, it's kind of hard to explain, you just have to come and experience it for yourself.

1UZsiz3iPfsculeik1V_0A.review_text: Chris is great! We had our engagement party there and reserved the upper level. He was responsive, accommodating and easy to work with. Sometimes he can be a little slow responding to email. He allowed up to cater food there at no charge, we had set-up time and space and he also provided tables. He provided us with a ticketing system and let me know when I reached my limit for the night, again very accommodating with the value of tickets, coordination, etc.  He is an honest guy...House specialty drinks were good....Ambient is great..cozy space. Only critic I have of the place is seems I didn't hear the music well, maybe they forgot to turn it up...Overall great experience.

nQG7XkgrsG4MXXXfexJwAA.review_text: Really liked this place.  Not very big, but a great open and inviting vibe.  Met some interesting eclectic people there - it felt like two sitcoms crashing together, Big Bang Theory and (short lived) Class.  Music had a good mix of some 80's gems.

z-oO1tVXUwLt8G1NDZwWDQ.review_text: This is another one of my favorite bars on Polk St.   it's very cozy, but still very fun. They have a nice warm fire going at night and it's a good place to grab some drinks with friends (and actually be able to carry on a conversation with them).  Their Blueberry Martinis are to DIE for. They're delicious. And they also serve a Mel Gibson: A Tecate, a shot of Well Whiskey, and a racial slur.  Great bar.  CASH ONLY

WzwXpdsIMhqw03Bf4hcPow.review_text: This really is a great place on polk street with a very friendly happy hour-ish vibe and a great mix of people. The prices are fair and they really have great bartender service that is as fast as it gets.   They only accept cash so no credit cards. I recommend this place to locals and out of towners alike. It won't disappoint.

AjQBHxRdjvgJYnZPstasKQ.review_text: What's to like ? Douche bag bartenders with no personality. I heard this place was a cool bar prior. Pity they closed and changed it. Total fucking losers working here. Strictly for the marina type jocks

r6AKmjDkCo_umRI51lWICQ.review_text: This place is slowly becoming one of my favs...I say slowly cuz its too small. I like the crowed, great drinks and laid back oh ya the music is awesome too! what else do you want?! oh yya its COZY!!! real cute!

9NJpnD-nt4GvurQqYkEF7Q.review_text: I recently went here for a friends bday, and was less than impressed. We happen to be here on a night that was very busy, which was unfortuante b/c this place might be cool on a random week night.   The selection of alcohol and beer was solid, my boyfriend was happy with all the bourbons they carried. However, the bartenders were horrible. My gin gimlet on the rocks was made different everytime I ordered it, and never was made correctly. Also, the prices were different every time we ordered, like the price was at the whim of whatever bartender we could flag down.   The place was way to noisy, the music was loud, and it was near impossible to carry on a conversation without screaming. I don't mid loud music, at a club where people are dancing, but not in a bar/lounge scene. No one was very friendly, and everyone was in a bad mood from constantly getting bumped.  There are just too many cool places in SF to go here again....

aREzu8wiB_1NYMzi_TgN0A.review_text: Came to this lounge after dinner. Great vibes and great energy. Even though, this place is decked out with strange pieces of collections, a black/white movie that was playing on the tv on top of the bar-that I didn't know what was playing while a guy at the bar asks me about the movie...and I had no idea what he was talking about...nodded and smiled. Either way, I enjoyed this place so. CASH only but drinks are stiff. So, don't worry....you'll get your money's worth. Stand there a bit, then if you want to mingle with the crowd, you can. I love that it wasn't the stuck up crowd, or the typical bar crowd, or the typical club crowd, it was crowd in between. Thanks Lush Lounge for turning the "in between" crowd to lushes! lol...We had fun!

JdcEj9YlyQY8RvTdyFXJPQ.review_text: Came here with a gaggle of girlfriends before seeing Sex & the City on Van Ness. They had Cosmos for cheap, so it seemed appropriate. Also some frozen concoctions on tap that weren't delicious but were totally drinkable and cheap! They didn't have any problem with us bringing in outside food. Relaxed vibe. Conveniently located around the corner from stripper shoe stores, so you can multi-task, if that's your thing.

pyDVrFUhzHF6IEfw2Qi9MQ.review_text: This is one of my go-to bars in San Francisco. The mezzanine is the best (when it's open) and the bartenders are great.   They have a lot of custom cocktails and speciality drinks which is really nice as well.   Avoid the place on a Friday or Saturday night when the crowd (and all of Polk street for that matter) turns from casual to a bunch of kids wanting Fireball shots.

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: The BF loves this place, I prefer places with dancing but as far as Lounge's go this one has decent drinks and it's not so loud you can't hear each other. Bonus points for having relatively clean bathrooms. As in I do not fear getting any diseases when I have to use the facilities.

vL3tIltZWmahKl77sKwkoA.review_text: Eh, it's a cool place to just hang, chill, talk. NOT intended for a girls night out if you want to get down and buck wild, haha! Not a bad night though, just got one drink for all the girls and left to get down, get down.  - Not too much of a line, got in quickly after 11:30pm - Slide ID before entrance, so if you're not fond of that. Hm, don't know how to help you there. - Was super crowded, no seats. - Music was super lame, mixture of retail and elevator music, with a little bit of trance - No one was really dancing - Drinks were decently priced, bartenders were cool. - Cash only bro

Gq5D1V5jwrYPpOxfwM5lag.review_text: I love their happy hour frozen watermelon margarita specials! Sip your drink and admire the Judy Garland wall decorations. The bartenders are hot and friendly. An interesting tenderloin stop- especially if you're headed to Divas down the block.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Lush and I go back a ways when my friend Carlos used to take me to the old, more compact location down the street to get the Lemon Drops. He liked chatting it up with one of the bartenders while we both got sloshed. I know from taking the 19 all the time that Lush moved up Polk to bigger digs with a fireplace and an upstairs area. It's like an episode of "House Hunters" where the bickering young couple is staying with her parents in her girlhood room as they shop for a house with four walk-in closets and twin sinks in the master suite. Well, Lush obviously found their true north with this far more relaxing industrial-cool spot (photo: bit.ly/1eQXwYo). I came with Jamie W. this time before doing our regular pastrami run at Miller's East Coast Deli. It was a holiday weekend, so we figured the popular bars would be empty. Wanting to wet our whistles, I flashed back to the good times I had at the old Lush and was happy to discover the new place keeps the same convivial vibe. Oh wait, maybe I was the old lush, but I can be the new lush, too, right? It was Happy Hour, and we were already late since it starts at 3PM. The Lemon Drop wasn't on the list, but other temptations compensated. Jamie went for the tantalizing $6 Don Q Mojito evoking Havana nights he's never had (photo: bit.ly/1c2wmxL). I went predictable and ordered the $5 Blueberry Martini (photo: bit.ly/1bLfVvs). Ah, their fruity martini cocktails are still addictively tasty. Yes, we had another round. And that pastrami sure tasted good after that. COCKTAILS - 4 stars...they still make those refreshing martini drinks, don't they? AMBIANCE - 4 stars...far more spacious than the former spot with enough dim lighting that you don't notice the hipster quotient...much SERVICE - 4 stars...genuinely friendly and dexterous with a shaker (photo: bit.ly/1e6V4Nj) TOTAL - 4 stars...still holds up as a favorite watering hole with the $5-6 Happy Hour libations a major draw on quiet three-day weekends

ZpE3x2SerjBqYGcKr0HJWw.review_text: Seating and sangria. Works for me.

cKmh3yWeADbvKqkZqo0ECw.review_text: Spontaneous Monday night. Not bad for a weekday.

aVIp7GqkB-xE2oByrsev7Q.review_text: This place is even BETTER when its not busy. Their happy hours are pretty legit. There are lots of drinks that they offer and all sound and taste delicious!   The sweet tea vodka drink: It wasn't on the happy hour menu, but it is happy hour price: ask the bartender if you are interested. Sweet, not super alcoholic and comes in those cool glass jars  Agave Margarita: strong! lots of salt and fresh lime Mojito: delicious! One of my favorites: you can taste the fresh mint leaves and they give a good portion of alcohol.  Cucumber gimlet: tasty but has a strong alcohol taste   Con: felt like they put more ice than drink in the cups.   Tables along the windows are WEIRD. They are placed very far away from the chairs. But other than that, it was  warm, cozy, chill and fun.

pfIv1WLD3ED_K-JDr2hT6A.review_text: Lush Lounge is not a place that is generally my scene, but the drinks were good, the bar tenders friendly (one went out of his way to bring me back my sweater that fell on the floor) and though crowded, it wasn't too bad. I got the sense that it's a very popular place for singles. Cash only, but there's an ATM in the bar.

LSQsSMYUdxPs8VXFeYThyQ.review_text: Very nice.  I like this place but I wished it wasn't cash only and so expensive. I dropped 60 on drinks, felt pretty steep for not enough buzz.. Crowd is cool. Seating is ok. No dance floor. Decent diversity. I love the pizza joints around the area. Perfect for late night eats after a belly full of alcohol.

eZXLjt0MQL5PYqcrJWV0Hg.review_text: It's my favorite place to grab a drink.  I've been going here for years.  The bartenders are cute and friendly.  They really know how to make a good drink.  Besides, how can you go wrong with $3 frozen cosmos/martinis.   I love all the kitchy stuff hanging on the walls.  I always notice something I haven't seen before.  They also have a great selection of movies that play on the tv.  Sometimes they'll even have popcorn.  You can meet all sorts of cool people here.  It's one of those places you go to, and you're always glad you went.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: After Upcider, we decided to head out to another bar but wasn't sure where to go. We decided to check out Lush Lounge.   The vibe seems to be pretty fun and the drinks were well made. They have a cool upstairs area for people to hang out and have the windows open to keep you cool.   Overall Thoughts  I wouldn't mind coming back to the Lush Lounge if I was in the area

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: i used to pass by the old lush lounge spot all the time since my gym was a block away. i was never able to check it out. i was probably missing out because the new location looks awesome. it's very spacious, with a large downstairs bar-area, and a sizeable balcony area.   the decor is very cool and the staff was very friendly. the bartenders were cool and they made some pretty stiff vodka-soda's. prices are decent, even at non-happy hour times. the place was packed and the scene definitely looked good.  i think this is definitely a go-to spot in the polk district. my only complaint was that they carded me at the bar even though they already have a big-ass bouncer doing that at the front door.

iqmkrOQYGIyxhi4tW_dhMA.review_text: Friends and I went here after dinner on Thursday night.  What a great space.  The male bartenders were very friendly and generous, but the female bartender was bitchy at best and made crappy drinks! We'll definitely be back, but only will approach the male tenders!!!

r9UsGsLdDoTpsGxY6ln4WQ.review_text: This used to be one of my favorite bars. But during my first visit to the new location they were playing the movie Y tu mamá también. I thought the 3-way (two men, one woman) sex scene was too much to be shown at a public bar. When I complained to the owner, he harassed me via text, email, and voicemail by telling me "get yourself a big fucking life." I have reported him and the bar to the Better Business Bureau.

Vp14grGEIvYzmrsOdix4UQ.review_text: Been to Lush a couple of times now and it definitely does the trick for the loud, bar crawl kind of night. It's your average Polk St. bar, if larger and with a more memorable restroom arrangement (the sinks are pretty cool, though I wish they had more wc's being such a large place). For whatever reason, it always ends up being the last place I go to during a (unexpected or otherwise) crawl, so my memory of it may be somewhat impaired, but in general I think it's just one of those places that always seems sufficiently crowded to get you (or keep you...) in the party mood, yet roomy enough that it's not suffocating. It's a tad exhausting though, which may be why it's always the last stop. Eh, I have mixed feelings. In any case, I hate the cash-only policy, so that'll probably keep me away for a while.

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: What a great little find!  This bar is bright and welcoming. I loved the lights hanging from the ceiling and the various tasty martinis for under $7.  Our faves: cantaloupe martini and "the cable car."

WwTYfD8TysD1isAEhSEOoA.review_text: I don't drink alcohol, so I can't comment on the drinks.  A friend rented the second floor for his birthday party, so I went and was pleasantly surprised.    First, everyone was friendly from start to finish.  When I told the ID checker I was here for a birthday party, he asked for my friend's last name so he could more easily direct others arriving after me.  On the way out, I asked the security guard for bus directions.  He saved my night by telling me exactly where to go.  Had I not asked him, I would have ended up on the wrong side of the street and missed the last Caltrain at 12:01AM.    Second, the bartenders didn't dally after I made eye contact.  I usually tip a dollar a drink, and they seemed fine with that.  (I was buying drinks for my friends.)  They also smiled when my friend made a joke: "The strawberry fizz [a girly drink] is for him," she said.    Third, the location is convenient.  There's a bus stop right outside the bar, and plenty more on Van Ness, which is one block up.  As of July 2013, the #47 on Van Ness goes to the Caltrain station on 4th and King, and if you're heading back, you want to make sure you cross the street on Van Ness.    Two final points: 1) I arrived at 9:45PM on a Saturday night, and the bar wasn't busy.  It seems like more people started showing up at around 10:10PM.  By 11:20PM, the place was packed; 2) in case you're wondering, this is not a bar where people dance (at least not when I was there).  There is music--I heard Michael Jackson's ABC and recognized a few other songs--but the place gets so busy at night, people don't have space to dance.

2ZLYtANvx39tffYRV9Khag.review_text: not a bad place for a drink.  Last i remember, they had some hot wimmin bartenders.

gfBdQ3JHBuktSm6BiPi7tw.review_text: The most varietal martinis ever.  The scene (being the Tenderloin) on the street can be quite entertaiing at times.  Friendly folk and a great atmosphere.  You just wanna kick back a few and enjoy what comes next!

Rq1oxDRH1g82hrBUI4_1xg.review_text: They literally scam you here at night. The drink glasses shrink from a pint, to 12 oz, to 8 oz over the course of the night with no price change and no warning. We lined up our empties after we got suspicious and sure enough! Terrible.

1w3brs6DYDuWbvSYFkzvPg.review_text: The mango martini I had was delicious!! Weird crowd--but I had already been drinking quite a bit soooo may have to amend this when/if I go again--but alright for what it was.

SYczrI2m6euXJn7_SmcOjA.review_text: My brother and I would stop by LL for a nightcap before going back to our hotel {The Opal} after a night on the town. This was 5 yrs ago. Loved the fresh  squeezed juices for cocktails done with a strong arm. My brother loved the Manhattans, delicious cold and up. Steve was the owner then, is he still there? If so tell him Larry and Kevin say hello!

0MKQCTNjIdqSqLXglHkUBQ.review_text: I've only been here for Happy Hour. I'm talking 3 ish till about 7 (ish.)  The HH specials are the tops. If you don't get the $6 cucumber gimlet, you lose. I know enough to understand that venues don't put candy everyone wants on sale. They push the stuff they need to sell. But the cucumber gim looks as good as it tastes. I took pictures of the frothy green goodness and everyone in my social network was perving it. I mean... making people think your cocktails are better than theirs is always a good time.

Me0nZrqjWtRNvlH2mV50vQ.review_text: I LOVE THIS BAR! I wish it was located in LA. They play the BEST jukebox music and they have drink specials. The night I went was $7 patron shots along with their special cocktails. The place is a little small, but it's cute and has plants in there.   We went around 11ish and it started to get crowded. There's no cover charge and i just adore this place!!  NOTE - IT'S A CASH ONLY BAR.

GJDLiiiq81bPY9aY4Amfgg.review_text: It was OK. The scenery and look and feel were nice. We were there on a Sunday so it wasn't too crowded.   For gays, it's very friendly and there were a few gay couples there.  For Straight, you can come too. it's nice and open friendly atmosphere.  CASH ONLY but they have an ATM.  The bartender made me a white russian that was mostly cream. I asked for more vodka and he didn't look happy about that. The white russian was weak, ok?  Overall, not so bad. Drinks were more than I wanted to pay but the location was good and was a good after dinner drinking place with friends.

YzAdXapcYBiA-Xv24lxiYg.review_text: Trendy atmosphere with decent drinks. I got a standard Belvedere martini which was good. A friend asked for the bartender's specialty and got a blueberry martini which tasted like a frozen fruit pop. The crowd was older (over 25) and chill. I'd probably opt for Blur down the road instead.

4EsgOC9DjcNF15KaYSVo3g.review_text: Your neighborhood type of bar... I was reminded of this place when we went last weekend. It's been ages since the last... I suddenly remembered how much I like this place. It's a great place to go to when you want to be out for a couple of drinks but you aren't in the mood for anything high profile or anything too divey. Its lively enough with a very interesting and diverse crowd but not too crowded and not too dead. Just right. I like that it has window views of the street to let the outside activity liven the place up - I hate it when some bars you walk into are all walls... I feel super claustrophobic.... Its a great place to just chat with a group of friends over drinks - a night-ender... also if you like old music like me, they play goodies from the 80s and 90s... Hello Journey and Boston and Hall and Oates....

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: i went to this bar for the second time the other night - had a blast!  luckily we got seats at the bar (rad) and we tried some of their special drinks.  great mojitos, and the special was a frozen watermelon cosmo... yum!  any drink that comes with a cherry is a friend of mine.  they were playing awesome music too - lots of oldies and songs that you know.  i will definitely go back!

SxGwmJQ93lK_hgXEAVQ1pw.review_text: Made a stop here while barhopping for my friend's birthday this past weekend.  Has that dive bar charm with adequate space for both sitting and standing.  Seems like it would be a chill place to grab drinks with a friend on a weeknight.  They have an upstairs area, looked like it was being used for a private event the night we went.  One thing I will say is stick to beer if you're not staying long or have other stops planned for the night.  The hard stuff is a little pricey, and the blonde bartender seems to have issues with mixed drink proportions.

bW2LMBS-D-qAgXfpeof3UQ.review_text: Nice big space from the old Lush Lounge. Its nice and the bathrooms are unisex. Cocktails are really good and so are the bartenders.  Still one of my favorite places to go when I'm wandering around Polk St. Prices aren't too bad....wish it was a bit less. I wouldn't call this place a dive because it is still classy.  Its in between a dive and a sheeshy place.  But I love its a diverse crowd and fun on weekends and even at happy hour!

RDTVzWPoCeGaUujrHIWRBQ.review_text: Started a Friday night Polk Street crawl at Lush Lounge.  Very chill spot with a lot of seating (for a bar).  The bar area was very open, and we were able to get drinks quickly.  Loved the drink specials - beer and shot of whiskey for $5, my favorite!  Don't really remember the music, must not have been very impressionable.  All-in-all, a lounge-y spot that's solid for the start of a long night of drinking.  I can't speak for the late night scene, but chances are good that I'll eventually be back.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text: Great party place on Polk!  The decor is cool with old singers & performers pics on display... even a glittering gold mannequin hanging from the ceiling to bring you back to the "good ol' days".  They keep it "lush" with plenty of plants and people to drink their stiff yet tasty concoctions.  It's also in a good hood, with an array of places to continue the party nearby.  When you want to chill in a diverse SF hood, lush it up at this spot : )

g-tLFP3oghOGDWIIngMwZw.review_text: Went on a Tuesday night. Great drinks, reasonably priced. Easily smashed on an agave margherita and a couple of yummy blueberry martinis (includes real blueberry)!  Good crowd, nice upstairs area, friendly bar staff. Not sure if it was just the night we went or if it's every night - but weird music choices going on. From feet thumping pop rock to growly metal playing. Added to the fun though.

xBcNPTcCigOS4We-4ZIHqw.review_text: Its beautiful inside and clean. The drinks are nothing special, pretty average in that area and everyone who works there is an asshole. The end.

sTW0gS1reTlPhrZYCDKH7A.review_text: One of the main bars on Polk, but it was not super great. The bouncers were a bit unfriendly and rude, and it gets super packed here (good for the bar but not when I'm sober, hah). Probably won't be back. Music wasn't that great either. McTeague and Mayes (has cover) is definitely a better choice if you do come around, but this place is free cover so that's a plus!

cE9eOpb_FL2xamtzsUua0w.review_text: I've been going to Lush for a few years. I was devastated when they closed for their move. And of course, I had to go there a little after they re-opened at this new (current) location. It's great. Loads of room, a completely different crowd though than before at happy hour. Same great bartenders. Although to be honest, there's one that I avoid because he puts too much mixer and seriously not enough alcohol into drinks. Sami and Svetlana are still there, and Sami is there for Friday happy hours. Besides the fact that he's a cutie, he makes some of the best drinks around! The new location doesn't have the red bathroom, the frozen martinis, the popcorn, or the golden mannequin (sp?), but they don't really lack anything. The atmosphere is great, the drinks are devine, and the staff is spectacular.  I've brought at least a dozen friends here, and they keep coming back and brining new people. It's one of those places you'll never forget, and will keep dreaming about those delicious, -- and when it comes to the Almond Joy martini that Sami makes-- orgasmic martinis, you'll keep coming back.

GqAWZId7sUGylHljDFbe2A.review_text: i would have done four stars but i could not take the decor, marilyn, audrey, cliche, be original.  awesome bartender and strong drinks.  my friend and i did a lemon drop shot and i asked for water as a chaser, the bartender said NO and gave me a lemon.  I LOVE HIM.  if i go back i'll just close my eyes.

4IeiFWz7axqliFZmcJTvxQ.review_text: Amazing Mojotos! 'nuff said??  This is a great place for an "I'm too old to rock it like I'm 21 but don't want to accept that my friends are getting married, procreating and being role models" birthday party.
