You can reserve a space for an event through Lush Lounge.  FYI: The bar is cash only.

BO34VdtNW0F70RxD8NHDmA.review_text: I happened to stumble into this bar last night with a friend on our way back to her apt,  I can't really remember why we went into it in the first place.  Oh yea it was a Sunday night and bev mo was closed and we couldn't wait until we got back to have another drink, or maybe we had to pee too.    Anyways it was a slower night but there were people scattered around so it wasn't awkward.  We just had a beer and bolted.  But I'm pretty sure the first time I went here i had some specialty drink and it was pretty darn good.  A good spot for a quick drink if you are waiting for a movie or even a nice meet up spot with good music but not too loud so you can't hear yourself talk.

Lb37hatAjI3fgHEh2lMNEw.review_text: Came here on Cinco de Mayo, so a bit of a delayed review. I enjoy the atmosphere here (the upstairs/downstairs separation makes the place feel really big.) We were drawn in by sangria specials and probably had 2 or 3 too many, but boy was it tasty! I'll be sure to come back soon so I can write a better review.  I wasn't put off by the crowd here, unlike most other bars around Polk. I think that means a lot.  Come here after padding your stomach out with some kebabs / imperial rolls at Cordon Bleu! :)

zXi8WzXV2lfefnnzPEnOOw.review_text: I was never that crazy about the old lush. Overpriced, cramped, semi-friendly service. But the new spot is straight pimp. The entrance is akin to a Scottish castle and inside the space is intimate, cozy and dare I say romantic. Then again I was was with the amazingly sexy Bradley P. and the wine and conversation reminded me of the week we spent staring into each others eyes in a chateau in Switzerland. Okay... snapping out of that, the bartenders seem to be alot more polished and professional and the overall improvement to this business is a 180 degree turnaround. A great date spot or even a good spot to pop some vicodin, sit by the fire and reminisce on hot Swiss nights.   Hot Swiss Nights... Can I trademark that?

f9OfU45vXjiwtdGAttXGiA.review_text: how can you not fall in love with any bar that lies within a neighborhood called the tender nob? alright, that's the tourist in me talking, but i definitely got a laugh out of it.  loved, loved, LOVED the inside of this place. super high ceilings, tons of plants, a warm red glow and knick knackies all over that somehow managed to avoid the bennigan's/tji friday's feel.  the bartender wasn't the speediest in the world, but the cocktails were tasty, the crowd was super low key and the seats were plentiful.

FkiDKAYGGNIPQVdMe4JEXQ.review_text: Lush Lounge was one of the first places I ever went to in SF. I still love it to this day. I guess you can say I'm a regular (anyone who can walk into a bar and be told "oh no here comes trouble" while they hastily make a drink for you is a regular). The bartenders are fabulous in every sense of the word. Last  time I went there on a crappy date (we're talking a HORRIBLE date but I do digress) one of the bartenders conspired with me and he sweetly asked said date to leave. As soon as tacky boy left I got a sympathy drink on the house. Love it! Another great story involves my friend Kat. She and I were there getting our drink on one busy Saturday night when she had to use the bathroom. She went and came running back out. She called to Rami (the bartender on duty) and explained there was no TP. He stopped what he was doing to dash downstairs and bring her a fresh roll apologizing for the inconvience. How do you not love it when your bartender cares? The bloody Mary is tomato juice with the produce aisle attached to it. Anything out of their little "black book" of drinks is usually reasonably priced and tasty! It's a place with no pretenses; you can usually have a bar buddy within a few minutes of coming in (even if you came by yourself) and have at least one satisfying conversation. People watching here is great! The movies and music playing are usually stuff you like anyway (and fun to zone out to). All in all if you find yourself near Post and Polk do go.

0Od3PvCzzVfbX-RDR7G1rA.review_text: Never had probs here simply because I am straight, as other reviewers have mentioned...? This is the bar I always end up at after racking my brain trying to think of a new bar to try...simply because I think it is good to try new places. Well, I guess with an old standby like the Lush Lounge I don't have to try the newest or hippest places. This place is kind of a throwback, a mish-mash of eras in one space and there is always 80s music playing. The cocktails are froofy and fun, so who cares if they are not super sophisticated? They always seem to have a drink special. Last time I was there there were Lemon Drops all night for $5. I like the Cactus Berry Margarita becasue they give you this big honkin fruit stick thing with it. Yum. The crowd is a mix, which I like, and is always pretty laid-back and friendly. BONUS: You can watch the 'ladies' working the street in front of Divas tranny club across Post. A goldmine of observation.

f2PvxaRfZ3c0vJm4Q0rJTA.review_text: This place was fun but it was way too crowded. If it had 15 fewer people it would have been great.

9KjYINEKP5f7_6ubcHwDxQ.review_text: Watching the sunday night football game here. Really cool spot, dive bar atmosphere but with a lot of space. The drinks here are good and the free popcorn is pretty cool too!

FjTssJowYPc8dbUX1p7McQ.review_text: Dropped in one night about two months ago while I was on vacation. Affordable and expertly made mixology-oriented cocktails. I had a ginger-cucumber gimlet (wasn't available with gin, only a house vodka infusion) that was fantastic as well as a delicious sazerac. Will be sure to drop by again later this month.  The only cons I can think of are the cash-only business and that the music was a little overbearing the night I was there.

c4bNOJ5XnKKoHJoQE4zrcQ.review_text: Was not sure what to expect when someone invited me here for happy hour. Its a GREAT neighborhood bar with amazing happy hour specials! Casual, nice bartenders, not snobby but they make great drinks! I appreciate the extensive cocktail list for HH. BRING CASH!

5v6juPIOisfmogp7QSso-A.review_text: Happy hour two for one deal is pretty sweet.

YHV4HKDoVAear1EcH1F_GA.review_text: I just had the best experience at this bar a couple of nights ago! Not only were my drinks delicious, the bartender gave me a few for freeeee!!! Plus he was extremely friendly and sociable. We were also able to seat 4 of us easily at the bar. I seriously love this place. I can't get over how little they charge for such delicious drinks. I have to recommend their mojitos. Just give it a try. You won't be disappointed!!!

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: When I'd recommend "Lush Lounge" to friends, they'd automatically assumed this was a douchey, Marina-esque bar. But don't let the name fool you. Lush is not your typical bar. It's a bar that's over-the-top everything. From their hanging plants, vinyl records and framed pictures that cover the walls (let's not mention a flying mannequin!?) to their unique drink concoctions, Lush Lounge is a one of a kind find. It's also a bar that attracts the most interesting crowd: college students from USF, senior citizens, dogs?, trannies from the TL and Polk street bar dwellers. So if you're that easily distracted / entertained, people watcher type of drunk, Lush Lounge is a MUST to get lush at.

Jlw_zb6Ga2greiZ1VjpJdw.review_text: Probably caught the bartenders at a bad night. Watermelon shooters were pretty nasty.

vKJ8-9LRu66BEqH0b8DWlw.review_text: the drinks are very tasty. and the place is very tiny. tons of stuff to look at on the walls. i dig it.

_5UOy92raGpnas-84FttFg.review_text: Apart from the shockingly stunning bar staff that work here, the awesome and ever so entertaining location, the super-cool public bathrooms, the all night happy hour cocktail special (ok why did I list the toilet before that..?) and the awe-inspiring decoration complete with framed quotes from all your favorite 1940's movie legends: This place ROCKS!! And I so very rarely use all uppercase like that.  Let your hair down after work one night, this corner location with surrounding windows on either side provides the perfect setting. It's the most open minded 'gay bar' in the whole world! It's just so great to see so many liberal Californians mixing and mingling with us gay fellows. Close minded suppressive republicans are not welcome (well, not officially but I would imagine the lack of biblical references may be somewhat underwhelming) - It would be like that day I accidentally walked into Walmart, I shudder...

J3GhokDy-I4GHvpHebc-Eg.review_text: The chocolate martinis at this bar really are great.  The space is small but the interior is cozy and welcoming.  Have to agree with others that the drinks seemed pricey - even if the bartender did give me a cherry/blueberry drink skewer- yum.

ivG4VgMLNGf_wF1CIA1-Ww.review_text: Update:  So i have been back since this post and I do now see what everyone is talking about.  Shows you how much I care about that, gay not gay who gives a fly rats a$$.  The place is cool, the drinks are stiff, and the prices are right.  The people watching is also priceless.   OK Im a straight dude that has been oing here for sometime for the cheap martini's and crowd watching.   I must be ABSOLUTELY blind because I haven't noticed the gay thing that everyone talks about.  There is a transgender bar across the street (DIVA) but never notice them in there.  I must just be completely faced by theh time they role in.  I go here to people watch and get wasted.  The drinks are stiff and the specials aren't.  The prices are fair and the crowd is priceless.  This is the place the XYZ crowd wish they could hang out at but are too busy trying to be ULTRA-cool to leave the pack.   I've never picked up a broad here but thats probably because I am busy making crazy oogulie eyes at them or referring to them as broads.   Don't bring a date here on the weekends unless you like to people watch together and don't mind screaming at them.

Qi_xP8C_2xo7MY4rmP_c3Q.review_text: The New Old Lush Lounge!!!! OPEN NOW OK the bar looks great, love the booths and all the chairs. I really love the big window and fireplace (great choice). And the drinks well great!!!!!!!!!!!! But that large table is to close to the bar, when people are siting at the bar and table you can't get past ( and the guy I was sitting across from said his knees kept getting hit and beer was spilling - sad- he was just trying to watch TV). Plus put some chairs or tables in front of the great fireplace of yours ( standing with no table, well it's just weird).  Overall a great new old start for the Lush Lounge!!!!

4wOcvMLtU6a9Lslggq74Vg.review_text: Good music, decent drinks, and but it seems to be too small to hold as many people as they stack in there. Aside from that, its not very lounge-y as there isn't really anywhere to sit either.

Q_TFz4TsVj_Qgb1akllpVQ.review_text: OMG, for months i thought that Lush had closed.  Then a friend informed me that it had just moved up the street.  Phew!!!! The current located is awesome, tons of space, great lighting and as with the previous space awesome drinks!!  I love the natural wood tables.  My favorite drink here has to be their sangria and second would be the sweet tea drink.  As for the scene,  it's younger.  Makes sense, since it's located on Polk.  But the crowd isn't too obnoxious, which can't be said of some of the surrounding establishments.    While at Lush, You might see the owner's dog hanging around below the seats.   Cosmo's his name and he's a cutie!!   If you're in need of a good drink and  a venue with fun vibe, head on over Lush!  They just might make you blush with their drinks!!

7LtaYnxq1f8in3k49KHe1Q.review_text: Wonderful, can't beat em, seriously good Mojitos.  The atmosphere is fun (in an entirely Asia SF on hard drugs kinda way), which can get a little tiring after a while. And the cash only, somewhat expensive drinks, mean you gotta carry some cash in (or use the expensive ATM there).

CTG_s8IKKI6CtVyBbV_DAw.review_text: The location's changed and so has the sweet taste of their lemon drops.  I miss the more low key place it used to be =(

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: This place is divey and dark in all the right ways. Its good for groups and the drink specials are very nice considering they even apply on weekends (which like never happens).  I love the big window where you can sit and watch the crazies pass by. All in all a great ghetto placed bar.

Wjl73qDBmUlbuTWcJ-gpCA.review_text: Someone described this bar as "The Girly Drink Mecca of San Francisco" so I guess I was in touch with my inner girly self the evening I went to this place. If you're up for a strangely wonderful happy hour, get your butt over to Lush Lounge. This place is small but so cool and friendly. It's DIVERSE with a capital D. What a great people-watching bar. I was with two friends who hadn't been there before, and the woman in our group went a little ga-ga for Sami the bartender. He's middle-eastern and Italian and a lot of fun. Also fast and smart with a big smile and good vibes. We were feeling pretty fubu as I said above so we all had the watermelon frozen martini. Wowsa, what a tasty drink.  Thanks to the Lush Lounge and Sami.  It's a cool place for sure.  Note: I haven't been to the new Lush Lounge location up Polk Street, so I'm wondering what's happening there. I'm reading some of the more recent reviews. I'll let you all know when I visit there.

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: The new Lush Lounge is going to make it hard for me to drink less. I really like this space. By really like, I mean I'd really like to move in and make it home. Big and spacious, with a lofted space up top (when you're rolling 30 deep like we tend to do, a private space is instrumental in keeping the tribe herded together), it's kind of like they inflated 80 Proof and moved it to Polk Gulch.   The bar staff are excellent. By excellent, I mean they'll make you a good cocktail and won't ask you (me) to leave if you happen to slap one of the cute ones on the ass. Drinks are a little pricey and it can get a little crowded, but I'm still down.  Great spot for an impromptu party or after-work drinks. Fan. Like. Drink.

5xFkiPEarQUZMbUcJYz8Rg.review_text:
And a Lush is what I will be if I continue to hang out with this crowd (yelp..er...gulp)
  nice bar ~ good tenders ~ tasty drinks ~ too crowded?

49aCB1D8ga70-57ZR7KhjA.review_text: This place is a good scene, although I wouldn't say it's my first choice when going out on Polk St.  I do like that this place is roomy, so the crowds of people aren't too overwhelming, and they make a great drink with sweet tea vodka.  I'm not sure if this is standard there, but when I was there the bar was cash only, and I was not a fan of that. The music they play is awesome though!

-h3OxE2YbWzFXVkBhYtJTw.review_text: This lounge is great; the drinks that we had (of course had to try some different martini's since we were in SF) were awesome! Being a dog lover, I thought the fact that the owners had their dogs in the bar and they were just chilling there with the guests, was awesome! The atmosphere was very inviting and warm, the bartender was very knowledgeable about the drinks and service was prompt

7Mf3tWblh1618nIem_aLNg.review_text: Great new location, wonderful ambiance. If you like cosmos, this one is most fabulous! A nice venue on Polk Street!

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: It's a chill place if:  You like $3 beers.   Or you know, you're cold, because their fire place is really nice.

dHnhtiMurxY1_qPHWsOeFw.review_text: I think my review is a bit higher than I think I would have done simply for the fact that I'm nostalgic for the "old" Lush Lounge when it was on the corner of Polk and Post.  I was never a bar person to begin with so when an old boyfriend introduced me to the Lush Lounge, it was love at first sip.    The drinks were spectacular and was matched in its fabulosity by the bar patrons.  A mix of older gay men, trannies, rent boys, heteros and homos in all shapes, sizes, and color.  Last night I took some friends visiting from England to the new location and I just knew it was going to be different.  Right off the bat through the door the vibe was different.  More Marina types than any other in the whole room.  Gay patrons yes, but the crazy mix of people I loved was gone.  Instead of the old black and white films playing on the flatscreen, they were instead playing "Saw."  This is definitely not your father's Lush Lounge.  The drink I ordered, a Bellini, was in a smaller glass instead of the tall champagne glass of old.  Sigh.  It still, however, tasted wonderful.    They say all good things must come to an end.  And sadly for all of us that miss the old Lush Lounge, this is very true.

zp2NxN0q4PafBPgE2c8LSg.review_text: This lounge was real crowded on a Saturday night.  I guess that's the point right?  Well, I thought it would be a more chill bar, but i guess not.  The drinks were cheap and yummy, but it was an adventure to get there. People didn't know how to move...or was it that they were too busy making out with each other? There were like two different hardcore duos lip-locking it up.  Also, this one guy stripped down to his undies and followed a girl out.    Maybe I'm not hip to the single and ready to mingle scene, but all i wanted to do was have a drink and celebrate a friend's birthday. Maybe I'll go again.

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: I think the happy hour reflects the name of Lush Lounge. $4 glasses of champagne, $6 cucumber gin gimlet and other cocktails, $7 for a tecate and tequila or PBR and whiskey? I'm feeling lushful already...  The mood in here is kind of sexy with reddish lighting and beautiful seating. Head upstairs to the balcony-like area for extra seating if the downstairs is too crowded. You have to walk further to get your drink, but at least you'll get a sitting break in between rounds. And when you're on your 3 or 4 round that's quite important.

UpBo6qdlr3yfRvoTFSArNQ.review_text: Daveeed, where the fuck did you go? Was it because we stopped missing your Tuesday nights? Was it the requested over-abuse of the old Bowie b-sides? Was it because we didn't fawn over your hair enough? Dammit man, where in the world is Daveeed San Diego?   Some things have sooooo much promise... take the band Kinski. Fun rollicking guitar driven droning rock. Periodically, the band tries to sing. Dear Kinski, please don't rely on the vocals to carry any of your tunes. The charm of Kinski is not the front man. I know that statement makes me somewhat of an asshole, but what makes Kinski's music special is the strength of the music (Edge Set, Wives of Artie Shaw, The Party Which You Know Will Be Heavy, etc.) Really, take the lyrics out of Newport and there's absolutely NO degradation there. Alpine Static remains the standard bearer.  Lush seems to suffer the other extreme. The lynch pin here is the bartender(s). Lush has the ability to be a cool place to have a drink or two (or four). However, a poor bartender here (and I realize that "poor" is subjective in this biz) sucks all the joy out of stopping here, especially since this is a mixed club (homo/trans/hetero). I argue that the bartender at a joint like Lush serves as an even more important facilitator of the social glue. So Daveeed, where the hell are ya?

HJEn04iudiXFDhUpe4rXEQ.review_text: A cute small cozy bar filled with locals and lovers of a good cocktail.  The bartenders are great, they don't even cringe when asked for a mijoito.  But I still think that the frozen watermelon martinis are the best. I have to get one ever time I go there...i sometimes go there just for them.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: good local spot, good new belgium weekenight drink deal.

QW3LIXu3xwKZ9LiDqf7a_g.review_text: Chris, one of the owners of LL, is a thrill to work with.   I needed a space with a mezzanine to rent out for the night for ~30-35 people. Not only does LL have an upstairs mez. available for events, there's no rental fee. Say what? No rental fee. We had a bar minimum for our private bartender upstairs, but it was within reason.  We partied on a Friday night and the bar was packed by 10ish. It definitley was awesome having the upstairs to ourselves while it filled up downstairs. #feellikeaceleb. The crowd was diverse, more men than women uh duh (we're in SF, no?). Drinks were stiff, affordable and tasty. I'm coming back for their sweet tea lemonade and their friendly bartenders. I'm booking the mez here! Thank you, Chris!  Parking: two words: Polk street. Just walk it/ bus it;. Or cab/Uber/Lyft/sidecar... or take all simultaneously heh:)

AWye-gCYuGO4oqYN2IrMbQ.review_text: This is technically 4.5 stars, because it's not the best bar in the world but it is definitely one of the best of San Francisco. If you're looking for somewhere less snobbish than Union Square lounges, but a little classier than your usual Irish bar, this is it!  The bad: the happy hour is a bit depressing and drinks are on the pricier side, as always (but not that pricey for the city)  The good: Around 8-9 pm, the music kicks up, the bartenders file in and Lush lounge becomes an awesome place to start or even spend the night. The best part about this place is the music- they blast some solid hip hop, 90's, and good time music (none of the hipstery house stuff) and it's a great place to meet up with friends, and enjoy a couple of good drinks. I was also impressed by how I shouted 5 drink orders to the gruff bartender who nodded and sped back with them drinks under a couple of minutes.  Ambiance: dimly lit, eccentrically decorated, awesomely music filled bar on Polk. A mix of college aged kids and mid 20's folks- on the younger side.  Overall: Mellow and unpretentious, great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night.

OjT_mpy_nDrN9oFoGvANpA.review_text: There is nothing Lush about this place.  Drinks were cool, but not as cool as all the ghetto ass Tenderloinin muda fukas who pick pocketed me inside the joint.  I was there on a very packed Saturday Night, at least half the people inside were a part of my friends birthday party... AND they kicked him out because he was too drunk.  Its like WTF?  Give him some ice water and find him a seat.  Douche Bags.  My first time in the neighborhood and it was all so tragic.  When in doubt... stay at home in the castro.

uU7GIgzs4-5Dtp9Vuymb3A.review_text: Came here for HH before my birthday dinner and it was a nice little joint. Their HH drinks are pretty interesting, ranges from $5-$6. I like the blackberry something, strong. I suggest not ordering the lemon drop special, it was very sweet.

JcB4XA0zxlx6F4b4MUT0Hg.review_text: Lush Has lush drinks at stripped down prices.  Sammy mixes a cocktail like nobody's bidniss!!  2-story knotty pine interior, with spacious bar, great long wooden tables with a feel like a ski lodge, psuedo fireplace and warm atmosphere.  My new favorite drinking spot on Polk!

q5wWt1Xmfjhm20LtTCQfMg.review_text: How about a faster wifi service so I can drink and do all my business there.

CKE7bImVY81KJD8PiiuDPQ.review_text: Chill spot. Interesting cocktails. I believe I had a Chimay on top.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: The "new" Lush Lounge has proven to be an outstanding upgrade. Roomy and spacious, this bar was the bar of choice on NYE. $15 cover wasn't bad and the bar wasn't that overcrowded when we arrived. We found a little spot in the corner of the bar to hang out. Drinks weren't that difficult to get. I had a few of the cucumber ones and they were pretty tasty. My date bought us a bottle of champagne they were offering for $30 for the midnight toast. Good call on his part. Music was a mixed bag which was great. Something for everyone. One thing that sucked was the line for the bathrooms. There was only 1 bathroom each for men and women and it was horrible.   I had an awesome night at Lush regardless and had one of the best NYEs ever. Even more awesome was my midnight kiss from the one person I most wanted it from.

hkVCtvSKceBOsH8QqbSDoA.review_text: Intoxicated me and cell phones have a long history of becoming separated and last night was no exception. Lush Lounge was my last stop on what was a really fun Polk street bar crawl and somehow I managed to leave my cell phone and jacket at the bar. Upon realizing this today, I stopped by the bar fully expecting them to tell me they did not have it, per my usual experience. Fortunately, the incredibly nice owner had kept my things safe and happily returned them to me. Additionally, the patrons who were there at the time were so genuine and friendly that it made me want to hang out for a while.   Overall, I think this is a great bar. It's spacious, beautifully designed, reasonably priced, and well-run. I highly recommend trying it out if haven't been and definitely say hello to the owner for me.

Dbq1m-h1FMEdqN0UjFS_DA.review_text: How can I not like this place!!!  Lush has delicious beverages, great bartenders, and you can bring in your doggy!!    Recommendations: Sweet Tea Vodka beverage- Makes me think of chicken & waffles  Blackberry Bubbles- Delicious & refreshing Blackberry Lemon Drop- Sweet & tart ...just like me  Cash Only Bar!  Lush has an ATM so don't fret !  Price Point = good for the struggling post-college adults

fpYIJYF0nqOAYtuz5zZPfg.review_text: The name is kind of misleading, I was expecting plush and velvet and white sofas, but it was more of a dive feel. Came in on a Saturday and it got crowded fast! Good thing there was an upstairs with more tables and seating. Drinks were pretty strong, some even came in cute maison jars. Music was mostly from early 2000, I mean Getting Hot in Here by Nelly is a classic haha. There's only a single toilet for the ladies, so expect to wait in line!

dLc9NyYXmcCVbdxPT6JzOA.review_text: I like this place.  We came around 10pm on a Saturday night and it was pretty dead but by 11pm, the place was bustling!  There are very few tables/chairs so 90% of the place is standing room only.  The drinks are fairly priced and the crowd is pretty diverse.  The second story is a little quieter than the first floor so it was nice to be able to hang out with friends without having to scream into their ears.  Really like this place and would definitely come back!  Also, if this place is full, there are a bunch of Irish pubs nearby as well.

4eR6hYFJcBHoAqhuOS07ww.review_text: Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday and here's what I like about the place:  -No cover! Automatic star for that -Pretty cheap drinks! Well, not super cheap but definitely a lot cheaper than most bars. AND the bartenders are super nice (which, to me, seems more rare these days) -Good music (although no dance floor because it's too crowded) -Pretty casual. I like that you don't need to dress up to come here. It's more chill, it's packed, everyone looks like they're having a great time

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: This is one of the nicer bar venues on lower Polk Street. It's very clean, sort of dark, and intimate (read: smallish), but this lends a cozy feel that is conducive to conversation over a very nicely prepared martini. Thankfully, they have my Belvedere on hand. And the mixed crowd can and should be considered built-in entertainment.

cyJsilA4llNkwFYOCLSIzw.review_text: Nice red room with lots of plants -- me likey.  I also likey the mojito made with coconut rum which makes the drink less potent but really tasty.  Another star for being able to make a really good extra dirty, extra dry Grey Goose martini.

Zcg8WQHGP8kLAIMfbvfgUA.review_text: This is a nice little neighborhood spot. A lot of people end up here on weekends because vertigo gets too crowded and you can actually move at this bar and chat with people. The drinks are good and they have great deals. Going there for happy hour around 4 to 5 PM is a little weird since you see a bunch of dirty old man there looking at you and winking at you.  The bartenders are nice too but one time I went there and I bought a bottle of water. I wanted to leave after that but they would let me leave for some reason. I argued a bit but didn't want to go over board since I would still come back to this place. I found that very awkward. I do like the frozen martinis/margaritas/sangrias they have and I will continue to come here because it's a pretty chill neighborhood dive bar.

QBXAIu1Vm-nKXUwBqZ5H7Q.review_text: I love their drinks, the atmosphere and random programs on the tv. The last time I was there (which was much too long ago) they were playing Elaine Stritch's one woman show "At Liberty". That's class.  It's kitchy, glam, cheesy and laid back. It welcomes all types and the bartendars are sweet. I like to sit at the high tables and stare out the window while munching on the bar's popcorn.

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: If you and your friends are looking for some over the top, sweet desert like, unique martinis, this is the place to go to.  Lush really makes some great martinis, and although I am not a fan of sweet alcohol drinks, I will say that having tried some of their signature cocktails, I was very impressed.  No worries though, they serve a selection of draft beers on tap and make a mean traditional martini.  Great place to visit during a night of bar hopping on Polk Street.  Only downer here, cash only bar.

Ldy03uMFaEEEnh3KIsPP_w.review_text: I never went to the old Lush Lounge, but I guess I should have, my friend says the drinks are the same or similar as the old venue, and I really do enjoy a "girly drink", as I call them.  Basically they have many delicious cocktails such as blueberry martinis with real blueberries in them, a chocolate martini I tasted that my friend ordered, and some pretty great gimlets where they squeeze their own fresh lime juice into.  I told my buddy I'd like to eventually try each drink on their menu.  She tells me their cantalope martini is very good.  We shall see!  The inside is pretty roomy with an upstairs area I have not been in yet, but you can see it from downstairs.  There are a few little seating areas that are pretty cozy.  The bathroom situation is interesting, guys and girls have to wash their hands in the same area with 2 sinks, I couldn't decide if it was cool or annoying . . . but it's  . .interesting.    I'd say the best thing about the bar is the drink selection. I definitely go there when I really don't want a lame old beer or boring drink, and I'm sick of wine.  Worth a try.

u59fJmAoS1Ro5C3H8xYq8w.review_text: GREAT DRINKS!!! so totally starting off with what a nice and chill atmosphere you are presented with.. Bartenders are sweet and know how to make strong drinks, and love the energy they provide...have one for everyones type!! always fun music..great for those moments when you need to sing along.. love the neighborhood feel and the regulars, and you know who you are... :)  love the relaxing feel that this place has.. totally best during the week!!   Fav drinks: bloody marie, dirty vodka, mango & watermelon frozen martini!! love it is like drinking an alcoholic slushy in a martin glass.. go for the double totally a great buy!! half the fun is watching them make your drink for you, true bar-tending...over all cant go wrong.   Has been a major stomping ground on my nights out in the city..over the past few years.. Totally love the gay decor and vibe, though have been noticing the straights are totally taking  over!! Totally enjoy the mix bar that this place was, but now the bouncer guy?? what has this place become. have to admit though i will hold a close place in my heart for the great times had laughing and drinking...an great people watching!!   I feel like i need to voice out a shoot for my fellow gays to make our presence better known.. Worried that we may be pushed out..Love this place to much!!  Glad to see business is huge, just concerned with the changing taking place... really do enjoy having the crazies walk in and shoot at us the paying consumers and the total drunks trying for one more drink... that trashy feel is what is all about the area!!  kinda like getting a show for free!! :)  All in all if you are still reading this, please go and enjoy your time here!! talk to others totally a kick back environment. just please go and be yourself it a great neighborhood spot!!

sr5ThmDuk8daEADGWSzLyg.review_text: I don't know about you but I love this place. It's never insanely crowded and stuffed full, the patrons and staff are all super friendly, and the specialty drinks are fabulous.  I think the last time i had some sort of dark chocolate berry something martini.. wow. Hit me like a ton of bricks once I got to the middle of it. Strong and tasty and ohhh it took me awhile to sober up once i left!!   I think what I like best is that it really is pretty loungey and mellow, it's a good place to have a few drinks and catch up with your friends without having to shout over a huge crowd or a bad jukebox! PLUS there always seems to be a movie on the tv screens overhead!

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 01.10.13 etc.  Cool door, friendly bouncer, plenty of seating, great atmosphere, strong drinks.  Only downer?  Cash only.

qFBOo0dp1Mpah-G1z1zHYQ.review_text: This is a regular place for me.  I come here when I want a cheap, strong drink at a place that I can actually breath on a weekend night, and is not super crowded.  I usually get their pre-made mango martini and ask the bartender to squeeze some fresh lime juice in it so it's not quite so sweet.  I especially like the decor, plenty to read and entertain!

sfQXLZGk6beiSuNZYb8iSQ.review_text: One of the best bars. The staff is always cool and very personable. The drinks always great. The vibe and energy a very good one. A good mix of people which makes it interesting and fun.

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: Five important things to note:  1) Influx of Marina boys 2) Surprisingly good music (impressive soundtrack of 80-00s pop rap) 3) Interesting men's bathroom (uncomfortable urinal situation) 4) PBR + whiskey shot special! 5) Cash only

I6WeX_XlwdGwLIsi-06mig.review_text: The big wooden doors, and open-window seating area is what lured me in here. What a great happy hour. They always have some booze pouring out of these spigot-pitcher things during HH. It's around 7$ for a shot and a beer.   The upstairs location is kinda cool also. Lots of seating. I really enjoyed the champagne blackberry cocktail (and I'm typically a bourbon kinda guy). Right next to hemlock, blur, mayes and McTeagues. Another great bar to add to your pub crawl.

W5d-Nx2T2OtOECRBNUbqqA.review_text: the location of my very first mojito, and my, was it delicious! really awesome. the place was kind of awkwardly small though.

RYsuzPc5ilPkOGgTysVh6A.review_text: Cozy corner bar with great people (trannie) watching and eavesdopping opportunities and very coconutty sweet mojitos.  You can always watch the old movies on the TV screens too if you get tired of the people.  Service can be very slow at times (it took 20 minutes to even be acknowledged by a bartender last time we sat at the bar) although it does also get really busy for just one guy to man.

hws8fBVk3ng_gktsW_KXnQ.review_text: Pretty small place but I went on a  Monday night and it was a good sized crowd--everybody could sit. When I first walked in I noticed a bathroom smell that I must have acclimated to after a half hour.  The selection of sweet mixed drinks were wonderful because the ones I had weren't overly sweet like they are at every other bar in the world.   I would love to go here again.

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: There's a lot of space, but on weekends it can a little insane to navigate through here. It looks like the smallish section upstairs can be rented out for private parties, at least there was one up there one night when I was there.  Weekday nights are much different, much more relaxed and spacious.   Oh yeah, the drinks are good! And the overall atmosphere of the place is nice.

wWyrAZtHLp5eN7Asj-n4BQ.review_text: I love the new place..........great bartenders.

fgnccvVwJi-_BCYye_HRpQ.review_text: I came here for my friend's birthday a couple weeks ago.  The crowd was so - so, and the music was whack.  The best thing about this spot was that there is ample places to sit down.  The music isn't too loud where you can't hear others while trying to have a conversation. This spot is good for a more mature crowd that isn't looking to go crazy partying on the town, but mainly to get out and have a good time with great folks.   The best part of the night was the crepes spot across the street. We went there afterwards! = )

hVY5dJtw_B3zdAYN4V7I0A.review_text: I think that Lush Lounge currently has the best bartenders in SF. They make great cocktails, work fast, and are very friendly. The bar is a cool Pulk Gulch spot with a mixed crowd. Classic movies on televisions.

zpWizDgUk4-rQJXdjiBY1w.review_text: Awesome bar! They had a decent selection of mixed/made up drinks and the crowd was mixed. We got decently fast service at the bar, and my friends already claimed a table. It had just the right amount of people, which was nice, esp if you're just going to hang out with friends.  Bathrooms are decently clean. There are two bathrooms and each has a frosted glass, which means you can kind of see through where the person is in the bathroom. That's awkward.

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: This is a nice place to 'class it up' in the 'loin. The bar staff is stellar and the drinks are strong and pretty looking as well. It's like a little disco oasis where you can unwind after a long day.

5rmEJbcwwo5GhTi0AWpqWA.review_text: Lush Lounge....errr...it certainly is...when we are on the premises....stop on by....$2.00 PBR, et all, til 7pm...nothing wrong with that!!  (~_~)

zQdWPH3DGD2NiGMPhNBm1w.review_text: We were there on a Saturday night (some of us 10 could call themselves even "regulars" at the bar) and it was medium full I would say. Atmosphere and drinks are decent, nothing fancy, still kinda pricy (except happy hour) BUT the service at the bar and especially by the blowsy guy cleaning up the glasses from tables WAS BEYOND BAD, it was probably the worst "service" in the last 10 months in SF I experienced (and I go and eat out a lot). Why?  - The bar tending girl was at least only plain arrogant and unskilled.  - Yet, the blowsy cleaner took the biscuit. There was no pre-story or history to his behavior / no personal issues whatsoever. That is why I think the owner should know about the following behavior of him.  He pushed people (not only us 10) out of the way before cleaning the table and did not even excuse himself. It was so sad to see him being even extremely rude AFTER being clumsy. He touched and literally cussed people out and said that this behavior was normal in a public bar. He even told the security to remove the barrel table in front of us 10 people and made up poor excuses that they "need" the table outside of the bar where 2 other barrel tables were already uselessly standing around. No apologies, not even a try to talk things out. All that seemed normal for him and "customer oriented". Well, we didn't think so. And so did the other guests around us... So, this location has seen better days and luckily there SO MANY OTHER GOOD PLACES that value customers, are fun and deserve your hard earned money and tips.   I STRONGLY ADVICE YOU NOT TO COME HERE, you will be greatly disappointed. Cheers, George

QkBFSJklsh6bJe1dAEkD2g.review_text: i love this bar - it's suuuuuuch a great place for people watching. (what - isn't that why most ppl go to bars??!!)    although the 3 dollar frozen watermelon martini comes out of a machine, it's tasty ... and only three bux! last time we were here, my hubby only ordered a coke, and they gave it to him free.  i got out of a bar for only *3 dollars!!!* (plus tip) ... now that's amazing. i felt like i should order another drink b/c i felt wrong about only spending three bucks in a bar.   i once asked them if they could make me a watermelon mojito (which i'd only had at this bar i loved out of state, b/4 i moved here), and the bartender was more than willing to give it a try - and it was actually really good.  speaking of the bar tenders -- they're precious, and although i usually have to wait a bit to order, i can't be mad b/c they're so cute- and call me sweetie and hun.  i know, i'm a sucker.

pfH2l0N8e0CuvOb5kb3OZg.review_text: ah....marsha was going to give a four, i guess i should do the same. the coconut mojito offshoot was an amalgam of whizzbang tresses and schoolgirl naughtiness, while the haleys comet i didnt quite agree name wise. Either way, it was all about me and the ms. z having a smashing time discussing our relative home pieces and experiences in similar institutions. she likes slapstick, i like hate-yourself molten dramadies, but it all amounted to a cemented treat.

IpiqMt_Za5zwaD8Pc-cEjg.review_text: Laid back spot, cool vibe. I've never seen it packed shoulder to shoulder, and the upstairs seating is fantastic. The bartenders are a little rough around the edges, but in turn they get your drinks out fast so you can go have a good time. Great place to start the night.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: I spent about 20 minutes here, which was about 15 minutes too long. Was skeptical about their quality of drinks after surveying the decor, but was assured they made "fantastic cocktails." Ordered a gin martini (this was probably my mistake) and it was a mouthful of vermouth. Seriously just horrifyingly bad. My friends ordered a round of Grey Goose vodka tonics and couldn't finish theirs either! On top of that, Lush only accepts cash. SERIOUSLY??

kZXWjmCV2O_ylz2xQg2kRw.review_text: With the exception of the tweaker chic who walked us in and started asking us what we liked...  this place was pretty freakin awesome.  Really,  who the hell are you and why are you asking us these wierd questions?  You obviously don't work here.    As my friends and I ditched the wierd chic (with a backpack) and made our way to the bar, we were mesmerized by the efficiency and the generosity of the bartender pouring our drinks.  Seriously, he poured nothing but vodka into our vodka tonics and dashed it with a little tonic as a top off rather than a mix...  Dang, this is going to be a hell of a night!  The place was pretty packed due to a birthday party going on upstairs but the atmosphere was fun and inviting.  Definitely a cooler spot to socialize compared to the other  bars in the area.

CqJVkZYzNiPgOVaOB1bMdw.review_text: I've been here twice and I have very mixed reviews. The first time I went I enjoyed the drinks.. that's it.  Second visit.. bartender sucked! I'm a huge mojito fan, and I've had my share of good and bad mojitos.. This was overly sweet.. Can we say sugar rush?! The music is very hit or miss, I'm a huge fan of 80's but sometimes it gets a bit over the top cheezy.   The crowd is this place is soo random! 1) I witnessed a woman being smacked on the ass with a stalk of celery  by her "friend".. funny 2) homeless man getting kicked out 3) Eurotrash tried sending his wife over to pick up on my friend and I   Entertaining/creepy crowd? Yes. Drinks.. guess it depends on the night. I'll go back if I have nothing better to do.

YlicL5XgNFDSn3T5TABizA.review_text: Solid when it's not super crowded, which is weekdays, especially early afternoon. Opens at 3, awesome happy hour prices including a damn tasty mojito, fun hippie/classic rock tunes playing, and friendly service.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: I pass by Lush every time im on the 4 going home. I swear it use to be something else before it was Lush Lounge?  Anyway, cool bar that's convenient to hit up on the way home or to stop by when you're in the TL for a quick drink.  The night i was here i met a dude who i swear was wearing the same jacket in the Thriller video and an irishman who complimented me on my taste for good whisky saying he's never met an american girl who knows her stuff.  Tell me something i dont know buddy....*polishes finger nails*  Pretty cool crowd.

MR9ITRp4Icc_5d4wOmB_1Q.review_text: Being new to San Francisco, as many are at some point I didn't know this bar was a $20 card minimum. The bartender looked at me after handing him my card and told me of the minimum charge (not sure how hard it is to swipe a card these days, a charge is still a charge) and told me "there is an ATM over there, I suggest you use it.". . . As a bartender as well, I understand the busy environment, an off night, all of the excuses I know them, and it gets irritating repeating rules however, it was early in the night and I am curious to know how telling that to the 50th person went by the end of the evening. . . I can't imagine it was much more polite.

ZmitoFfF-pb6UbUwNTC3_A.review_text: I was truly sad to see the Lush Lounge move from its previous location the corner of Post and Polk. I think it was the slightly more seedy locale that kept the Marina crowd from slumming there.  Now that it's moved...well, that chapter has ended for me. I'm sure lots of people enjoy it now that they've discovered it on Polk street. Good for the owners, woe to all of us who loved it when no one else cared or knew.

ICmRztithXUuzI6lFrvCiQ.review_text: We came here to watch the 49ers Game! It's a nice atmosphere. Like the interior. They also allow dogs which is cool! Friendly staff! The restrooms were clean. Upstairs seating areais great!

bJQmnnp9n1t05NBy-ssedw.review_text: This bar is fantastic! The music and decor are very cool and it attracts a slightly classier crowd than most of the other bars along Polk Gulch. The barstaff are totally awesome as well: fast, friendly, and they all know how to mix a mean drink. On the subject of drinks, the cocktails here are top class-  the Sweet Tea in particular. In summary if you are looking for a hip and classy spin on the Polk Street experience then the Lush Lounge is where it's at! Highly recommended.

qK5GQYyckJx_5tyqDtqrXw.review_text: I went to Lush with a couple of friends after brunch! They had happy hour going on so we were thrilled to try their drinks!  We started off with their blueberry martinis! I wouldn't usually order a martini, but this really stood out to us, and it was actually good! You cannot say no to their happy hour prices as well, compared to other spots in SF!  I also had their mojito, which was refreshing after our brunch!  This is overall a great place to hang out, grab a couple of drinks and just chill.   Since we went here in the afternoon, there was less action in the lounge, and there was only one bartender making drinks! He was very nice and took care of every customer!

PVFekEJidqcH3V55HqhIBg.review_text: good music, chill crowd, friendly/attentive bartenders  TIPS: - cash only (there's an atm in the corner of the room) - only two bathrooms which means the line gets pretty long - avoid the watermelon shooters! the deal sounds amazing (something like 3 for $12) but it tastes horrible - it's insanely sweet and artificial but at the same time it can't overpower the taste of cheap alcohol

pEnPxArLOZlKC94iVkVFxQ.review_text: Man with Lush Lounge's new location they really went up twice in my book.  Before even walking into the bar you get this warm cozy feeling- I love the huge doors, and once inside the lighting and ambiance are perfect for any season.  We came for happy hour and the deals were great!  We came in 15 minutes before happy hour ended and the bartender allowed us to buy 2 glasses of wine each.  They also had good specials and deals after happy hour ended.  The bartenders were very nice, you can even rent the upstairs area for a low minimum or nothing, just come in and spend your $ at will.  I will be back!

ZSuJDWTYHlbiD5vdPhJEzg.review_text: Fun martinis for the sweet tooth.  Diverse and interesting crowd.  Great place to come with friends to catch up and make new friends.

YPkXV7QgbUR7S7tnfAtI_Q.review_text: Lovely cocktails and a great vibe.  My to-go place for girl talk.  The best part is ordering your drinks and sitting in the back corner on the stairs-that-go-nowhere.  There's something cozy about sitting in a bricked off stairwell.  Is there someone trapped inside?  Is it The Cask of Amontillado come to life in our fair city?  Spooky!  Also, if you get the reference, well done, braniac.  You can buy me a drink here.

7HESPpy_OXPE4LlH9iCNCg.review_text: Had a joint birthday celebration just last night. It was really good because   1. Great drinks!  2. Love the chill and laid back atmosphere 3. They were nice to offer us table since we have a huge party   Would most definitely come back here again for a chill evening out.

LUvebi4Q4_VAjLWmAgE50w.review_text: great place. Nice layout with interesting stuff on the walls. Friendly bartenders and the clientele are easy to talk to.

HdW_VZSVFiZTt7VcGIu52w.review_text: there are over 90 useful reviews on lush, but this isn't one of them.  . i came here alone on one cold christmas night...long story, don't ask...  the place was tranquil...no noise...completely empty...except for this one guy at the bar and the bartender...ahhh, just what i needed after another stressful christmas family gathering.  so i pull out a stool and sit somewhat near this guy...maybe four...maybe five stools down...  i'm not sure what prompted me to sit somewhat near him. perhaps even a holiday cynic like myself didn't want to be completely alone on a night like this...  he looks at me momentarily before he goes about his business.  the bartender comes over and asks, "what can i get you, fella?"  "a cold one...maybe a stella", i said.  "you got it. coming right up", he said...and pours a nice, cold stella from the tap.  ahhh, tastes so good...mmmm, tastes so refreshing...  everything is slowing down...to a crawl...  . just me, my beer, the bartender and this guy in a bar on a cold, lonely, eerily quiet christmas night.  silence...slience...and more silence...  after thirty minutes or so, we sorta glance and nod at each other, and go about our business again.  silence...silence...and more silence...  another thirty minutes go by...and i decide to buy the guy a beer. i mean, after all, it is christmas.  he's a budweiser kinda guy.  he thanks me, or more like nods at me for the beer...and goes about his business again...not even a small talk, which was fine with me cuz i didn't feel like talking that night either.   silence...silence...and more silence...  another thirty minutes go by...and the guy returns the favor and buys me a beer.  i nod at the guy...and go about my business.  silence...silence...and more silence...  another thirty minutes go by...and i buy the guy another beer.  he nods at me again...and goes about his business.  silence...silence...and more silence...  another thirty minutes go by...and the guy buys me another beer.  i nod at the guy...and go about my business.  silence...silence...and more silence...  this act of goodwill goes on for the next three hours until...  . time for last call...time for me to go home...  so i nod at him for one last time...and exited rush...  i never got his name. we never said a word, but that was ok with both of us on that cold, lonely, eerily quiet christmas night.  . somewhere johnny cash was smiling...

qD51vvp5Zf5DgPEGy7yfDQ.review_text: I'm glad it's back, but to me, it's now just a regular ol' bar--just like the rest.  Sure, they still play the old movies, and some of the interesting wall pieces are back up, decorating the place.  But their old location was small and intimate; there was a certain charm to it.  It was the one bar in my neighborhood that I enjoyed taking others to.     At least they haven't moved very far, which still makes for interesting people watching on Polk.

kFdKkVOUV8zPfLCvBObBeQ.review_text: Love the sweet tea here! The atmosphere is nice and isn't too douchey. Wish they took credit cards, though.

jJh05BDtCbxcOUcUF6UMAA.review_text: I've been to this bar several times and I love it. The decorations are awesome and completely distracting. Many times I've been in a conversation only to realize I'm staring at the ceiling and the wild things coming out of the walls. I think it gives the bar a lot of character.

UVxY0iyPaqY7s4BSFtt-xA.review_text: With a name like Lush Lounge, this place sounds like a Vegas bottle service joint with hotties in their hoochie mini-dresses, with velvet seating, sheer drapes, and a jammed disco dance floor of sweating young bodies with Polynesian armband tattoos and tramp stamps. It is not this at all.    Lush starts off the evening with a nice vibe, mature and comfy, with a casual ambiance to meet up with friends to imbibe a few and catch up with friends and their latest drama or gossip. It isn't crowded early, and the drinks are reasonable, like $8 call and $7 well.   The long single bar is to the left, there is a large picture window in front which is open on nice days to the street, with tables and chairs there and around the edges of the room. There is an upstairs mezzanine section for the overflow or private function crowd, but there isn't any table service that I could see. It is step up to the bar and order.   There are plenty of helpful bartenders, so the wait is never long. They offer a blackboard of specialty concoctions like most hip bars in SF do nowadays, but they aren't bogging down the bartenders with 5 minute prep time drinks with crushed fruits, shaken and never stirred girlie combos, mortar and pestle veggies, and a dab of bitters.   Lush Lounge is part of the Polk Street corridor of nightlife spots, where on weekends, particularly after 11 PM, the streets fill up with young revelers looking for a good party time. After 11pm here, the vibe changes from comfy and friendly to young hotties, single ready to mingle, and a line forms almost exactly at the strike of 11.   It isn't like the dance clubs in the TenderNob, since there is no dance floor here, and you can easily talk over the music, unlike most clubs, or even some bars like Rickhouse on Kearny. If you don't like the vibe (or change in vibe) here, you can just walk down the street to another spot on the Polk corridor.   Decades ago, Polk Street used to be famously Gay, before it was castrated by the Castro. You'll still see the occasional cross dresser and trannies in the lower Polk, which is an area that used to also have male prostitutes. But up here on the upper Polk area, it is Hetero, with the young Marina crowd migrating up as the evening wears on, and they tire of Buffy and Bif (or should I say Mitt?) named lawyers in the Marina spots.   During fleet week, there were groups of the Few, the Proud, the first in battle, roaming the bars in uniform, prowling for friend, not enemy. We applauded them and befriended them, thanking them for their service. I think they were looking for girls, but since the repeal of don't ask, don't tell, anything is game on Polk Street. I didn't ask, and they didn't tell.

G1CjI71Agj4_Ew4CuVQIgQ.review_text: This place is just a normal bar now. But before they used to have Martinis that came out of a slusshy machine. It was amazing. Now they are just a regular bar that accepts cash only. Not impressed. Maybe I just need to be already drunk before I go in there. And have cash or find a guy to buy me drinks.

C5VdqjjQ7cXKCG1x0UJ19g.review_text: Decor is a blast from the past.. if you are a fan of noir films this is the place...I luv the whole Broadway theme of the bar as well the drinks are reasonable this place is well known for their Martinis. Is a mix crowd. Which I really enjoy it feels a little bit like NYC. the edge with the  wanna be yuppie but at the end  you never know,what are you getting. This lounge is good in company of friends.An Is very low key but is worth checking out!

llNOyE235byFsuZcrZNo9Q.review_text: $3 frozen mango margaritaaaaaassss????  let's get drunk!  ok, maybe not (would be a harsh hangover..)  i like this place for an early 'classy' drink with a couple of girlfriends BEFORE going crazy somewhere else.  the atmosphere is ok, nothing to get that excited about., but they have good music that remains me my pre-teen years (hum...neon socks and headbands...i so miss it!).   the whole place is very intimate, just a couple of high tables and chairs along the bar.    staff is cool and friendly, as well as the people that hang out there. it's quite easy to meet other regulars.  like me. so see ya!

VkSK6i_6pqAsoo8aP8DUFA.review_text: I love this place.  And frankly, I don't even know why.  I mean, there's nothing that specifically stands out about it, but I've never had a bad time here.  Maybe it's the combination of really strong drinks and very cool people.  You get all walks of life here.   Tuesday afternoon you'll see a drag queen (or is she a pre-op or a post-op?  So hard to tell...) sipping a fruity cocktail.  Evenings and weekends you'll see a great combination of straight preppy folks, hipsters, gays and lesbians galore and anybody else who falls through those profiles.  It's just a fun place!   However, and this is a fair warning to ya'll: if you see me slipping off my chair because I'm so drunk, and I start hitting on you, just tell me to piss off.  I say this because frankly, everytime i'm at this bar I'm shit-faced drunk and i'm always perpetually single.  You've been warned.  :)

NknWFPAxaGxx_OJIEYVXWA.review_text: This is a really fun place to go for drinks.  They have cool drinks like The Mel Gibson.  I love their Cuban, cabana feel.  I love their ceiling fans.  I recommend this place for a fun night out.

3oIlTsI7GpQ57CGMekknyA.review_text: The new location of Lush Lounge is one of my favorite places to dog watch.  (No.  That isn't some sort of euphemism.)  Day or night, the people watching from inside the bar out the big, often open front windows is only average.  Even from the second floor level homosapien activity is predictable.  However, just after opening until early evening, the various breeds of owner and staff dogs are a pleasure to watch scamper after tennis balls, lay about huge as their human, or to be greeted by at the door with a canine smile.  Yes, yes.  No matter your preference, the bartenders are usually younger and easy on the eye, the drinks are nicely made and poured, the set decoration eclectic, the old movies still playing (thank goodness!) along with sports on another screen.  Still, the dogs--not too many at once and well-behaved--provide a true element of happy.  And I'm a cat person.

29XSOh9fNkyRpwxY0wI_TA.review_text: Cool space with nice spots to hang out. Pretty wide range of cocktails, too. I have to say the mojito wasnt the best I've ever had, but it was decent.

2pBmUTpG-ckHwMsUvYN-Jw.review_text: I don't really remember much about this place but what I do remember is that its an average spot. I was here for my night cap on a friday night of drinking. I ordered a beer with my friends and we were all chatting. They do have a few beers on tap and my friends had some martini's, which I appropriately made fun of them shortly thereafter. I'm sure this is a great place for a couple drinks on a date...but don't come here with some friends looking to continue a good buzz. Now to the story.  So I'm writing a text message on my phone and I look up and see a guy turned around at the bar staring at me. I ignore him and continue to message then I look up again and he's still staring at me!!! So I yell out, "hey I ain't calling you", at that point I expected him to get in my face, which usually happens at other bars, but he looked like a yuppie who was really scared at that point. He then turned around to face the bar and my friends and I joked about the situation. He didn't look at us the rest of the night.

5bEBWAaKF3PbwXjn_qwhpg.review_text: The new Lush Lounge is a disheartening reminder of the gradual shift on Polk St from interesting cross-section of the city to sanitized borefest. The old lush lounge was one of my favorite bars in the city: it was cozy, had great, unique decor and the drinks were amazing. Best of all, you never knew who would walk through the door next: some queers from the Tendernob, some sketchy characters from the TL, some trannies hopping over from Divas, or chill Russian Hill residents looking for a change of pace.  The new Lush Lounge is bigger, and the decor is nice, I'll give it that. but it's also completely faceless - no personality, nothing worth noting. Where once offbeat movies and weird pornos played on the screens, now you find sports games. The eccentric characters have been replaced by Marina clones and faux-hipsters. Even the drinks, which are now pricier, have lost their kick. My personal fave was the Cactus Berry Margarita -- now I wouldn't wish a sip upon my worst enemy.  Really sad, but all good things must come to an end. Enjoy your new digs, hetero girls and douchey boys - I understand that Blur, Vertigo, Hemlock, and the countless other places on the street weren't enough. Kimo's had to be taken over, and now Lush Lounge too. I guess I'll go enjoy the Cinch while I still can...

bQyQnkp93Lwy61B-JEqvdw.review_text: Descent layout with good drinks.  I bought a round of orange cosmos for my girls, and we thought we were going to bounce after that.  Instead, we wound up staying here the whole night.  I'm going back to check out their happy hour.  :)

cQmsm7a65uGPCfm1Jdc3lQ.review_text: I don't know why all these reviews say it's a value because $6.50 for a Jack and Coke doesn't seem like a big value to ME, but whatever. The ambiance is lovely, the clientle was varied, the specialty drinks are delicious, the owner (?) guy was friendly, but daaaaaaaaaaamn -- one of the straight-guy bartenders who came on later in the evening was cranky.   Minus three stars for being reprimanded (!!!) by the bartender, but I'll give one back because we *were* drunk, just not THAT drunk.    And just so I end on a positive note -- the frozen watermelon cosmos (or whatever they were) were good, surprisingly potent for a slushy machine drink, and rimmed with cinnamon sugar, which was an unexpectedly delicious flavor combo!

y9-bfJEhXvU98vwt5UejuA.review_text: I just moved into the area a few months ago and found Lush to be a great neighborhood bar.  The vibe is unpretentious and the drink specials are really cheap.  That said, the bartenders here still try to style up their drinks in their own way.  The place isn't very big and usually has a decent crowd of locals, but you should be able to still pack in a few of your friends for a great time.

w--1HdiEfETVHJLON1flXA.review_text: The place had some good music when I got in.  Not too crowded so you didn't feel stuffy.  Drinks were okay.  Don't mind coming back

S5tNghO1IpPgGidBaN3CLw.review_text: 4 stars for a great happy hour!  Drink specials until 7PM, and it wasn't too crowded.  I think it is a dog friendly bar because there were a few dogs running around... that's cool I guess.  The bartenders were nice, good crowd too.

qUg4PXAT42bxV48CqPaUwQ.review_text: "Well hello Lush-ious!"  Every time I've come to this bar, it's been a pleasant accident. Vertigo or some other establishment was too crowded and we've done the "How 'bout that place?" thang.  Well THAT place is Lush and they brew up a mean cocktail, served without attitude...at least not a bad attitude. The bartenders are cool, helpful and make either great suggestions or funny quips (deserving of a witty retort..but they wouldn't have it any other way "Mary!").  Depending upon the night it can get crowded, but still fun. Much better than RRRRrrrrrr Baaaarrrrr!  Try a Hangar 1 'Tini!  Been there with the crew at night, or H-hour to catch up with a friend or two. Hell....even hung with the Nishmaster himself  at  Lush. Five duckets to Lush for being a great stop along the TenderNob crawl.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: This definitely isn't a place I would come to regularly, but I like it.  I went with some Hastings students for some tax law club "meeting" during happy hour, so drinks were cheap!  I ended up getting a chardonnay, which was delicious for me, but I'm no wine expert so it might be a good idea not to trust me if you're into good wine.  We sat upstairs in a nice secluded area, and it was a good place to really just get to know people / talk!  I liked that there was music playing, but that it wasn't too loud.  I mean, I guess that kind of makes me sound like a granny, but for real, I hate it when I have to yell over music at a bar... not even a club.   I think what made me like this place more than I normally would have was that the bartenders were very nice.  I mean, the place was far from crowded so I didn't really expect them to be stressing or rushing / whatever, but I guess sometimes there are some that are just bored, uninterested, or just want to get your order over with so they can go back to watching the game.  The bartenders here were friendly and seemed pretty relaxed.  Sometimes I know it's hard to deal with customers like me because I have no idea what I want most of the time, especially when it comes to wine, soooo it was appreciated :)  Thanks guys!

3PDbYcLe2d8gbTzSEn_1Kg.review_text: Laid back bar scene with a cool vibe.  Pretty spacious and plays mostly new wave tunes so if you're looking for top 40 this might not be the place for you.  Drinks were generous as well.  Not too shabby: D

dyYwpSmLFqbHSvZPSBXu1w.review_text: I went to Lush this past Saturday and had an awesome time, great venues and great ppl. I'm only giving it 3 stars because it doesn't take credit cards. I know a lot of ppl still like to use cash, but its nice to know you have the option to use your plasic, especially at bars.

I_5SJx93OGeBRmu82q-7Ow.review_text: John (the bartender) made us a killer martini.  Don't remember what it was but it was full octane and chocolatey.  Good thing I was already buzzed to not be able to taste the alcohol anymore.  It's a fun place to get drunk.  And yeah.  That's all I remember.  Move along.  Nothing to see here.

oKrct4Hc8hZNMYXecitLCw.review_text: When I am in this bar, I find my eyes darting around catching glimpses of strange southwestern skulls or bones...  twisted ropes, wood sculptures. Cool fireplace.. The wood church pew seating was alittle hard on the arse so we had to leave. The drinks were good too. I did not want to leave. I was enjoying the music. My rear was not enjoying the seats.

WdE8eWEeZ7aYcnR8kf6u8A.review_text: This place is a chiller place to hang out when you are making your rounds on Polk St. and I came here as a second stop when I was celebrating my friends 21st birthday. Although crowded, the vibe here is very calm, and you can have a conversation without having to shout it out loud...which is always a welcome change on a night out. There do tend to be a lot of people here though, so finding standing or sitting room may get pretty tricky at times. I think the price of drinks here are pretty average too. One of the downsides is that their restrooms are single stalls, so there can be a line especially during those busy weekend nights. Overall, not a bad place to hang out, and wouldn't mind if I had to come back here.   A sad thing that did happen this night though is that one of my friends lost her phone, and when we called them the next day, no one picked up the calls after several tries. We even left a voice message, but no one returned the call either. True the phone is lost and probably not their fault, but it would have been nice for someone to have picked up their phone during business hours.

VDYSOtauXSk9pt2AgnEKCQ.review_text: There's nothing quite like sipping a chocolate martini on a cold San Francisco late afternoon, chatting with Brazilian bartenders and watching Hitchcock's The Birds.  It doesn't get much better than this.

aPXKEuJLx6FQREFXEtGUWw.review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this aptly named watering hole. It was Friday night on a Halloween weekend and the vibe just seemed super positive and friendly. The Yelp folks reserved the mezzanine for the evening's DYL and I'm really glad I decided to go despite my noncommittal "sounds cool" reply.  Decent selection of beer, excellent array of spirits and friendly bar staff. My drink of choice to start the evening was G&T with Hendrick's Gin. Bartender #1 charged me $5 for my first drink. Bartender #2 charged me $8 for my second. When I complained about this bizarre price disparity, I was informed that all top-shelf drinks are eight bucks. Sorry if I ratted you out barkeep #1, thanks for the discount!  On tap I spotted Deschutes Mirror Pond Pale Ale, Chimay and some kind of IPA. Definitely three choices I can work with!   I went outside for some fresh air at one point and a drag queen in a banana costume flirted with me. Gotta love Polk Street on Halloween!

GHZdMggvuYk1fsVWcyy0JQ.review_text: I usually come here on week nights when it's about a third full. I recently came here on a weekend night and it was super busy. Something about the architecture amplifies sound when there's more people in here, but the selection of drinks is great, prices reasonable, and the service is good. It's one of my favorite bars on Polk.

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: Lush is small and a good place to people watch.  They do a pretty good happy hour and lot's of interesting vodka drinks.  I used to frequent here regularly and run into the same people.

fNq6cIwJGrtbnohGtPnYkA.review_text: I really like this bar, so much so that I went twice this past weekend.  They make great drinks (particularly their mojitos and gin martinis) and they give you popcorn.  It is a great place to enjoy a quality drink while mindlessly watching classic films.  There is always a crowd but not so much of one that you can't get a seat or have a conversation with the people you came with.  Mostly, I love the crowd...it is one of the most diverse I've seen in the city.

zRh-dbEL1p6dEVhmc5Fsnw.review_text: I only like this place because of the variety of she-male hookers we have to walk by to get into the bar.  My lady friends and I ordered a couple rounds of fruit-flavored martinis from the Russian bartender and were crazy underwhelmed.  I had a cantaloupe martini, and while interesting, it was heavy on the cantaloupe and way too light on the alky-haul.  The bathroom is almost completely dark, which is fun, except that I could only see a faint ectoplasmic glow of  myself which is a waste of the wall-sized mirror they have in there.

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: Great place for happy hour. Love the atmosphere. It's not a hipster bar--bartenders are down to Earth. They play games on the screen too but it's not really a sports bar feel...hard to explain the scene but it's pretty professional, young, lower nob hill crowd. The cocktails are really yummy (and deceptively strong). No food but they have pretzels at the bar.

wNsSz6R73I3tcskuTv6yQw.review_text: Lush is my go-to when I'm looking for a night out on Polk Street. It's cheap, spacious, and friendly. There's an upstairs which is sometime used for private events but when it's opened up it allows for a lot more room at Lush. The only bar is downstairs so you'll still have to go to up and down the stairs but long as you keep a sharp mind, the stairs will be no threat.  The bar is long so you probably won't have an issue getting to the front. There's usually only three or four bartenders serving the entire bar though so you'll be waiting awhile. They have a $20 minimum on credit cards and since drinks are pretty cheap you'll have to drink quite a bit to reach the minimum. Personally I think that's a blessing in disguise.   Lush is both a good place to start and end the night. There's no cover fee and it's a convenient place to meet up. It's purely a bar but there are dance clubs like Playland, Mayes, and Vertigo very close by. My recommendation? Stop by Lush first to get your drink fix and then head out to some dance clubs. End up at Lush again at the end of the night to share stories and keep drinking.

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: HOLY HELL I'VE NEVER SEEN SO MANY HOT GUYS IN ONE PLACE. Started my night of bar hopping here. It was the only bar in the surrounding area that didn't have a line but it was packed inside.   They had $3 raspberry lemon drop shots that were so strong I had to chase them with my friends beer. They have an upstairs area that is just as crowded. I think there was a bouncer on the stairs so you probably can't go up once it gets too packed or something.   They check ids at the door and it might take a while to get a drink by no fault of the bartender. The crowd just gets really heavy by the bar area and you have to push your way through.

NR6Y46Ni2JjQcj4vDbqKUA.review_text: Lush Lounge has slowly become one of my go-to places when I'm barhopping on Polk.  The layout is cute..I like how they have a good amount of seating up and downstairs.  I love their chocolate martini!  It tastes like a milkshake but it's deceivingly strong for how girly the drink is.    They have a foursquare special but I remember the drink not being that great...can't expect much for $2 though.

g3HFkZgloxLQCvoJ5Zs5gg.review_text: Quite cool little place!!! Drinking before 4 in the afternoon? Aye aye... guilty as charged!  Together with some new acquaintances and friends after an afternoon of urban hiking about Russian and Nob Hills and getting our little hineys worked deserved some imbibing, oh yes....  $5 got me a nice chilled (just what I needed despite all the wind today in the City) blueberry martini. Wasn't bad, but also wasn't WOW flavor, gotta admit. My new friend, V, told me that the ladies really tend to like the cocktails shaken up by the mixologists here. I believe him!  Such a chill environment... two large flat screens, a real working fireplace in case the temperate weather should turn for the worse... Nice ambiance.. great venue for chatting and talking. Great chill time after our hike and sweat!  PS Hey, "Progresh"...we'll def have to meet again with J over at Viks!! My side of town..

ISn6n_YRURYAHW4qk3q-Fw.review_text: Stopped in last night for the 1st time for a margarita.  What a beautiful margarita it was.  It was beyond tasty and worth having two!  The bartenders were great and the other patrons were definitely hokey.  I look forward to visiting the new location when they move.  If you have time before they close this location ask for Sam to make you a margarita in a margarita glass and not a pint glass - you won't regret it!

xxm2VHIJZVO3U55rVmGLWw.review_text: i've never had a dull night at lush.  maybe it's because it's where i often end nights after having 5 too many drinks...and then i start drinking martinis.  it always seems like a good idea at the time.  interesting people, positive vibe and a seedy neighborhood.  great to end a night of bar hopping from the hemlock to the castle...

1zxx_sECzAnmOwD4-ilZMg.review_text: I love LUSH! I moved to the area just before Lush opened and figured McTeague's would be my local watering hole.  I was soooo wrong.  Lush is everything you could want and more.    First and foremost, the drinks are delicious.  I had the lemon drop $5 happy hour drink.  Perfect mix of lemon sour and sugary sweet.  Next, I asked the bartender for a suggestion.  He made me a cucumber gimlet.  The most amazing delicious fabulous heavenly gimlet in the world.  It's actually my favorite drink.  But so many bartenders butcher it, I rarely order it.  The only place (prior to Lush) that I would even consider ordering one was at Le Colonial.  Well, now that's all I will ever drink again.   All the drinks are handmade, shaken, stirred and scrumptious.  My friend had a Manhattan and she said it was excellent.  They use fresh fruit, real cucumbers, etc.  It's swanky without the snobby.  Oh, the happy hour specials vary.  One day it's blueberry martinis, the next lemon drops.  So, you can easily find a reason to go, you haven't tried the new happy hour drink yet!  Second, the bartenders.  Not only are they nice to look at, but they are also ridiculously approachable and friendly.  I didn't feel rushed to figure out what I wanted next and they happily recommended drinks based on my tastes.  They are great at what they do.  We actually went through three bartenders (no judgment, it was a rough week).  All three were equally nice and good at their job, making good solid strong drinks.  Third, the atmosphere/crowd.  My biggest issue with McTeague's are the pseudo wannabe ex-frat hipster folks.  I knew I was in trouble when a Britney song came on and the high pitched excited screams were not from a group of gay men.  Plus, really people, let the leggings and 'stache go.  It's sooo 2008.  Lush is the perfect mix and represents every reason I moved back to San Francisco.  You have hipsters, Irish dudes (cute ones too), lesbians, gays, straights, the random weird couple making out in the corner, and every other label I can't think of right now.  Everyone is friendly (except the weird couple, but eh, what can you do).  Each time I've gone, I've met people at the bar.  Just a good bar that draws a good group of people.  Fourth, the decor.  It's just light enough to see your friend or what's in your purse without holding it up to your face like your trying to eat something out of it.  But not so light to keep you from making a mistake by going home with someone that in the daylight, you might wonder what you were thinking.  The tables are set far apart and there's lot of options.  Tall tables, short small tables, tables for 6, a long table for 12 (or more), a nice long bar and a large upstairs for more private personal settings.  The jukebox plays good music and it's at a level where you can hear it, but you can also hear yourself think.  Plus, the have a FIREPLACE.  It's fabulous.  I warmed my hands and toosh and then headed out home.    Fifth, the owner.  He's local (yay local small business owners) and I think I might have heard he also owns that great shop Leftovers (just down the street at Bush and Polk and then a large one on Sutter just down from Van Ness).  He was so nice and genuine, plus he said I have a great figure and his friends said I had porcelain skin.  Really, they had me at hello.  Compliments aside, he cares about this place and wants it to be successful.  It was refreshing to hear.  He's got my happy hour business for sure.  Overall, this is a great bar for happy hour, first stop of the night or somewhere towards the end of your night.  They have a jukebox with great music, everything from Morrissey to Snow Patrol to Lou Reed.  The drinks are very well made and don't take 20 minutes like other places (orbit, bourbon, I'm talking to you).  The crowd is eclectic and friendly.  The decor is fun and cozy.  The owner is nice.  Really, would even want anything else in a bar?  I think not.  Note: this place is cash only, but they have an atm machine in the bar.  The fee is $2 which isn't that bad since one of the convenient stores down the street charge like 3.25 or something ridic.

XqZmRNuPFU4DgHmBrPhVcA.review_text: Great ambiance with wonderful drinks at reasonable prices.   Bartender Sammy is very good at what he does.  We will be going back.
