Q5I52p_h4KtauCVR_vfSeg.review_text: Interesting decorations, they were playing some crazy black and white movie on the TV.  They make incredibly delicious fancy drinks here, particularly if you are a fan of sweet drinks.  Chocolate martinis are delicious when I want something frou frou to drink.  My friend ordered a Bloody Mary that had all kinds of crazy shit in it.  They have a drink menu if you are indecisive, like I often am when at a place like this (I'm usually a Jack & Coke kind of gal).

lvkJL4jKF42oRyMYuZjK3A.review_text: Really love this place.  Nice bar tenders, decently priced cocktails, fun/mellow/quirky/eclectic atmosphere. "B-52's dressing room decor"  Love it.

I6ovPT6h58Nr-fiKWmTuYw.review_text: my favorite place for a cocktail! great atmosphere, old movies on the tube, frozen cosmo's, cute bartenders, creative drinks, elaborate mixology...need i continue?

nOXESQFS3h_ZhKQEO8SiWw.review_text: Very yummy (kind of pricey) drinks and a good load of space. If you make your way upstairs, you can actually fit a sizable group at a table and have a good conversation. Downstairs gets super crowded as the night goes on, but what doesn't get crowded on this street. I had a very decent Dark and Stormy and tried some of my friends' other drinks which were pretty solid as well. Overall, spent the longest time on my bar crawl here and actually had nice conversations and a good time. Definitely recommend to stop by here.

BG1V-CJjtv2LN6Dqb8MBrw.review_text: This place is nice, but really NOISY. My friend and I sat by the fire, but had to yell to each other the whole time. This place seems better for groups rather than an intimate date because of the noise.   The drinks were good though. If you go before 7pm, you can get a delicious blueberry tini for $5. Yum.

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: Eh....Whatever.  Went here on a Thursday night and the place was pretty empty.  No music, just vibes.  The drinks are okay but the white bald guy bartender dude was a douche.  Manager, if you are reading this, please fire him as he does not know how to treat women.  He lost a star for your lounge.

qiHW6RqL5AeuJWMLyycivA.review_text: Great bartender - love the open window to the outside and blueberry martini is wonderful! Great happy hour even on a saturday!

mj0TFO4fyv2K9BydUUZ_Yw.review_text: Cool, nice place to chill, small area, but good enough.  Has a good, mixed crowd.  Drinks are decently priced, had some cheap drinks as well.  Tried the 3 shots of SoCo Lime for $12, but seemed to not have enough alcohol, so kind of a waste.  Had other unique drinks too, and well priced, like a blood orange infused vodka shot.  Bartenders are nice too, don't need to fight your way in to get eye contact.    Only thing, no real dance floor, just a bunch of people standing around and chilling, hence it is a bar.  And BEWARE:  CASH ONLY!!!    Other than the cash only thing, it was a fun night!

Q-erYkdjPUs4E9hzpcS8gQ.review_text: I didn't really form an opinion either way on this place but it was fun when a crack addict came in asking for a spoon and the bartender chased him out.  Drinks were good.

7ecvBHMwf8xoJPL2AA3MoA.review_text: One of my preferred places on Polk St. They're always bumping great music and the drinks are great. Place get's pretty crowded on Friday and Saturday nights, so get there a little earlier if you want to snag some seats by the windows or along the back wall. Otherwise you'll end up standing around. Bring cash and some friends for a good time.

a9wSaY-Y_uBs1DgobJnIuw.review_text: Been here many times. And will return many more. Nice atmosphere great service and never had any problems with clientele. Other bars in the area can't seem to hold a candle to this one.

qemLmo2gM7SAMsvUK5JWUA.review_text: I love Lush Lounge because I am Linh the Lush.  LOVE the drinks, and the people that you meet are hilarious.

a0G4ZMN2jScFevRzzLafCw.review_text: Last night, I finally checked out the new location a bit further up Polk, between Bush and Sutter. Happy hour called, so I met up with my drinking companion after work. The space is much bigger, with a second-floor loft, but the bar still retains some of the old location's wall kitsch, which is very good. I did notice more of a mix in clientele (read: more peeps in nicer digs), so I'm guessing the move from the seedier block has upgraded the place a bit.   I'm still a big fan of this place, although I missed the corner booth in the back of the old spot. The new bar, though, has a cool little wooden L-shaped booth near the front, as well as a circular table near the window that looks like a fat tree stump.  Hooray for Chimays! (And very nice company...)

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: Came here at 4 pm on a Friday afternoon for some Happy Hour drinks and tried the Cucumber Ginger Gimlet. I had two of them and it was DELISH!  The bartender was friendly and helpful which was a plus.The crowd on that afternoon was pretty quiet though so I would like to come back and give this place another try.

vl5xZOMYAFqgHd7lT4uQDQ.review_text: LADIES BEWARE ITS THE KIND OF PLACE THAT SHITTY PHONE SNATCHERS GO TO!!!  Avoid yourself a random night with weirdos.  I think the only good thing about this place was their mojito & my dear company. Apart from that it was packed with bro-ey douchebags (literarily packed to the point where someone was able to reach inside my purse on my way back from the bathroom) worst part, we were just about to take off..

t5AFrfee1pFSgVQ8Bb05Ug.review_text: Went here thanks to Yelpers uniting to direct my friend and I to a fun place on Saturday night. We posted a list of things we were looking for and Yelpers came through for us! Well...there weren't as many cute boys there as I'd like to have seen...but you can't win them all.  Dig on the $3 frozen watermelon martinis, the rockin' oldies/motown tunes, AND the seats at the bar.  I'm sure I'll be back here.

2kGPSiQNRflysJncDJQH4A.review_text: Loved it! Um, can we please discuss the effing RED BATHROOM?!?  Ok, now that my bladder feels as stylish and as sassy as I did at Lush, let's get to the point. So I've been on this pear vodka kick thing lately. Now you as well as I know that Verna is not into the girly drink nonsense, but pear freaking vodka? UHmazing! Had it at a bar in LA a year or so ago and have been waiting for it to be available in SF. Finally.  The bartender was awesome. I told him to make me something with pear vodka. It resulted in this fabulous cantalope, pear, lime, amazingness. We were going to name it. But it didn't really happen. But he said anytime I or anyone else wants it, just ask for the Cantalope Martini with Pear Vodka. So there you go. Let me know if you get it so that I can start charging for popularity rights. :)  Also, I'm sorta hesitant to admit this, but I haven't had a Long Island since graduation weekend in college. I know you know what I'm talking about. It's like once you graduate, your days of Long Islands, AMFs, and Jungle Juice are over (except if you're in Vegas).... (or in the Marina....) OK OK, simma down, I'm JK, not Marina bashing. You all know you love a night in the Marina every once in a while so don't get your panties in a double knot.  Lush made the Long Island make me happy. And deliciously so. You could poured that huge ole glass of smackingly good LI into a martini glass and served it at Gary Danko's.

6l7VXFVWb79Cv0vezDvq2Q.review_text: Did I like my NYE?  YES!  I was with friends and people who mattered to me. Did I like my NYE here or would I return?  H&%$ f$&$ing no!  Maybe New Years Eve isn't the day to make a good impression for any bar/lounge/club.  But that the day I went and so did many people.  Waiting in line, one of my friend's friend commented to another friend to prepare for sticky floor.  Four steps in, it felt the sticky.  What else was bad?  The employees.  I don't feel they are the brightest or the most considerate.  It's all about the cover and the money.  I felt like they didn't care about service or impression.  What else was bad?  Three people got pucked on that I know of.  Me.  My friend.  And another dude.  It hit me on the shoes.  It hit my friend all over his pants.  And it hit some random dude on his shirt.   Was it clean quickly?  NO!  I'm not sure it was even cleaned.  This place is on my AVOID list.

k_NwG5SE1KqhXlxeoMs7ng.review_text: Lush. I had so much fun! The bartender-- I dont know his name but hes  italian with dark skin---- treat me and my friends excellent. The drinks were off the hook! I definitely will go again!

P3lgczevYp6gje4KfYH_nw.review_text: Cool spot. Unfortunately we came on an off day. The place was nice, and the bartenders were cool. I'll have to drop by, again, in the future.

npZu3OtrDH4wmdTU2JNNcw.review_text: With all their delicious and affordable drink specials you can certainly be a lush at this electric neighborhood bar. Lush is an everybody bar not just gay and not just straight ---this is San Francisco does it really matter?   Last night my friends (me straight, one gay, and one is a confused bisexual) tried the blueberry martinis and then a mango frozen martini. Each martini was $5 or under. The bartenders nor is the crowd is pretentious and the scene is def. more "friendly" than a pick-up spot. A very comfortable place to grab a drink after a movie, work, or just to catch up on conversations.

FsYixLGKymWPYASTuUPvtg.review_text: I love going to Lush Lounge for Happy Hour! They have a HH EVERYday. Tuesday through Saturday its 3-7, Sunday and Monday I think starts even earlier. They have a big list of the Happy Hour cocktails AND how much they cost. Is it just me that likes to know how much my drink is going to cost...? Anyways my absolute favorite is their Blueberry Martini. Its $5 and strong and amazing. Lastly and most importantly, the Happy Hour bartender, Sammy is super nice and attentive. Easy on the eyes too ;)  I think their non HH prices go up to $7 which still is a pretty good deal.

ym6lisvhlI9UrE5JSoXQ8w.review_text: this place is intoxicating. its fun, flirty and has plenty of plants that make it feel very intimate and not at all like the grimey polk street that awaits you outside. some hot bartenders who are mostly gay but fun to look at.   they used to have an open cabaret night- def not of the karaoke kind- i saw some talented heartfelt performances here.

pfZJ3xQmgM-pM2swm3TE4w.review_text: Sometimes of the smell of hot fart can be welcoming...or so I'd like to believe was the marketing ploy of Lush Lounge this Friday night.   My buddy and I were killing some seriously misplanned time before the Cold War Kids show at GAMH, and wandered down the road to Lush Lounge.  We spotted the open door to this joint and peeked inside - a nice mix of folks that didn't look on the verge of derelict state.    Then it hit us: mildew buttbomb.  Not sure where it was drifting from (and I won't put it past my friend for just slipping one one out and blaming it on the establishment), but honestly - it was a bit chilly outside and the thought of catching a buzz in a massive dutch oven wasn't the worst thing on my list of to-do's that night.  Past the gassblast, this was a fun joint.  We sat down at the bar and had a couple of cocktails, followed by their nightly special - some sort of strawberry cowboy koolaid served in a sugar-rimmed martini glass. Good vibe, good service, good music - all around goodtimes.  We searched again for this place on Saturday night, but apparently my sense of smell was off.  Couldn't find it.  I'll take my Naselex next time and try again.

r_ePqChsjGGXtxy9gZvW3Q.review_text: the only reason i don't give this place 5 stars is because it's small and when it gets crowded, it's a real turnoff to be elbow to elbow with people.  great drinks (*love* the metropolitan), relaxed atmosphere, and there's always some old classic movie playing above the bar (maltese falcon, chinatown, etc.).

3uJootQ876cXOb4Q2H39IQ.review_text: Lush can be fun, but lately, there is simply no breathing room in this narrow bar space.  The bartenders are solid and flirtatious, and though they look ambiguous, they swing straight.  If you are an utter nutter like me, you get lemon drops on the house and they remember you so that you can cash in on free drinks the next time.  Some call this place a "chick bar," but those guys are just mad jealous by the musculature on the bartenders.  True, they also are good at making so-called "chick drinks," like blueberry martinis, cosmos, strawberry daiquiris, etc.  But, come on, almost anything with blueberry--feminine or not--is tasty.  I have had the lemon drops, and delicate name, notwithstanding, those little suckers can pack a wallop.  They treat me well here, so I am a little bit torn on the rating, but the place just does not have the draw for me that it used to.  Moreover, it is not a dive, nor a lounge, nor super chill, nor especially anything.  Hence, it is, by definition, a stop during a pub crawl.  Strategically placed, too, since Polk and Post are peppered with pubs and taverns.

3XtMlMcY4k1Rop3aCUrn6Q.review_text: One of my main concerns about a new Lush location was what I assumed would be a major change in ambiance and space. So I was surprised when upon entering, I not only felt the space welcoming me, nay, demanding that I find myself a seat, if not by the fireplace, by the window or the bar, but I felt the Lush had been waiting.   Drinks are still stiff and well done but the space, oddly enough, feels the same, yet more, which is not an easy thing to accomplish.   Gone are all the Dorothy Parker placards and many of the photos of old actors, but there is a much nicer bathroom (and you can see where you're whizzing!!!) not to mention a Dyson Airblade with which you can dry your hands.   Looks like the upstairs lounge area is about to open. Also, the new wood door make the place motherfucking pimp. In general, it's like the old place with just enough breathing room. Awww... who's all growns up.

UKG4_dN_HIJD36UkjNwG3A.review_text: so, sometimes there's a line outside Hemlock Tavern on the weekends. and since i don't love waiting in line, i usually end up over here. the service is quick, the drinks are relatively inexpensive, and the people are usually watchable, if not talkable.

jjcPqs01tbPZe9i67HRBzQ.review_text: i've always loved this place for the casual atmosphere, fantastic drinks, and friendly bartenders.  the cinematic decor was also a bonus.  NEWS ON THE NEW LOCATION:  i've heard that they're to re-open in late november here - 1221 Polk Street, near Sutter...  thank gawd!

xuxB92OtitdoBBr68TLTVg.review_text: The mixed drinks were pretty bad for the price. I ordered a margarita and it was super sweet, almost what you expect with a $2 margarita on taco Tuesday's. So I asked for more tequila, still didn't help. Then I ended up paying an extra six for a tequila shot to add. My friend had the same problem with the dark and stormy, she got an extra rum shot. Bar is cool, drinks not very good. Just go with plain drinks

swqPgaC_wLtmVbCYxIpOqw.review_text: -Cucumber Ginger Gimlet -Blood Orange Cosmo  Drinks are great and creative, atmosphere is good, eclectic mix of people, fills up at peak times. Clean and nice ambiance.  Downside - cash only.

F01s5dK-Rit8g_SlSkJdTA.review_text: It's all about the really cheap frozen mango martinis... nice. Popular with both guys and gals during a night out on the town.  I've been to Lush a few times, and every time I go I really enjoy myself. The last time I was there I went for a birthday celebration. It turned out that another party was celebrating a birthday there as well. We all ended up sharing a delicious red velvet cake together and having a big party.  All in all, I'd say Lush is your friendly neighborhood bar - nothing too exciting or crazy, but always reliable and fun.

f7JBSy-Nu55rQ718Ud35uQ.review_text: This is my new favorite spot on Polk! The decor is absolutely beautiful. It's like a grown-up version of the Blue Bayou Restaurant in Disneyland. There are plants everywhere and dim, red lighting. I love it! There's a good amount of seating all over the bar, and even an upper deck area.   But my favorite part about this bar is that they always have great films playing above the bar. There are just so many things going on that I always have a great time!  I'd passed this place a few times because the name makes it sound sooooo lame. Just ignore it and walk right in, you won't be disappointed.

Zn6_1t5LujJZLkkMOBgntg.review_text: This place was fine. Vodka tonic was good. Drunk guy trying to feed me cupcake icing out the palm of his hand was gross.

5UDpc2CMOgbf3GePS6SGVA.review_text: While waiting for the next showing of Bond at AMC theatres, we walked over to this lounge & had some drinks.  At the suggestion of the nice female bartender, I tried the lychee pomegranate martini, and loved it.  Extremely fruity and that's what I like, so I had two of them.  The glasses are uniquely shaped, and fun to drink out of.  Many colors of drinks/selection, and I was tempted to try them all...next time.  It's a laid back bar, with good company all around.  There was a black and white movie (starring Marilyn Monroe) playing at the time, and interesting 80's music in the background, with a tiny disco ball shining towards the restroom.  I enjoyed this little, cozy joint.  Remember to bring cash though...if not, there's an ATM inside.

hWsFeJtDYhLxXmjK8-t8_Q.review_text: I used to love this place when it was gay. Alas, it's been discovered by the masses, and now I have to make sure to have my anti-hipster spray in tow whenever I visit. (Which is rare these days.)  Still, it's worth the trip just to see the 1970s dried-pasta collage poster of Nancy Sinatra at the Fillmore. Flawless.

HMx0CPxWgQzWy6PcjeKONw.review_text: I went to Lush for my birthday this year, and had a blast. The crowd was very diverse, a nice change from the upper end of the Polk St. scene. I recommend going to Lush to get things started, then heading across the street to Hemlock, and maybe wandering your way to the Karaoke Bar.

diyCOcuzPbYEQVpAY2Bzwg.review_text: Deuchebags galore! If you wanna know where Deuchebags go to breed just step inside of Lush lounge.  The Marina frat bros and wannabe hard techies join together in a beautiful dickweed cocktail to grope on chicks and do their best impression of Frank Gore by just pushing you out of the way when they are weaving through this ridiculously over crowded deuchebag factory.  Even the bartenders are shady, paid for 2 drinks $15, she wouldn't bring my change back.  Instead she just goes to the opposite end of the bar and cleans.  I've seen seen enough V-Neck shirts and taco meat tonight to hold me over until the 2nd coming of John Travolta and Saturday Night Fever.  Won't be back.

pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg.review_text: Dark, low key, sensual, sultry, $4.50 fernet shots, small up and close tables make it more of a intimate date spot than a place for 6 of the fellas for an after work happy hour.  *Mental Note*, add Lush Lounge to the repertoire.  Lushalicious

z-KkYvu4klkBOSUfgKoTJQ.review_text: Very cool dive bar! If you are in the area it is definitely worth checking out. I happened to stroll in on a Hawaiian theme night but even though I had forgotten my flowered shirt I did not feel out of place at all. The only reason why I did not give Lush 5 stars is due to the long wait and obscene effort I had to make to get a drink. I know it is a game of survival of the fittest in a bar on a sat. night but this wait was just a little too intense for me. Over all it was a great time (particularly because it was a celebration for my sisters birthday) and I would definitely return!  Drink Recommendation: TRY THEIR BELLINI! IT IS AMAZING

iIx5jkLjCA-8ujObEHOHIQ.review_text:
Great mojitos and if you can get a window seat, you'll have a great view of the action going down in this part of the TL.  The decor is an interesting mish-mash of all kinds of cool vintage film knick-knacks and every time I've been here some old-skool movie playing overhead.
  The last time I was here, the second I got up to go tinkle, a creepy old guy with stringy hair in a suit that had been hungrily eyeing up my date, brazenly took the opportunity to come and chat her up!  I came back as he was handing her his card, she was cowering in the corner ...and guess what? He completely ignored me and that I'd been there all along and continued to chat her up!! haha. So I had to "save" her and rock outta there pronto. I think he was harmless but definitely socially "off". Its kinda random & funny in hindsight, and just part of the local scenery.

GIMg5oHqsJXdRq_7tR2jjQ.review_text: There are very few things in life that make me truly happy.  Bubbly is always going to put a smile on my face.  Now when you add the Bubbly with fermented peaches (yes they have been soaking in alcohol...I'm not sure what kind) and Cointreau you have Lush's Bellini.  It was delicious.  I was able to enjoy this divine little concoction, two in fact, with one of my best friends on a quiet afternoon. As the sun hit our backs through the large glass windows we were able to catch up on life before she had to catch her plane home.  Lush's Bellini and quality BFF time when you haven't seen the girl in months when for one the bar has yet to turn rowdy are the little things that make me appreciate my life.    And I have to mention that the bartender who served us was back from a hiatus / life elsewhere. He was funny and charming and boy did he have a fan club.  Clearly he had at one point been a regular bartender because the happy hour crew of business men were so excited to see him I thought they were going to wet their pants.  His girlfriend better watch out! Men in suits?  That's some heavy competition right there.  Yes he mentioned to the happy hour crew he had a girlfriend. I'm not a stalker, unless you want me to be.  *pulls out safety scissors*  The happy hour options, however, weren't that great: Blended margaritas from a machine for $5.  At happy hour, they should at least have happy hour specials like at Blur.  And I imagine this place gets packed at night, but that I will have to check out at a later date.

0-TeFfTcygluUSekhnTntQ.review_text: They told me that I couldn't fit 6 puppies in my thong, but who's laughing now?  Not me or the puppies, that's for sure.  Listen:  This is the kind of thing that you too might try after leaving the [aptly named] Lush Lounge.   Their drinks are stiffer than "you-know-what" on a honeymoon!   But their real charm is the space. The design and decorating are amazing, complete with a fireplace and spacious seating.  Reminds me of that week that Bradley P, Dru P, and I spent in a chateau in Switzerland.

7DNCMwpfwwwim34SWV9q1g.review_text: On my first night in San Francisco, my friends and I dropped our bags at the hotel and ran out to the bars down the street on Polk. The first bar we walked into was Lush Lounge. It was packed (good sign) and had a very cool, casual feel I'm not used to. Wait, I can wear THIS and still go out? Folks, we're not in LA anymore!! I ordered my favorite drink, a kamikaze on the rocks, and I forget how much it was now, but I remember being shocked at how cheap it was! Maybe $8-10? It was good too!! The place was so popping that it was a bit hard to move about or find space, but I definitely recommend coming here if you just want to chill and have a drink. Granted, you probably will be standing with your friends as you chill, but regardless, real chill and cool atmosphere. Friendly crowd and cheap drinks, go!! When you're done here, walk out and visit the numerous other bars next to it, across from it, etc.

0XXIv9a0LWiaCjAkurjMMQ.review_text: A cool place to hang out on a Sunday afternoon.    Like, Easter Sunday afternoon.  It was a nice cash only bar, with an interesting decor and lots of space.  I suppose the lots of space disappears evenings and weekends.  I like all the chalkboards with the interesting drinks, and that they have drinks in every price range.    The bartender was friendly, attentive and polite.  The other patrons were congenial, too.    3 flutes of champagne and a glass of chardonnay = $15 + tip.

Wh2Y4k8MPPvBAGoRu4WCNw.review_text: I came here on a Saturday night with some friends after stopping by R bar. We beat the rush because after we showed up, a lot more started showing up and lines were forming outside! I checked in on foursquare and got a deal for a $2 rum cocktail. My friend just showed my phone to the other bartender and she got that deal too. It was pretty strong for a $2 drink so if you're sober, take advantage of that while you can!  Also, I saw that there were $5 raspberry lemon drops (or something like that) so it seemed like there were some good deals with drinks.   There's space for dancing downstairs, but the music is just alright. Not too many songs I'd dance to myself. When it got crowded, we got tired of standing there with nowhere to sit so we decided to see if we could go upstairs. To our surprise, it was almost empty up there so we got some seats at a tall table. It was more chill up there since it wasn't as crowded.   I like the decor. It's a nice place. I just wish it wasn't so crowded and that the music was better.

tNsid135DeTOBdJgK29giQ.review_text: This is probably one of my favorite spots for a drinky poo!  THe stiffs are drink...  THe bartenders and super cool and very friendly...no attitude.  I've even brought my dog in here and not even the slightest bit of attitude.  the best part its a block from my house so i can stumble home.

ut-75LeXS5aYpLyGIpcxlw.review_text: Crowded, full of hip people, but cheap enough drinks. I got a Jameson and Ginger for $6 and a special for my friend $8. Cash only -- boo but that's how Polk is.  I'd likely drop by again in the area but truth be told, SF's bar scene is nothing compared to NYC or Chicago.

pyEmIm7G7SJ8llEVB3zsvA.review_text: Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We ordered drinks at the bar and right after I drank my drink I needed a lime right after so when I saw that they were in front of me in their separated trays, I grabbed one but the bartender (tall lady with blonde hair) shoved my hand aside or should I say almost slapped my hand aside and started yelling at me!!!! First of all, I didn't know that I wasn't aloud to do that. Second of all, NEVER touch a customer or YELL at a customer. She was the rudest bartender I've ever dealt with. With that being said, I'm never going there again and I'll make sure to spread my experience at Lush Lounge!

Icpf2k5JDH7wTlEZcybcEg.review_text: This place has super yummy drinks and super low prices. Went with a bunch of girlfriends and would definitely go back.

PauNerg-kHRpoqLwB6F5CQ.review_text: Nice place with a reservable mezzanine that fits around 30 comfortably. Drinks are well-balanced and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and attentive even when it was busy, though I found it odd that a bar with this much atmosphere (albeit a little rustic) is cash-only but they do have an ATM on site.

PtTZf3VF_JwSKf-rkhuvRA.review_text: This place is great! They have really great, extremely well-priced drinks. The drink menu is pretty extensive and geared towards the dessert lover...grasshoppers, oatmeal cookies, etc. YUM.

4Ebs_E9ANhInJ9YzNXCZvA.review_text: For some reason, I always find myself back here even 2 nights in a row!  No cover. Hardly a bathroom line. The most delicious, seductive cocktails I've ever had. Oh and of course, Nichy, the "kawaii" rebellious bartender who took care of us.  The music isn't loud so I can actually hear my conversations even though I have deaf left ear.  It's AWESOME!!!  I went back to hang outside of Element Lounge, but I came right back to hang out until last call here.  Am I just a lush?  Ok off to Napoli

gtccglugEfJugd4HIJ0EVA.review_text: I used to live on the same block as the old location.  I was disappointed when I walked up and saw the place torn up.  I thought maybe they had gone out of business.  A quick search on yelp revealed their new location just two blocks north.    Their new spot retains some of the old kitschy charm in a larger, more chic space.  They have one of those fancy touchscreen jukeboxes now.  Also, the flat screens were playing a football game instead of a black and white film.   The drinks are just as good as always, though.  Hold onto your cash, they still don't take credit cards.

uSyPtqgXYsAwdiPvostnLg.review_text: Whaaaatt?! I didn't know Zachary Quinto is a bartender here on Sunday nights! I kid, but the nice gentleman that served our liquor looked like the aforementioned actor, and I couldn't help but bring it up with him - though I'm sure this wasn't the first time nor will it be the last time he'll hear of it. 5 stars to him for being awesomely light about it.  The door to this joint is huge, resembling the entrance to an old church, but the decor inside channeled almost a speakeasy slash retro feel with their pictures posted up of Cary Grant and insanely attractive old Hollywood actors. There's a random bicycle nailed to the wall, and this awesome double fan circling above the bartender's area. I felt like I was in a speakeasy where it requires a password to get in. The ginormous barrels in the middle doubled as a makeshift table for three. The lovely part in all this is there's enough room to move around and not feel so claustrophobic.  How can someone not fall in love with this lounge?  Listed below are Lush lounge's happy hour times and drinks:   Sunday noon-2am Monday 3pm-2am Tuesday-Saturday 3pm-7pm  -$3 Bud Light draft beer, glass of wine (Chardonnay,Pinot Grigio, Merlot,Cabernet) -$4 glass of Champagne, Shot of Cuervo Silver Tradicional (100% Agave Tequila) -$5 Blueberry martini, Blackberry Bubbles **(I recommend ordering both of these)** -$6 Don Q Mojito, Margarita, Skyy Cucumber Ginger Gimlet  I've also tried their Dark and Stormy (which my friend described it looking as "San Mateo beach water" when mixed), Strawberry bourbon , sangria, and blood orange/raspberry infused vodka shots ($3 a shot!). I recommend all of these, b/c I don't torture myself with less-than-amazing tasting drinks that get you buzzed fast. Then again, I'm a 5'1 Asian woman, any alcohol will get me there.  A+++++ fast service, great drinks, will come back again! **CA$H ONLY*

s5l6AGMkvlAeAnmepZLGLw.review_text: Lush Lounge is one of my fav. spots when my BF and I visit SF. It's one of the first bars we went to when traveling together after we first met. Four years later it still is. Very tasty martinis and the ambiance is perfect. Very romantic. Love, love, love it. Good times and good memories. :)  As a matter of fact my profile pic is a tasty martini from this lovely place. The owner is very nice and there is def. no pretentiousness in this bar. Do yourself a favor and check it out.

dwnzd5z4TE13ge3jmsaasA.review_text: I LOVE THE NEW LUSH LOUNGE!!  The space at the new location is absolutely great!  It is by all the other Polk bars I may want to visit if for some reason I feel the need to hop around and check out who's out and about.    I invited some folks out for Valentine's Day drinks at Lush and the owner and bartenders were completely accomodating!  We had the perfect space for hanging out.  The whole set-up is cozy for mingling.  I feel like all types of people are attracted to going to the new Lush and the couple of times I've gone it feels like the crossroads of the City.  The diversity of people represented there is pretty cool.  Drink specials are as awesome as they used to be and creative.  You get your bang for your buck at this place.  Sammi was a pretty cool bartender and added to the Lush feel.  I'm heading back for sure.

e4c5ah4-mL6EtV-yKxVtpw.review_text: No cover, no line, not crowded, chill! It was easy to order drinks and they have sangria ($5-$7?) and other lemon kind of shots for $3. They have huge TVs that were playing soccer when I went last night (Friday night) and the music is sick here! Old school rap and R&B! There are tables to sit and chill at. It's pretty chill and plan to come next time!

i7kEmwperz9uhs38RfguWg.review_text: I've been here seven or eight times so I feel confident giving it five stars. This is why I like Lush Lounge, and this is how they earned each star:   1) Interesting decor with a definite theme, but that does not overwhelm.  2) A strong gay contingent. I'm not of that tribe, but I like bars that are frequented by gay and straight alike. It tends to keep away the macho jerks with environment-killing transport/"high-class" hoochies in search of said jerks. It's very mixed in all senses--hipsters (which I might be mistaken for sometimes), people in definite dress-down mode, fashionistas, etc.  3) The Cable Car. I'm talking about the drink, folks. It was invented in San Francisco and is a little sweeter than drinks I usually go for but it's awesome.  4) Nice bartenders. Always friendly, always good pours.   5) There's good music but this is also a nice place to chat, sit at the window and people watch, whatever. It can get pretty crowded but the vibe always stays friendly and peaceful.  That's it, what more do you need?

disS5oye86976awyFa4Tsw.review_text: Lush Lounge has a really laid-back, varied crowd which makes me a very happy girl.  Grab a drink and chill out on the steps in the back corner with your friends.  All these reviews talk about people in drag, but I haven't seen anyone in drag there.  Maybe it was the wrong night.  Maybe they just look convincing.

7T57z2rPCr7r49m8gI5UyQ.review_text: This is such a chill place. It's great for happy hour or as the first stop on a night of bar hopping on Polk street. There's never a cover and you can always find a seat whether it's at the bar, along the walls or upstairs if you want a more intimate setting. However, the main reason I come here is for their Alabama Sweet Tea! It's not too sweet and you don't taste the alcohol, but after one or two it hits you! The one thing that would make this place better is if they had dancing! I would definitely stay all night if they did.

F3nnYBk4Le9ekAVarvlmPw.review_text:
Many label this place as a gay bar but despite the decor, it's not really trying to be. It's gray with a mix of fun people.
  Give the the watermelon and raspberry slushy drinks a try.
  Try to score a seat in front of their large windows. Polk St. traffic is even more amusing after a few martinis.

9kZTyRP2l4CBunexED0ZrA.review_text: I'm sad to update my review because Lush has always been one of my favorite bar destinations in SF.  What I used to love was the intimateness of the little corner bar and admittedly the crazy passer-by, heh!  But now, it's a full blown Club-O-rama, which can be fun, I guess, if that's what you're looking for, or if your in the mood for a pick up joint with amazing tasty cocktails that gets mad hot really quick... The bartenders are still really friendly though.  I'm just saying I don't recommend Lush if your looking for a similar cozy experience you may have enjoyed at the previous location.  The patrons have changed a little too.  It seems to draw a rowdier bunch...yeah... just not the same.  P.S. One bathroom stall per sex is kinda CRAZY for such a HUGE place, just sayn'!

CYY6B6SXkVMzoBNJh66XZQ.review_text: I went to Lush for my birthday. I had some good drunken birthday fun so I'll give this place 4 stars. Minus one star because they seriously need air conditioning and it's really small. Luckily my friends are I got the table in the back corner, but other than that, there are only stools in the "lounge." It was not lounge-y at all. Despite how small the place is and how HOT it was inside, I loved the decor.  My friends also said the bartenders were nice. They helped in setting up for my  "surprise" birthday cake as well. They even lighted the candles a second time after I blew them out on the cake and put them in a shot glass. That was cool. =) And they didn't kick me out when I was trashed and throwing up in the bathroom. Oh, and of course, great delicious cocktails/drinks. I agree with some of the other reviews.. great place for the ladies!

j-qG3DeHZjMzmTKEd367Rw.review_text: I'm going to the Lush Lounge tonight. I haven't been there in awhile-- I haven't been out drinking in awhile-- and I am very, very excited. OK, maybe just one "very." Last time I was there, my friend Thomas and I practiced our "Shiny, Happy People" karaoke routine in the back of the place for hours, and our significant others didn't even notice. That's how wonderfully buzzy we all were on the not-too-sickly-sweet mojitos...and a few shots of tequila. Looking forward again to the feel-good, neighborhoody, warm-and-fuzzily-diverse vibe (yikes, no wonder I'm not a marketing copywriter).

tMym5FBTh76TzlQCsY6VWA.review_text: NOOOOOOO! Crying and stomping feet. Stop this!   So over this. I love/loved Lush Lounge. ...............................  Okay, rumor is they are moving. All right. We shall see. Enough is enough. Stay gold Pony Boy. Or else.

De8tuYPKZwpT-syR1sylOQ.review_text: I live nearby and this place can sometimes be part of the McTeagues, Hemlock, stagger home.  It's hit or miss.  I don't go enough to know the bartenders or anything, but I have met some interesting characters here and have had some good laughs.  Late at night if you're bored, there's always the tranny hooker show going on outside the Post Street window.  I hear they are moving so not sure what kind of street entertainment will be happening outside the new place.  All good, and "A-OK", things must come to an end.

j1bq03g52WSTnrd6fYElQA.review_text: Headed over here after a show at the Shooting Gallery (which I do recommend you checking out if in the hood). Had dinner at Thai house which was excellent BTW!.   We managed to score the corner booth in the window at Lush and that is what kept us there. However the drinks were horrible!!! I first ordered a mango margarita - Aye disgusting - tasted like watered down peach schnaps - ugh. they did switch it our for me (I have NEVER) returned a drink before BTW. I got a seabreeze and again it was terrible - didnt bother with a third try.  The frozen martinis looked good but didn't have the strength to try after that. Maybe I'm getting old and just can't drink mixed drinks or cheap alcohol. bar had good vibe but wouldn't go there again unless I already had some drinks in me.

Z0XNbOZEHZl27cLyXXi0iQ.review_text: Great little spot on Polk if you're tired of your usual jack and diet. Come here for a specialty cocktail with champagne, bourbon, strawberry purée and a cucumber. They've got about a 15-20 to choose from . A drink will cost you $10. They have very few tables so come early if you want a seat on a Saturday. A line also forms at the door on a busy night .

qUPgcVR_WRJ8HhViLPyIWw.review_text: Dog Friendly... Friendly Bartenders and mean cocktails!

49JhAJh8vSQ-vM4Aourl0g.review_text: Cash only!  ~ $6 per drink, and they have really good specialty drinks..try the SWEET TEA  They play good music (last Saturday I heard alternative, country, bit of hip hop, and rock), and they have upstairs seating so you're not stuck around the bar. Glad I discovered this place. Thanks Yelp!

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Lush is probably one of the better bars on Polk Street to go to. The venue is quite beautiful and does not feel as dirty and cheap as its peers. They have a great set up of tables and a long table to hang around. More importantly they have great drink selections and specials that other bars do not offer. Can get a little pack on the weekends but cool place to lounge around.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: Solid place to grab some drinks, assuming that it's not bursting at the seams with people.  The bartenders are generally friendly, and they have a number of frozen alcohol drinks to offer, which are pretty refreshing when it gets packed inside.  The drinks are fairly priced and well made, which is a good way to make you feel better while you wait for an opening to sit somewhere.  The crowd is rather eclectic both inside and out - they have a lot of scattered memorabilia and decorations on the walls, and the patrons range from 40-50 year old tourists looking to enjoy the local nightlife to the usual twenty-somethings bar hopping on Polk.  You'll even see some Marina folk overflow to the area, as well as patrons from the Castro as well.  Sound, chill place to grab some drinks...but if only someone could explain to me how this isn't a "bar" since there really isn't much space to "lounge"...

RPD2MK_RJbCY_GFsLAZjig.review_text: Bambi came by got sloshed at Lush and staggered out after 4 margaritas to head to the movies...the rest I can't remember.   Always a great spot for happy hour. Can get busy on Friday and Saturday nights as expected. Service is always prompt and the staff is friendly.

m4XlCprA3YUdOxtFclx_Jw.review_text: I only went into this place briefly last weekend, but really enjoyed it. Great atmosphere, good vibe, bartenders were nice and helpful, quick service even though it was busy. There is plenty of space to hang out. You don't need to yell to be heard by your friends. Good crowd.  I definitely want to go back and stay longer next time.

IUzGTlUTw3Ee8z5B29BD2w.review_text: Forget dessert at the restaurant and opt for a Chocolate Martini at Lush!  This is a great little spot for drinks after work, after dinner, or after a date!  Basically anytime! As anon a. says, try to get a window seat, you'll catch some of the neighborhood action!

DgjHA9zexvzZgyHO_GZjLw.review_text: I really liked the last Lush Lounge, and I was worried they wouldn't be able to recapture the ambiance at their new location. Fortunately, I was wrong! The new space is much larger, but the delicious drinks and friendly bartenders have stayed the same. I hit up happy hour on a Thursday afternoon and the crowd was great - enough people to keep up the mood of the bar, but not too crowded at all. Definitely plan on frequenting this new location more than I did the last one. Expansion was a success for sure.

huSu7DnPqRYezptLN_vVTw.review_text: Chill spot to have some good conversation meet new people and have a drink. The bartenders are nice and make good drinks! Can get crowded but that's standard for the bars on Polk Street. Also no cover!!

Ip4F_YG9wGytarXu5o62_w.review_text: I had a very strange experience here. My husband and I were early for a dinner reservation at Crustacean so decided to stop here for a drink. We sat down at the bar and waited for a good 15 minutes but the two bartenders (one girl and one guy) refused to make eye contact! Weird. Would understand if the place was packed and busy, but the two bartenders actually serviced the couple sitting next to us and the group of 3 at the end of the bar TWICE while we waited. We left and went to Pour House which was great! :)

HOOKm7y2NN0RTy1XWGnSPw.review_text: Prior to a late-night opening show of Sex and the City, I went with a group of 20-something girls to get cocktails SATC style at Lush Lounge. Located at the edge of the TL, LL provides a slight haven from the sketchiness that surrounds it. Small, dark, and extremely crowded, LL seems to be a happening spot filled with Marinaites and fresh out of college type kids. After reading yelp reviews, I had higher expectations for the drinks. Yes, the portions were enormous and decently priced, but quantity does not always equal quality. The selection was okay, pretty standard in my opinion but nothing very unique or exciting (not to mention the bartender was not particularly helpful or knowledgable about mixed drinks). I went for the most creative concoction on the menu, which turned out to be a ginormous margerita laced with cactus berry liqueur and garnished with blueberries, marachino cherries, and citrus wedges. The drink was served in a large rimmed sugar coated glass and was the object of everyone's attention for the first few minutes. As I struggled to make my way across the bar with my drink to catch my friends, about three girls stopped me and asked what kind of drink I had- apparently people were envious. Apparently no one was brave enough to venture out from their lemon drop bubble to sample something a bit more unique (seriously folks, how crazy is cactus flower syrup) as most people there seem to stick to the very basic cocktails. And the drink itself? Not bad, pretty sweet, pretty strong, but nothing to write home about with the exception that about a third of it made me pretty damn drunk and I had to give away the rest to my eager friends.

i9FE2dNxJEw0ty06pzdEaw.review_text: Went to Lush Lounge last Sunday and it was great!  Great atmosphere to have some drinks and catch up with friends. They have good specials but of course I was craving a bloody mary. The bartender put his blood, sweat and tears into this thing and it was delicious! Although it took him a long time to make, he didn't seem to mind and was very pleasant.` All of the happy hour drinks looked great especially the cucumber gimlet! I will definitely go back.

QctdWnU7Bn6b6FXopHDSMA.review_text: We went here on a Sunday night for an after-dinner drink. As we walked in, and ordered our drinks with the bartender (clearly hearing we were out of town), he proceeded to refuse our orders till he went through a "routine ID check", then happily took my $50 for drinks that summed up to $8 and pretend not to know how much change he should have given me back! If I was THAT trustworthy, I would have walked alway $42 short.  "Long night", he calims.   I'm sure.   Discraceful to see that such despicable people still exist. How can someone take advantage of people's vulnerability like that. Since when did it become OK to steal fortips?!  Who ever the bartender was tonight (14th September 2014), I hope karma servers you right.

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: So I was never really a fan of this place while living in the neighborhood. Came back into town recently and discovered that they had moved up the street. Great new location. Very nice. Was quite impressed. Much larger and a lot more space to sit and chill. Still not really my scene but I love the new set up.

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: Again- this review is super super overdue. I went to Lush on a Saturday night to celebrate my 26th birthday with some friends. First of all, trying to celebrate on Easter weekend is a bad idea...but that's not Lush's fault!  The fireplace makes this place entirely cozy- could absolutely be a cool date spot on a week day night.   Didn't interact much with the wait staff, not sure how cool they are. I do know one of them wasn't sure what a Paloma was, and that just made me sad. :(  I'd go back to Lush if someone suggested it, but I'm not sure it would be a "go to" spot.

WR2lBUSmXrGRYFpvMopokw.review_text: Very cool bar with a private area for small parties. I like the way they set this bar up so you can casually walk in and work your way around the bar to see what's going on. The music is ok and so are the drinks. Its a primary location to start off your night since its at the beginning of Polk Street. If you sit by the window, you'll get a good seat and see some interesting people along the way.

X8m_KutqMNM6q7oAQ2rb6Q.review_text: Ugh! Stands for ugly drunk bartender with a food stained hoodie who charged me $12 for a black Russian well and never cleared the 6 glasses on the bat in front of me and called last call at 12:30. Ugh.  Also this place stinks. Its like sickly sweet like someone threw up fernet and no one cleaned it.    Please avoid.

Njr-4deTIXPvXfKHaXn_0A.review_text: Warm nights always put me in the mood for an icy drink. And Sunday was of course, quite the balmy evening. So, what better excuse do I have then to head over to one of my favorite places to consume a few drinks on a "school" night?  My friend and I met up and sipped on Watermelon and Mango frozen martinis while chatting the night away- just what the doctor  ordered. The bartender definitely made our night that much better when he doled out some popcorn for us and offered us a glass of red wine on the house (some girl had ordered it only to discover that she would be getting the boot for being under 21! meh, more for us. haha!).  Still love ya, Lush!

VNkEB5PlrESiPP6-3JR-xg.review_text: Lush Lounge is becoming one of my favorite places to grab a margarita. They are really tasty and during happy hour only $6.00!  The atmosphere is very relaxed and simple - including the staff.  At night they have the fire place going and during the day the place opens up with the huge Polk St. windows.  I'm sure they make other great drinks but I keep returning for the margaritas!

k_6JJl12UTicAEt6Ji8yTw.review_text: No cover, mellow crowd, drinks are cool, music okay nice area for bar hopping!

A5sEtzjzUWBVcr3w_pY2Mw.review_text: Big fan of the Tenderloin Iced Tea, and the seats in the corner are very comfortable and the bartender came out to take our orders and that was cool.  It is a great place to chill and I like the decor because it is thought-provoking.  I came here with a friend of mine and spent at least an hour talking to her about the joys of sex and capitalism.  Plus it's near a bunch of other bars so you have options.  Come here with a couple of friends but not too many because it is kinda small.

Kl7uOQWLBCmQN3phUx9tWA.review_text: Isn't it strange that the bartender doesn't know they have a particular single malt whisky, and so says to the patron after the patron asks for it, "We don't have that", to which the patron replies, "Yes, you do", and proceeds to walk around to the other end of the bar to point it out to the bartender?  Huh.  Isn't it also strange that the patron feels he was overcharged for his selection? But, hey.  They've got great hanging stuff in there which made for some cool photos...

q2csu9H5K72JHGrVL_pFhw.review_text: This is an excellent week night neighborhood bar.  The music is great, the bartenders are really friendly, but not over the top, and the crowd is always interesting.    I even forgot my wallet on the bar the other night when I went in to pick it up the next day, everything was still there!  Thanks so much!

88UZQd04EBL5kxpCUplzRw.review_text: This was a good spot to start the night and start off slow.  It was kick back but popping.  The crowd was a good mix and it seemed to be a cozy place.  It was pretty loud and crowded on the lower level.  There is a 2nd level that my friends and I were able to have a corner to ourselves where we can just chill be comfortable and chit chat.  I wasn't feeling the music in this place.  But not sure if they change it up or if it's always that type of music.

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: I'm on the fence about the new Lush.  It's big, it's busy, and it's not the eclectic bar it was just a block south.  I understand why Steve moved it and I'm still a fan.  But it seems oh-so-much-more conventional, and, well, it might not be, it might be, and if I figure it out, I'll you know.  I still like it.

Vv-AiAGE59I3jmVkuykm4Q.review_text: Great chill lounge that isn't very packed (at least when I went.)  If you are drunk with your buddies (because this probably your last stop in your barhopping) and you feel like having a deep, friendly and incoherent conversation on jurisprudence.  Then this is your place. Grab a drink and sit down. Just remember that you still gotta get home.

Jqg6znqVuB1BBWF7YUHL6A.review_text: Had my 25th birthday celebration here. Chris and his staff (bar tenders) we're very nice and accommodating! I was able to have the upstairs and it is BEAUTIFUL!!! They were also flexible with the music which was a plus and made my gathering even more fabulous. The drink prices were very REASONABLE!!! My guest had to have spent over $400 lol but hey it was all worth it and we partied right!   Oh! We came on a Sunday night (day before labor day) - parking was easy to find and the people (customers) we're also really friendly  Definitely wouldn't mind coming back :)

cxMcM-7kZj7sVqEefv2fhg.review_text: I love this bar!  Best happy hour on Polk st!

MUBAMHWj42xkx09RaxbvDQ.review_text: Cute lil bar full of greenery and fun little signs and funky stuff.  Great place to go after work on a weekday to unwind with friends.  Went there last Sunday night to hang out with the boys after work and had a very chill evening.  They always have cheap, cool concoctions behind the bar in large glass dispensers.  Last time I had the triple spiked sangria and lemon drops...mmm good and stiff.  Typical mixed SF crowd.  I'll visit again.

K6JdkhLBB6ZVcfMUEO4Y0w.review_text: It's a nice place to grab a drink after work or with friends.The atmosphere is very serene, intimate and inviting. Great place to unwind.

IMOOyjf3UbcExgm_hyCCpg.review_text: well, i like this place. Very chill bar, no loud music, easy to meet people. Especially for a bisexual man. Mix crowd gay bi straight and i lov it. Drinks r little bit expensive (maybe im cheap) 5$ for a draft beer!!!!!. Besides thats, its very kewl. Will try again

YmLC21GN6P2A2f7_2y6GGA.review_text: Lush how I was deceived. We dropped by Lush to start our birthday bar hop and it was a colossal mistake. The place is dark and divey. Floor was sticky. Crowd was pushy as fuck. Dranks tasted like shit, straight up sewer water would've been better.  We ordered two AMFs (for birthday boy and birthday girl), a whiskey sour, and midori sour. Very typical drinks that all bartenders should know how to make. The whiskey sour and midori was literally just lemon juice (no hint of alcohol nor the typical flavoring). The AMFs were just liquor that was meshed together and tasted like cheap vodka from Safeway (but worst!). Since we bought it, we downed it anyways using the lemon juice (what jokes) as our chaser. Felt sick afterwards. We left immediately.   No thanks, never coming back again.

GU9j0228Cjpdu_zFRaD-TQ.review_text: Great place to have a drink, the bartenders were all very nice and got the drinks out quick. I was there on a Saturday night and the place was pretty crowded, I was thinking it would take forever to get a drink. This was never a problem, I will definitely stop by next time I'm in town.

151EU7c3A1hNJh0Y-AKBQA.review_text: I think my favorite specialty drink here is in between a Makers Manhattan or the Oatmeal Cookie; very spicy and sweet. The place is dark, eclectic in a very sophisticated way, and small. It gets pretty loud and crowded on a Saturday night but still worth the trek to mingle and drink.  I dont know if they accept credit but there is an ATM.  Oh and Ladies (and men) watch your handbags if you are sitting against the window. There are sketchy people always scoping them out from outside.

tfYkWph6HxcE4fX7r6Vo_w.review_text: I really love this place. It's such a nice and cozy lounge serving great cocktails with reasonable price and great service always... though... I've experienced a few uncomfortable mishaps recently here. First one was about an apprentice bartender.  Every time when he took order that evening, he just couldn't find where the booze bottles were. Contrary to the customer's extreme patience, his excuse was like "Oh, come on. This is my first day. Give me a break!"  Ugh...ouch. I know he shouldn't have been there alone in the first place, but his attitude evidently lacks grace to work for my beloved classy martini bar. Second was about music. One day my folks and I went there for a couple of pre-dinner cocktails. As soon as we opened the gate, a loud noise struck our ears. This bartender was playing his kind of music all the time when he's on duty. I assume he thinks it's his privilege to play his favorites. I endure this ear-deafning music only when the bar becomes like a meat market on the late-night weekend, but not on weekdays especially after a long, long day.  Anyways, a bartender as a soothing ambiance creator should thoughtfully select tunes to allow us to relax, get a good buzz on and enjoy conversation. Then again, this bartender is one of the rookies. I hope those newcomers soon become able to carry on tradition of THE LUSH LOUNGE. Then, I'll be happy to give five stars.

W4SVZz55F8_9vWoau1iWDQ.review_text: Chill bouncer. Genuinely friendly bar-tenders. Dim lighting. Outgoing patrons. Strong tangerine martini. Candy sweet lush mojito. Cash only.

nPpPW1aWYSMGC62LHI7BUw.review_text: Great place to swank out for night.  Fun drinks and fun crowd.

aw973Pm1nrTbRjP4zY9B9g.review_text: Awesome place to go if you dont wanna get tied down to one spot (aka clubbin in the city). Came here recently on a Friday night for a friend's good-bye night out and it was a nice chill environment.   They spin a nice variety of top 40 music to whatever you listen to off 99.7. Dranks? They have a huge variety with very good prices that won't break ya pockets. almost ALL their drinks taste really good, well ... GIRLY good. We all know the ladies love those tasty drinks but you can always order the regular redbull vodka / jack and coke. Not gonna deny it though, their mix drinks like the sweet tea is poppin. i can drink 5 of those and not taste the alcohol in there but it'll creep on you.  Bouncers at the door seem chill.   -1 for cash only though ... some people NEVER carry cash. aka me

jxs7SnriWMiLPXfEMft9nQ.review_text: Lush is definitely one of my favorite places to start off the night.  What more convincing does a girl need than tasty drinks with names of the like of oatmeal cookie, apple pie, and peppermint patty (Not to add that the prices are not bad at all at about $7-$8 per cocktail)?  And after you get a pretty good buzz on, you can either hop next door to Vertigo and dance the night away...or because of its central location in the city, take a short cab ride to a multitude of other places!  In terms of drinks: Despite all of the unique drinks Lush has to offer, I have to say that my favorite is still their lemon drop...but it is my favorite lemon drop in the entire city.  Something about that fresh squeezed lemon!

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: Lush is the type of bar you go to when you want to avoid the kiddies and the douchebaggery of other clubs. On my girl Carmella T's b-day, we just wanted to kick it at a bar with a laid back vibe and get our grown woman drank on. Lush was it.  No line to get in.  No attitude at the door. No crowds at the bar. No problem snagging a table.  I tried their 3 for $12 drink special - SoCo lemon shots! Oh, and clean bathrooms. The only downside is that the bar is cash only, so be prepared.

-twSpty9KDGNmrhvUjQLYQ.review_text: I'm mostly a fan because I'm in here a lot. That might be a bit of understatement but it does ring true. It's nice, if you can grab a seat by the fire then it's super cozy, and the drinks are pretty decent. Or so I hear from my friends because I'm always getting the sangria. Tis a friendly place with a nice ambiance to it (especially if you can beat the crowds).

JPiKlswqJED5w7c3R3DoTw.review_text: These guys are great!!! Absolutely excellent atmosphere, awesome people, and a great time was always had. I had a fantastic time and i can't wait to come back!! Thank you guys for an awesome night.

gZAl8ZKpss1a7pImWDDZrw.review_text: I could drink their mojitos ALL day long. They are amazing and for 8 bucks they are pretty strong! I would come here all the time with my friends and grab a couple rounds of mojitos and enjoy the people. Theres this odd little corner with steps and a bench that we would like to sneak into, it's interesting.  Anyhow, the ambience is nice and the bartenders are really mysterious sometimes! We once saw a bartender jump out from inside of the bar, out of the door and yell at a bum who was trying to get inside! It was intense!  Their happy hour specials change I believe, I went once when they had their speciality martinis for 5 dollars and they were all amazing! Yes, I had to try all of them on the menu!

Y6O3zlMKBPwYlxVmBQCEew.review_text: Came here for a friend's birthday celebration.  The place seems a bit run down and dirty, kind of what I expect for a bar on Polk.  The bartenders were ok, the drinks were ok, the patrons range from the emo punkster to some gangsta wannabe.  I was really bored here, so thanks for playing one of my fav shows: Big Bang Theory on the TV above the bar.  I feel like this place is nothing special and there are plenty of other cool bars and places to check out on Polk.

-dwzGfMkie647nJg-Ix6JA.review_text: this place can get packed & sweaty, & other nights it's just a chill place to kick it. their specials are great! getting buzzed on cheap drinks is definitely the i like way to go. i haven't tried any of their mixed drinks, though their sangria isn't too bad. the people tend to be a diverse crowd during the school nights. on weekends it becomes a collar popping, one too many cologne spritzes, frat guy haven. i like my guys normal, clean & not so tan... so my favorite day to kick it here is a thursday or friday. if i carried more cash on me, it might be 5 stars.

l0rgSl1kKnQf6e2HRUbpgg.review_text: I always consider Lush Lounge to be the marker of where Polk street starts to get cool.  Turn one way and it's homeless/crazytown central.  Turn the other and it's bar after bar after cute restaurant after bar.  So it goes without saying that Lush should be great.  Isn't the name genius too?  It makes you feel like you belong there.  A lounge.  For lushes.  Perfect!  Okay, on to the drinks.  They ALWAYS have great drink specials, whether it's for margaritas or martinis or mojitos, and they are super cheap and super good.  They find ways to include fruit like mango and blueberries into their drinks, but you can still taste the alcohol which is important!!

Aup-4hi_30Xzr_qBmxIuNQ.review_text: GREAT frozen mango margarita. It took like 10 minutes though to figure out what was the dark round thing the put in the middle. It was a blueberry. The place was fairly empty on a Thursday except for us, some woman who was REALLY into the old movie they were playing on the TV with Cary Grant and these two guys making out constantly at the bar. It was a nice place to just sit down and have a unique drink or two.

UzUnpnlH1n346MDgaFMOmw.review_text: Very cozy neighborhood bar with the most attentive (and CUTE) bartender!!  They make crazy good bellini's (with pieces of peach in the bottom...soooo good) and very sweet, but good mojitos. I went here with some girlfriends and had a great time chatting it up.  The crowd was eclectic and mixed and it was surprisingly empty for a Saturday night...though I was probably just there too early.  Did I mention they have a hottie bartender?? I might have to come back regularly...for the bellini's of course.

fkGjBhgDwAbbBFqdASZ3JA.review_text: I love this place. It is where I like to hang out on my days off even though I live in the sunset. I am a bartender right up the street from here and it is great to have a place where friends and I can meet up.  Good strong drinks and great happy hour crowds keep me hanging out here. Sam and Chris are just so damn cool. All of the staff are cool but them as the week day crew make the place.

imYDUE0xF4-GsNdKwKlB0A.review_text: I have to say that this is the "go to" place for me and my friends when we can't think of where to go.  Somehow we are always able to get a table that seats five or six, even on a Friday or Saturday night.  We also love the cheap ($5 for a large, and $3 for a small) frozen drinks.  The bartenders are very friendly as are the people that hang out there. This is a great place to go if you just want to meet some friends after work, or potentially begin an evening of fun partying.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Came here last night for a friend's going away party, and the 4 star review was for the roomy mezzanine where he had his private party.  Ample space, seating, music, and drinks.  The bottom floor felt pretty much like a standard SF/anywhere bar -- crowded, loud, and for some reason, this section of Polk Street just reminds me of college, haha. :)  Good for private parties though on the mezzanine!

aBfT6rp0tfhEyc7fWeuYJA.review_text: Ah, the Lush Lounge.  A few years ago this was really an interesting place, with live music most nights, and musicians tucked in a tiny upstairs stage that looked like something out of a Vincent Price movie....   but for whatever reason they dropped the live music.  Now it's just another bar....

QnZa23RHmuxhR7dZz4ZAfA.review_text: Came here and slammed a few back before a concert! Friendly service...hell I have no complaints...nice place! it was on a week day so it wasn't crowed but it was laid back! I would definetley come check the place out on a weekend...see if it's still pretty chill!

hhrUmkSUrtfuf4gVMISsLA.review_text: Love the Bellini's in this gaylicious bar!  The boys are fab, the bartenders are uber fab and the price is ultra fab!!

m9zEchaUCZn9inXtRp0W9A.review_text: Horrible management. .... was there for a world cup game  a guy was taking pics of girls  legs n up skirt shots when was confronted manager said "ITS OK HE A REGULAR"  I didn't know being a regular allowed u to b a pervert n disrespect people!!!!!

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: This is my new 'deep conversation bar.' Not for any other reason than I've always seemed to have very intellectual or heartfelt conversations here. Maybe because it's named 'lush' and that fits my persona. Or maybe there's fairy dust in the beer. Either way, I've determined this cool little bar is where I'm going from now on to talk everything out.

v-HcprOKPC1_F5_15t4JDw.review_text: I came across this place on accident and it looked interesting from the outside so I figured I would check it out. They had an interesting list of mixed drinks so I opted to skip a beer and go for one of those. The service is quick and the clientele is a nice mix. It is a very social place where it was full but not overcrowded. It's the perfect spot for a quick drink where you might get sucked in or where you have other near by options to continue your night.

dWTKr-ZB4ugPM5zJ3Kckgw.review_text: Nice place to go, even on a weeknight.  It wasn't crowded when I ended up here on a Wednesday.  The large window near the front of the bar was open to the street.  Only one homeless person came up to talk to me and my friend.  Bud light is on tap, which is awesome.  Also, the pomegranate martini doesn't taste like pomegranate.  Its certainly a distinctive taste, but not quite all there.  Other cocktails might be better, but I stuck to that one and draft beer.  A nice place for a little-after-happy-hour drink with friends.  I'd go back.

EjVRsZhNyG7vkCxVci7xHQ.review_text: Where to start for St. Patrick's day? Polk street is always a safe bet since you can just make your way from bar to bar in either direction. Lucky for us it was 6:30pm so we were able to take full advantage of Lush's happy hour:  - $2 PBR's -$4.50 glasses of yellow tail champagne served with blueberries (cute touch)  -$5 frozen martinis  The place is small and the hanging plants are interesting and abundant. The decor is a little off kilter from the red and black signage outside to the wacky oval mirrors in the restrooms. Large cocktail menu with pretty much every martini you can think of. The bartenders are nice and once Happy Hour sadly ends you can still get a wonderful glass of Watermelon Sangria for only $4.50. Popcorn is provided at the bar...yummy salt.   **Note: if you're hunger grab one of the yellow Hanks menu, call in an order of tacos, wraps, sandwiches, fries, etc from across the street and you are more then welcome to munch while you cocktail.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: I really enjoyed having a big joint birthday here. Everything about it was good from the drinks, to the music, to the space, to the ease of working with the staff. Cantelope martinis 4eva!

-DmpYICjBii640Zny46cLQ.review_text: I don't know why my friends LOVE lush lounge.  I swear they end up here every week.  It's not so bad, but I'm not a big fan of the crowd of the Polk street bars in general.  It's always a bunch of fratty college boys who can't strike up a good conversation.  However, I do like how Lush is set up.  We always end up sitting on the upper level with our group and it's good times there.    Helpful hint:  If you check in on foursquare, you get a rum and coke for $2.  It is STIFF, so beware!  It tastes like shit, but if you want a cheap buzz, then this is a good deal.

TgCW5tyinPDvZWE5Sqwwgw.review_text: We strolled on into this place, after a YEE that ended nearby...   Great place to catch a football game! Although, I couldn't hear why a call was called, and the Closed Captioning wasn't on...   they have a lot of $5 specials... the BLACKBERRY BUBBLES was tasty, like a mimosa with blackberry juice instead of OJ.   the Blueberry martini, however, tasted like dimetapp... next!   overall a nice place to catch up with a small or even a big group of friends. the atmosphere is definitely inviting, and not pretentious... nice place. :)

lKCDrJtD-30GhDwsrjrNxA.review_text: If you're in the mood to wait 15 minutes for some sort of fruit juice concoction hand squeezed into your glass, then covered with so much fruit you'll never be able to drink it, this is your place.  Actually, it's not such a bad place.  It's a really small place, and I'd imagine it's great on quieter nights.  I went in there with a bunch of Yelpers after seeing the Borat movie on a Friday night.  The place was super crowded even before we arrived.  Also, it seemed understaffed.  Most of their popular drinks require a lot of time to prepare and there just weren't enough bartenders.  I'm not really a fan of really sweet drinks, so the house specials were pretty much lost on me.  But if you do like that stuff, try the margarita.  It's extra fancy.

zG6CNNmoid_KeXMtxTJSlQ.review_text:
My date and I ended up here on Wednesday night, and it had been a very long time since I had been to Lush.  So, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I immediately felt at home in their cozy, 'lush', comfortable atmosphere, and then after ordering a drink from the sweetie pie bartender, who was not only hot, but very nice (he let me change my mind 3 times after seeing him make other cocktails), humble and helpful, I had the distinct feeling that I had found a new favorite watering hole.  
  They have a great list of specialty drinks, and you can even ask them to tweak them to your liking.  I don't like really sweet drinks,  and like to taste the tequilla in my Margaritas more than the sugar, so the bartender happily made my watermelon marg exactly how I wanted it....and it was REALLY good.  I moved on to my favorite drink, a basic Bombay Sapphire Martini, slightly dirty, and he made those perfectly as well.  I don't get that very often, so I was really pleased. 
  What happened next could have turned a wonderful evening into a nightmare....my date returned from the bar to find his wallet missing.  Granted we were sitting at a table right next to the window in the TenderNob area and he left his wallet on the table (dumb), but we all have a lapse in judgment, and even moreso after 4 really stiff drinks.  
  Everyone around us, and I mean EVERYONE rallied together to try to find it...even ventured outside and did laps around the block hoping the thief had just taken the money and discarded the rest of the wallet in an alley.  But no luck...UNTIL the bartender overheard what was going on and said a neighboring bar had called and said if anyone was looking for a wallet, they had it.  How wonderful is that??!?!?!
  4 stars to excellent service, excellent drinks, and a really climactic end to an evening!!!  
  I would give 5 starts, but my incredibly hot date got more attention than I did as it seems to be more of a gay bar. It didn't bother me at the time because I was with Mr. McDreamy, but it's not a place I'd go with my girlfriends if we were looking for some male admiration.

I0ViOyrQqguZo-QSH9iDjQ.review_text: Maybe I'm jaded, but lately I'd become accustomed to paying $12 -15 for a drink. So how great is a bar where you can order a round of drinks for seven people for $45?!  They lose a star for being cash only.

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: So crowded, so loud. Not my thing. The decor is cool, the drinks aren't anything you can't get anywhere else. We stood up on the balcony, and watched people pushing and shoving below. Seems like a scene for single twenty-somethings. They have a decent happy hour, so I will probably try again during a less hectic time. I'm never going to be back on a weekend night though.

MDmNN2laCuXHrfc04COMCQ.review_text: blueberry martini was the perfect antidote to a hellish day at work.   cash only though so somewhat inconvenient.

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text:
So we walked in to this bar and really liked the mellow vibe and setting with its framed prints and photos on the walls and great blown glass pendant lamps over the bar.  My friend ordered a mojito and I had a Grey Goose and tonic. Turns out that the vodka drink had little vodka and the mojito was sickeningly sweet and they had used coconut rum (apparently, their mojitos are their unique specialty).  My friend was really repulsed by the drink and went back up to the bar and politely asked if she could exchange the mojito for something else as it was too syrupy and the following unfolded:
  bartender: "well, I can 'soda' it down for you
 friend: I guess we could try that, but I'd really just like something else instead if possible.
 bartender: well, these are our specialty and I already made this one and put it in the computer.
 friend: ok, can I just get a bailey's on the rocks then?
 bartender: ok, I will have to charge you full price for another drink though. Just throw me 4 dollars, they are usually 8."
  To me, it seemed a bit petty for the bartender to have engaged in this whole exchange over a lousy drink.  A good bartender would simply have tossed it and made a new drink free of charge.  The moral of the story is always run your business in absolute good faith because you just never know what yelpers may be lurking in the corner....

pRTOFvkfacjO-qFtE0f8tQ.review_text: This is where you can find me Friday afternoons. The place is usually empty when we get there around 4 pm for happy hour. It fills up around 5:30 or so and it isn't a huge spot so get there early if you plan on staying for a while.   The drinks are sorta pricey, especially for happy hour. But you cant go wrong with their Blueberry Cosmo or Melontini....I believe they make them both with real fruit...maybe that is the reason for the higher priced drinks...nnooo can't be the beers are even on the expensive side....and they don't take credit card... cash only.   Either way I still like the place. It's right across from the Hemlock so if you are looking for a much quieter, friendlier and more convenient spot then Lush Lounge is your place .

gfY-BGAJMINto1WK8w6orw.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE LUSH.....  my favorite lounge in sf. the drinks can be on the pricey side, but that happens after a few martinis.   the service is always fantastic, the martinis to die for, the mojito is heaven and the patrons are friendly and eager to chat it up.   my type of place and always my first stop when i come back to sf.

r1BM6Jb4VKT_aRanY5fxcQ.review_text: Great atmosphere.  Very comfortable.  Defies categorization.  This is the poster child of SF lounge, hip, night culture.    There's no pretension, no judgment.   It's all just about lounging, being w/ friends, meeting new friends, and drinking great cocktails.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Mediocre bar lounge on Polk street, but one of the main ones on Polk street, nonetheless!  Bar drinks are of the norm here (pricey that can range for $13-15 with tips included) and it's loud to hold a conversation here during late nights when it is time to turn up!   It's a fun bar spot to drink at and hop on over to another!

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: The music is pretty good and the bartenders are quick and efficient, which makes for a super crowded bar.  It was insanely crowded on Saturday, which I imagine was the source of a couple of the fights towards the end of the night.  Some people attempted to dance here but were stifled by the number of people in the bar who passed through.  The upstairs was reserved for a private party, which was too bad.  There was some seating in the middle.  Getting in and out was pretty easy.

RqUJo6tjD8m4JEuZ37VN5g.review_text: "i'm kind of confused b/c i think i read online that this is supposed to be a gay bar. i totally didn't get that impression when i went though (it just seemed to have a good mix of all sorts of people). the bartender was incredibly nice and helpful (and cute too!), and i remember liking the music too (i was *very* drunk, though). moreover, they carry chimay white, and any place with chimay white has my instant approval. oh, the mojitos are fabulous too! it's also conveniently located right near hemlock and vertigo..."

uCoE6wQezH3R8JD1T1vRHQ.review_text: We decided to go out in the hood after work after walking by the Lush Lounge's new location for way too long.  To sum it up  MOJITO!   The lush lounge still lives up to it's reputation of making great drinks with fresh ingredients.  I made a mojito myself recently, and they are a workout, especially if you pulverize the mint by hand, the way Lush lounge does.     I was a little nervous about the crowd after reading the other reviews, since the bar has always been gay friendly and popular with the after show actor and stage crew types.   We arrived around 5:30, and it was a little slow, but within an hour it began to get busier with a friendly mixed after work crowd.  Actually this is a great place to meet after work, it's classy (I know that this sounds weird for lower Polk, but the Polk is a changin).  My suggestion would be to liven it up a bit with some good classic music videos, etc,  no need for the news or sports.   Also would be great to have some vodka drink specials for happy hour.

_O02PWs-iubaOmBHv7SUXg.review_text: Once you go through their giant wooden doors, the bar almost has an island nightlife kind of feel. Rough-hewn wood everywhere. Large barrels as tables. Dark inside but in a chill way. When I've been there, it's generally been a twenty-something crowd. Good music. Not super crowded. A handful of good drink specials. I personally think it's a bit over-priced for what they offer but the place itself is pretty fun. The bartenders serve pretty quickly regardless of how packed it is.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: an old friend, new location. The Lush is the best.Class act bartenders who don't grumble when you ask them to make really annoying drinks like bloody marys, or fresh fruit mojitos. Great drink selection,lots of fun and exotic combinations I'd never quite think of (blackberry and champagne--YUM!).Go there early on a weekend because at a certain time the crowd gets kinda lame,but the ambiance and drinks make it all worth it
