4zXEET9KfvpC6a2qoN2V5A.review_text: 1 STAR- cool, friendly, witty bartender  1 STAR- casual moody ambiance  1 STAR- CLEAN unisex bathrooms 1 STAR- DELICIOUS AND TANGY tangerine cosmopolitan (minus 1 star for barely-can-choke-it-down lemon drop shot)...TOXIC  My latest crush took me to Lush Lounge after the They Might Be Giants show last night at the Fillmore....sigh....I'd go just about anywhere with him...ahemnmn...sorry....as I was saying...This is an unpretentious but casually cool corner bar with a sort of dark, moody but friendly and inviting ambiance.  We sat at the bar and ordered the evening's drink special...the tangerine cosmopolitan...for $5...can you say cheap AND YUMMY?...the drink, that is...not my date...he is anything but cheap : )  We shared one lemon drop shot...$3...I'm a lightweight, so I could only tolerate one sip...I'm relatively certain that it killed any and all bacteria in my mouth, and possibly took one layer of tissue off the lining of my esophagus when I swallowed...my face contorting.  My crush is a drinker, and even he thought it was strong.  I would recommend ordering one if you...say...had something offensive for dinner...it's sort of like Listerine on steroids.  The bartender had the sort of personality that every bartender should have...gregarious and effortlessly charming...quick with a witty and poignant observation...attentive to our needs but never intrusive.  If you are so inclined, a hetero couple could use one bathroom at the same time, as they are unisex...each with a urinal and toilet.  I see this as a time saving device on a busier, crowded night.  They were also clean, which is a MAJOR bonus in my book.    I honestly can't remember one song that was playing last night.  Whatever it was, it never annoyed me.  I was too busy gazing into my crush's beautiful, sexy blue eyes and hanging on his every word.  The music was at a level where we could easily talk and listen to one another, which is nice.  Never once did either of us have to ask the other to repeat what was said.  This makes Lush Lounge a nice place to hang out and converse...and canoodle...and drink.  As we were leaving, the bartender thanked us for coming in and invited us back.  I would definitely go back again~

WJeipqBVdQmVhnYrXlLb7A.review_text: I went here with a friend after lunch on a Sat. around 2PM. It was dead with one bartender and very few people. I ordered an old fashion and my friend ordered a whiskey sour. It seemed like it was a full bar and he knew how to use the ingredients (which, he did) but he kept adding more and more ice which DILUTES the whiskey once it's said and done I had a cup of watered down whiskey. No vibe to this place to even worth staying to chit chat and chill. Stayed for about 20 mins and left.  Next.

khFA0eLpu7H08JOWtiVF8w.review_text: Unfortunately we came here on one of the hottest April days in memory and like so many other establishments in San Francisco, Lush Lounge has extremely poor ventilation. Let's just say it was ROASTING hot in there and when I left, sweat was literally dripping down my back. Nasty.  However, the drinks were good - I had a Bellini with what looked like fresh peach puree and the Champagne was ice cold as well. The decor was especially inviting - I plan on going back on a more normal San Francisco day.

sJy-UsIJRGXKIPBK3zwn4Q.review_text: A friend introduced me to this place years ago and if I'm ever in the neighborhood I always try to find an excuse to come here - the huge crazy fruity drinks are good, there is always a pretty diverse crowd, everyone including the staff is friendly, and motorcycle parking right out front - what more could one want?  I've never stayed for long there, just a drink or two before heading out (or home).  Good meeting point to start the night or a nightcap to end it.

plxysphwSskBO1IAVRWjlQ.review_text: I am extremely grateful for the staff at Lush Lounge. Not only did I have a great time with friends there on Saturday night (enjoying the quite reasonably priced $3 PBRs) - i lost my phone that night too. Thankfully a friend called my phone this morning, they answered and told my friend where my phone had been found. I told them I'd be over when they opened, and true to form they were there at 2:30pm. I will always make Lush Lounge a stopping place for my outings on Polk St. Many thanks to Darren and Frank!

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: my friends rang me and told me to come to the lush for happy hour as they heard that they were closing, and were going to find out the scoop.  this was our frequent happy hour spot, and upon their call i rushed the bf and myself out of our racquetball game to head to the lush.  my friends gave me the lowdown when i arrived, and apparently they are moving up the road to a swankier location -- fireplace, mezzanine and the whole lot!  phew!  i was sad when i thought they were closing, and am now relieved to hear the news of the new venue.    i can't wait to see the new location!

m3f1x02-81PfN-3LnIzOlg.review_text: First time I went there on a Wednesday night with a friend who grew up (yup, pretty rare!) in Tenderloin but now lives in Vegas. I was going to take him to Bourban and Branch, but he picked this place because he missed it.  We each got 2 shots of Knob Creek, the pourings were HUGE, it was more like 4 shots each. We sat down on the corner wood bench, kept our legs rested on the stool, I LOVED IT! The bench is designed differently, like a V shape so you could rest your butt there comfortably, without having to keep your back straight all the time.  2nd time I went there was a Monday afternoon after going to Brenda's for a late lunch. I have to say it is pretty strange going to a bar at 3pm on a Monday. This time I wanted something girly because I had rehearsals later, and found out that they actually have a very exciting cocktail menu!! I got the lychee pomegranate martini, delicious! But I couldn't taste lychee or martini...at all. Strangely enough, 3 hours later in my rehearsal I started burbing lychee, well, still delicious!

wcwH3HDVkIi9J90XzCZJkQ.review_text: Cool place in an area growing in popularity. Drinks are good, slightly pricey ($7-$9 but bartenders are quick which is nice. Sweet tea vodka is pretty good. Funky atmosphere, with a lot of random stuff. Has nice fire place as well.

qU3E7ENm8VsMc_IZCpTCZA.review_text: I hate cash only places, but the drink prices are actually not bad. And most of the bartenders have a heavy pour. The decor is interesting, as is the view of trannies out the window. But hey, there's alcohol so what does it matter?

m0Sek4TwkxIGP7o7T9zAtw.review_text: I was surprised by cash-only restriction, but after a hectic time at another lounge, the  chill, relaxing vibe of this one was very welcome. There might not be enough room to sit down, but there's plenty of room to mingle and talk with friends without moving around for passerbys or being crushed by the sheer amount of people.

45iBeVQvKyGp0gt1YzmAKg.review_text: We recently moved to the neighborhood and were looking for our neighborhood bar.  Systematically we ruled out the Nitecap (too many hookers/crack heads) and the Brown Jug (too many hookers/crack heads) and just as were were about to give in to Divas, we saw Lush Lounge.  I was a little reluctant at first- it was filled with frat brothers.  or so it seemed.  one even knocked my friends drink over.  But they soon left and it became a nice, low key place to get a big margarita for $6 and chat with the other locals at the bar.  We made friends, got a CD, and got drunk.  And we did it in style.

NOJjhPDAquDcJDf84ib9sA.review_text: Since moving to the SF area from Alabama there have been countless nights where I found myself missing spiked sweet tea.  They just don't taste the same at home.  Lush has Sweet Tea aaaaand it's even served in a mason jar!  So perfect.  Came here on a Friday for happy hour and it wasn't over crowded, bartenders were really nice, and prices were super reasonable.

f9aIofvRra79gzbPf5ui4g.review_text: small crowded and cash only... this is not the 1920s.. even the least high tech places take square.. what is this!?  At least drinks are fairly priced.. and we were able to catch the end of a couple olympics races during our crusade through polk friday...

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Small place, gets crowded... hard to move around and takes forever to order drinks with people standing there drinking their drinks... (get out of the darn way so people can order... !) The upstairs is pretty cool... very chill, unlike the downstairs where it's like you're packed in a can of sardines.

kXTNrJkxqG-VKgtnKVbX5g.review_text: Great if you want a pretty drink...other than that, its entirely boring and bland.

vhCzEMJ-XDTuJflaYTHRzw.review_text: This is one of my regular hangouts after work.  Where can I get a delicious frozen drink with enough liquor in it for 3 dollars?  No where else and I can double the size for 5 dollars. The music is great and the bartenders are attentive and don't forget all that free salty popcorn.  Come early to avoid the crowd but stay late and see why San francisco is so diverse.

1agrkgUD0ItXll9jLrzIew.review_text: Lush Lounge was stop #2 on our New Year's Eve pub crawl. I usually prefer someplace a bit more low-key to down my liquor, but the lush in me appreciated all of the fanciful and inventive concoctions they had to offer. The crowd was a bit too "straight and narrow" and the drinks were a bit too expensive for my tastes. Truly though, it was a good place to stop by for a few drinks and then pack up and move on to more exciting venues.

vRrOWo9dZjImi6a52cJEhw.review_text: When I went: Sun night 8-10 pm. Who I went with: A girlfriend who doesn't like clubs and writes for law journals and likes English literature  Drinks are really inexpensive here: From ($3) for beers and a few fruity specials to ($7) for a lot of the other specials.  The ambiance is quite eclectic. There's a smorgasbord of 40's and 50's memorabilia and two TVs that are playing classics like The Graduate and Breakfast at Tiffany's. The setting is dark with orange and red lighting, but with the 80's music playing, it gets very loud inside. There's no room to dance so this would be more of a place to sit around talking to a friend or two.   I've come here with a large group of young people and I was just glad that we had already had a few drinks before we had arrived. The seating isn't conducive to having a group outing here. The crowd is a bit older and you will see several regulars having a beer here. There are always far more men than women here.  The bartenders are always so nice here. One even made us popcorn just for fun and it was a really nice touch. The drinks are pretty strong here. The bathrooms are lit in bright red which always makes me feel uncomfortable because it really prevents you from seeing the true uncleanliness. It also makes you feel like you're waiting for a prostitute to come by.

nvfRhlMj_u5teR4tVcRBug.review_text: Great place to kick it in the city nice break from suburbia for sure for us non-city dwellers. Quite a trendy spot and well it definitely has one of the best mojitos i have had on this side of the world.

qcGbDYgqJQxpWLjKAEMhNw.review_text: I like this place on weekdays, when the crowd is thin and you can actually get a seat and a drink within moments of each other. Decent prices, and the clientel ranges from dirty old men, to trannys from Divas, to preppy folks, hipsters, and general loin inhabitants.

C4vhxT3UsAlFvYqLjXtZDg.review_text: When I first came upon this gem in Polk Gluch it was a depressing day.  I was unemployed, temping my ass off, and I needed to SING MY HEART OUT!  I found the Lush Lounge.  I came alone.  I went to the piano and asked to look at the book of sheet music.  I sang a duet from "Miss Saigon" called I Still Believe with one of the more regular if not seriously theatrical types there.  We ROCKED the house!  Let me tell you, you canNOT suck here.  Some of the frequenters are all experienced singers who are paid to perform in musicals.  It was a high just to share the stage with one of them and sang to my hearts content.  The drinks are potent.  Definitely an AWESOME place!  I recommend it to everyone.

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: Well I'd heard it was a gay bar!?  It didn't have that vibe, but it felt very mixed and open!  The most INCREDIBLE lemon drops... seriously... all their drink specials are amazing.  Lots of fresh ingredients.  A little pricy, but worth it for the taste.  It's also fairly easy to get a place to sit for a place this bustling. Way to go, LL!

JeueZm7jbE8ekvk0Z3HYNA.review_text: What a pleasant bar. Sammy, the bartender was super-friendly, the drinks were superb, and the tourists who kept complaining left with a thank you and a smile. i had two drinks there with an old friend and both of us said that we'd be back after leaving. And we rarely lie.

QR58q2KsjkTKzACr1JahHQ.review_text: This bar has a great mixture of patrons and a wide variety of drinks.  If you want to go to a bar that reflects the diversity of the city, this is definitely a spot to check out.  If nothing else try one of their awesome Mojitos's or martini drinks.  They have several varieties and, from some one who has tried them all, they are spectacular.

nRGn0JumMZ3t8uFqJsCTcg.review_text: Smaller than expected, super pact with what appeared to be a fun group of people. Really great service for how busy they were.

SWWqWl7wgNHMFIuV9aSSlw.review_text: It's the farmers' market of bars.  The juices for their drinks are fresh squeezed, and the garnishes are works of art.  It might take forever to get your drink, but it's all about the attention to detail here.  They have all-night $5 drink specials, which do not suck.  Have I mentioned how tasty their drinks are?  The tangerine cosmo tastes like tangerine!  The blueberry cosmo tastes like blueberry!  Someone call Violet Beauregarde and tell her to get her fat ass down here already.

A-AWLm1o13JCA0Qhnljutg.review_text: Drinks are decently priced, and thanks to  Foursquare, I got a deal on a rum drink. The upstairs area was good and was a good overlook for the rest of the people crowding near the bar.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: It would get 5 stars but they only take cash.  I recommend their raspberry lemon drop or the dark and stormy.  The bar staff has a heavy pour and they make a mean cocktail.  The crowd is am entertaining mix of regulars and hipsters.  You may see people drinking with their dog or pet birds.

g-wssBxG2znpJVKZE2N-lA.review_text: Love this place for several reasons: 1. I can walk from my place. 2. The drinks are good and they aren't $15.00 3. There's a fire place. 4. It's a big space so there's most always room for you, your friends and the new group of friends you collected on Polk st! Also, there's a picture of Audrey Hepburn in the ladies room which makes this place even more awesome.

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: Sidecar was pretty amazing, but there were WAY too many people there.

nd1Z0OCN5H6BaEr77HMLuA.review_text: my memory of this place is pretty vague. we had already spent most of the night at the Hemlock. we were wearing our Halloween costumes that night, but even though it was Halloween weekend, pretty much no one else was dressed up. hanging out in a bar while wearing a pink bunny costume was pretty random. i *think* that i remember the bartenders there being pretty nice... but maybe i'm just making that up. hrm, ok, maybe there really is nothing that i remember about this place... but at least the location is good... i'll have to give it that! (my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)

CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q.review_text: The name Lush Lounge sounds fancy, it is not. More bar like than lounge like...or at least in my opinion.  Sticky floors & loud music.   Lots of people, so a lot of the seats were taken.

KoBORLHV_6ff9_s13k42Fw.review_text: Get the chocolate martini AND the blood mary (ok, maybe not together).  They are great.  One star is lost, however, b/c the mojito is served with coconut rum.  Yuck, coconut.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: This place is dead most of the time.  Could be cool to 'take it over' for a night.  Nothin special.  A perfect 3.

VmloJ_YR6WMPOrX1Lp8wtw.review_text: cash only people...nice fireplace...good drinks...never too packed

3cT3bfSAbsYB6oT2whz-uA.review_text: This is my first trip to the new Lush Lounge. I was a fan of the old one, but this location is like an entirely different bar. I went on a Friday and the place, which is at least twice the size of the old one, was wall-to-wall. There is a nice feel to the bar, with a young, vibrant crowd. Didn't have a chance to sit down, or try any of their specialties, due to the volume of people. I saw enough to know that I will be back, this time however, during the week.

30Pch18LE63MyRYOC34-8g.review_text: Two stories of drunken hipster bliss in the heart of the Tenderloin.  I've never been here sober, so it's hard to know how accurate my memories of it are.   My drunken memory says that it's always packed and can be a pain in the ass to get a drink from the bar. Once you get a drink the best place to enjoy it is upstairs where there is a little more room.   Most importantly, the drinks here are always poured with a heavy hand. Order a few and enjoy your memory loss the next morning.

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: If you ever go here and order a white russian, they *might* be out of cream.  If you still want that white russian, they *might* make you run across the street to the corner store and pick up some cream.  They will then reward you for your efforts with a free drink.  So that's something.  This is one of my favorite Polk Gulch bars.  Probably because of the white russian cream...

_GywH_L_4NYFrAQm2Ei4Dw.review_text: He says :  I took "she says" here on our first date.  OK, she'll probably debate that it wasn't our "first"  hahahaha.  Anyways, I love coming here because the drinks are so dang tasty.  The bartenders really put their time into making their drinks like my favorite, the Mojito.  I know most bartenders just want people to get in and get out (is that why a vodka redbull is so popular?  hmmmm) but come on!!!     Yes, this is a diverse place with a collection of gay, straight, hipsters, and more.  Open your mind with some great people and awesome drinks.  She Says: Given my visit and location of this joint, I'd say they do cater more so to the gay community... although He Says tries to deny it.  It's okay... I know he likes to hang out here because he's secure about his manhood.  Hah!

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: Not only is this a fun group hangout with lots of people watching (ie. boy watching for my single girlfriends), and a cozy fun atmosphere (dim lighting, tall tables lining the window for good street people watching, lush plants to make you feel cozied in but several of us in our group also felt it was a good date spot.  With the array of drink options, friendly bartenders and fun people, even if the date was a doozy, ditch him or her and make some new friends!    You would never know what fun awaits you behind the tall wooden doors, if you didn't go in, at least to run away from the he/she yelling at you for walking in her way.............

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: This pretty much sums up Lush for me: The biggest Pimm's Cup EV-ER!   Seriously, for $7 it was well worth the cost. Plus the bartender there is super friendly and attentive! They have a great menu of cocktails, sangria, beer on tap, and blood orange infused vodka. Don't forget it's cash only (well if you forget, there is an ATM inside).   It was pretty laid back and quiet on a Tuesday night- I enjoyed the calm atmosphere, & the tropical decor is sort of cool! Looks like they have an upstairs as well (wasn't open on my visit).   I didn't visit the bathrooms, but I swear it sounded like people were using a giant blow dryer back there to dry off?   I shall be back Lush to drown in a giant cup of Pimm's!

d-Esnujp9CpNWOC7rKPMDg.review_text: Drinks are pretty good and strong.  I like rasberry truffle or the frozen martinis if I'm feeling a little girly.  This place got rated number 1 pickup bar and the crowd is pretty good.

VVXiQ-P09TTZUR049GDaZw.review_text: Lush Lounge is fine. It's not someplace I'd go out of my way to get to, but since it's a block or two from home and I don't have any serious qualms with it, I'll keep going back.  I'm not sure if it's me or the menu, but I've struck out with Lush specialty cocktails. The key lime martini was super sweet and syrupy, not tart at all like I was hoping for. The blueberry martini was better but didn't really taste like blueberries... I should remember this each time I go in and order beer instead, but the martini menu is just so alluring. I bet I'll find a good one sooner or later... I do want to try to jalapeno-infused tequila.  The crowd seems to change a lot. I've seen everything from uber-drunken women in their 30s draping themselves all over men at the bar to bikers chillin' with buddies to "normal" peole just hanging out.  I like the vibe in there... reddish lighting, dark wood, and old-fashioned bar decorations. One of these old-fashioned decorations is a cigarette ad with a woman that looks a lot like my mom... even more so after a few drinks. Weird.  It's definitely an added plus that you can order dinner or snacks from Hank's across the street and eat them at the bar. They even make it easy by having menus all over the place. Try the blue cheese tater tots... yum. Now if Hank's would only deliver...  Long story short, Lush is not phenomenal, but it's a decent bar to have in the neighborhood.

p08F3g2_lSSdzyjnVcvt4w.review_text: There's not many seats in this place, but the crowd and decor is nice.  Drinks are reasonable also.  It gets super busy later in the night.

xSJr86JwAZk_iwFSifc0zQ.review_text: Bar hopping on Polk street for the first time in my life, and it made me nostalgic about this Sex and the City episode I'm going to quote, observe : "I scoured the crowd and saw them, people getting it, people trying to get it, and people who can't get it. No wonder the city doesn't sleep, it's too busy trying to get laid"   I went with my best friend and elite yelper Tiffany [exclamation point ] Van and we both agreed that we have never seen so many attractive men (that smiled back at us) in the same vicinity. And here I thought so much of anything in the immediate radius only applied to spiders.   Now on to the actual venue. The place has an upstairs complete with a banister that allows you to look down at the crowd and plot targets like a an electromyography exercise, in other words, you can spot the cute guy or girl and make your way down the stairs and move in for the kill. The place is modeled to resemble an old parlor and the crowd is about as electric as hipster district Valencia and won't fail to disappoint, whether you're trying to get laid or not lol.  Expect it to be crowded and expect problems trying to move through the crowd as blaring music will muffle any propriety such as "excuse me" or even in worst case scenario, they hear you and refuse to move anyway.  The drinks are reasonably priced, and by reasonably I mean reasonable for a place that doesn't list the prices at all on the overhanging menu.  The bartenders have a variable knowledge of pour mans friends and also showcased strong shots for $3 in lemonade dispensers. I'd stay away from those though because they tasted like licorice and gasoline.  One thing you may not know of is the ginger beer which tasted amazing! A strong and refreshing ginger taste, alcohol completely undetectable yet strong enough for a great buzz.

quuHWPfPzglszOBaa17DxQ.review_text: Good place for after work drinks.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Now I like Lush. Will I go again on a Saturday night? Not likely. But on a quiet weekday evening? Yes. The cocktails are really tasty, especially the girly ones that are my style. I tried to order the Lychee Pomegranate Martini and the bartender was cool enough to straight up tell me no. He told me that he could guarantee I wouldn't like it and just waste my money. Even though I like both of those fruits, I trusted his opinion and went with the Cantaloupe Cosmo, wow. Mmmhm, a winner in my book (or in my mouth, depending on how you want to look at it).  It's also super chill on weeknights- good for conversation and quick service. The only annoyance is the complaint I tend to have about the mirror being between the girls and boys bathrooms...don't people realize it's kind of awkward to look at yourself in the mirror while guys are coming in and out? Haha, last night one guy gave me a sheepish smile while I was attempting to fix my hair...yea mirrors in actual bathrooms are much cooler.

_FAfjiCDG1-PQDNyXS7zBg.review_text: On our last trip to SF my dear friend and fellow yelper Katie M. decided to treat my boyfriend and I to this tasty little place. I say tasty because she advised me to get the blueberry martini, in which they crushed real blueberries.... it was delicious. I also had the apple pie martini... equally delicious. While I can't visit since I'm back down at home, it doesn't stop me from craving these tasty drinks!

IIkRLmeoT8-7LY-U4kQ9qA.review_text: Cool spot. Yelp shows pic ls if this place really bust but every time I go it's pretty empty

CN1DtMOkoCZUJ7Cvdl_rww.review_text: I like this bar. It really defies definition. I mean yes it is a gay bar, or wait maybe it isn't. Everyone likes Lush Lounge and everyone feels comfortable going here? Perfect. The fancy cocktails are well made and delicious, because sometimes you really want something with fruit juices in it, usually this happens when you are about to get scurvy.  They also have a nice selection of tap beers including PBR for those of you who are classy.   The prices are fair, not dirt cheap by any means but fair and the bartenders are all decent fellows some of whom have buns of steel. YaY!  My favorite things however are the plaques with classic one liners peppered throughout the decor,  like this one: "You can lead a horticulture but you can't make her think"  Funny stuff.

cobDxWUVyfKdxmhBDaaKVg.review_text: I have lived down the street from this place and never tried it, mostly because the name makes it sound a tad bit sleazy. It wasn't at all though. The inside of the bar is kind of rustic with barrels as tables and game plants having from the ceiling.   We went during happy hour, so drinks were very reasonable. We got a gimlet, which was smooth and sweet; a dark and stormy, my favorite; and a sweet tea, which was served in a mason jar. Oh, and of course the $3 bud light. After happy hour, it gets more expensive, so I would probably only come before 7pm.  The bar wasn't crowded when we went, so we had no problem finding a barrel to talk around. The upstairs section was closed for some reason. Good play on their part, because now I will atleast go again just to sit upstairs. Like everyone else said, the music was good and not too loud.

UhZ7GR0CA-klNAlV3PE9_Q.review_text: All I can say is if you have a lot of money go there. It's over priced and drinks suck.  It's very over crowded that you can barely move.

JhRRBFvqpEmWUXrjHjRuUA.review_text: I don't get this place.  They spent a fortune to put chatskies on the walls.  Why did they put the fireplace in the middle of the room.  Way too many men, relative to women in there, for my level of comfort.

j3j3cs-frjfS3flHcmi4cw.review_text: Favorite spot on Polk! Love the deal on Tecate + a Tequila shot. Always a fun time and never that difficult to get in, though it's always crowded inside.

vRziAXWI72nOFWNml4ldMA.review_text: So a couple weeks ago decided to do happy hour at a different location than the usual places in and around FiDi. We decided lets do Polk St. Look online and decided on Lush Lounge.   Place wasn't packed for happy hour which was actually a good thing since we had our own group and they had a bunch of great happy hour specials and the drinks were great too. Bartendars were quick and poured great drinks. The space is decent with like a wood theme which was cool. The cool thing is if you can snag a table by the window on a nice day you can sit with the windows open.  So good drinks + good happy hour+ many other bars in the area to hop around to = a great time.   The funny thing is our group left and kinda dispersed depending on what they wanted to eat for dinner and we stopped in a couple other bars but we all ended up back at Lush Lounge.

GQm0XRRNgqBWgJU37Nlzlg.review_text: Pros:  -cool/hip interior- but not clubby/trendy -good selection of beers -well-mixed cocktails -nice, clean bathrooms -friendly, chill bartenders  Cons: -watery sangria   Verdict: totally solid happy hour, pre-late-dinner spot.

js4wjUqfNu4xJBu27KZKhg.review_text: I like this space.  It reminds me of the bars of my youth--Badlands in it's Western early phase, with raw wood and license plates (this place has no license plates) or the Mine Shaft;  cleaned up, reorganized, prettified and with interesting light fixtures.  The problem is, it isn't the old Lush Lounge.  There are bars, and then there are Bars.  In my life there is Hula's Bar And Lei Stand, under the Banyan tree--where I came out, and the Lush Lounge on Polk at Post, where I rediscovered bars.  This Lush Lounge is no doubt someone's special place, but while it's a unique space on mid-Polk's bar scene, it lacks the intimacy and campy elegance of the old space.  This is sad for a lot of reasons, especially given its new, west-side of Polk orientation which protects it from the sun which used to turn the old place into a sauna.  I have nothing negative to say about this place, it's just that it doesn't carry forward the magical, mystical place I used to love across the street.  Oh well. Maybe there will be some other special place, but it better hurry up or I'll be taking my gin through tubes and needles.

i0sCinT5tsi0fgZ7_vF1tQ.review_text: The best freaking blueberry martini in San Francisco.  No frills bar, but fun  overall.

VDL2_EeBJ3e7aDYDC2pk6A.review_text: Didn't spend too long in here when we hit up Polk Street so maybe a better review will come once I get the full experience. Decent music. Huge Bathroom Line. Two floors with decent amount of sitting space.  - Cash Only.

wv6T-DtVCg-zGuT1Sra5QQ.review_text: I love this place. They're always showing classic movies, playing great tunes, and have personable bartenders that make great drinks. I've gone here every year for my birthday since 2001? Wow, I'm gettin' old. See you there next January 9th.  They've moved up the street to 1221 Polk.  Very nice space. Can't do it if my B-day falls on a weekend tho'. Too many douchebags about.

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: I love finding a place in the Tender Nob that rises above the stigma of being smack dab in the middle of the ghetto. I don't know if Lush had a change in management or got a interior designer but the new layout is a million times better than the old. The flow of the crowd moves both in and out, the art work is rustic and old, and the bathroom design is smart and functional. If you need to wash your hands, you don't need to stand in line and hold up the line-it feels Ally McBealish.  I'm a fan of their lounge feel and the coziness of the seating. My friends and I frequent this place early in the night when we can and I've just become a fan of their sangria. They're one of the few bars that carries a wide array of vodkas beyond the usual Chopin, Belvedere, and Grey Goose. (But no Jennifer, they do not carry Hangar One vodka.)  Come early to stake out a cozy corner seat and I can guarantee you'll not feel the need to do any bar hopping of any sort. The drinks are made well, the noise level is really kept to a minimum because of the high vaulted ceilings, and your empty glasses are frequently taken care of by the floating busser. Who could ask for anything more?

jinq4OH3kCcpni1oA39gRQ.review_text: Loved Jack, the bartender. Got way drunker than I thought I would because the drinks were cheap and the service was great.

4PpcgLICU5-s4nIYsOV6kA.review_text: i love the lush lounge.  gin and tonic or mojito - my friend gets the lemon drop. we go there fairly often, so the bartenders know us... which means that we got to try a mango something or other. frozen mango martini? it was pretty dang good too, but the mojito is where it's at.  just don't be afraid of trannies, there's usually at least one or two.

XO-YWxq9Y8fY5u7OYXERdw.review_text: I used to love this place, I went there for years until the bartender was extremely rude to me twice in a row and actually called me crude names and now I will never go back!

4TJF62R5ytolOmiMWKtjGA.review_text: Free cover, good energy and busy! Drinks are a bit pricey and they only take cash. Interesting lighting, dim and rose colored. Plenty of space to move around and also a separate lounge upstairs -- not sure if it's reserved for VIP but we went up there close to closing.

rOqeQewALXadVWCbhWty0Q.review_text: Hi.   I really like this place because the doorman is always doing some sort of crossword puzzle or something intellectual. It makes me feel smart. for going to that bar. like a professor is the doorman or something.  Lush Lounge is where you can begin the night because they have some snazzy delicious cocktails, then proceed to literally crawl around Polk St. and guzzle beer at R Bar/Hemlock/Vertigo, and end up here again after your TL pub crawl so you feel like you ended the night with cla$$iness.  However the one gripe I do have is one of the bartenders isn't exactly Mary Sunshine, but perhaps he's just one of those good-looking-straight-bartender-don't look at me-worship me type of guys. Overall, it's a nice place to chill with friends or a date because it's cozy and unpretentious and it makes me happy.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: More space, same feel  Great move and keeping the ambiance of the original Lush Cash only bar still Like I said, same feel Drinks were good - $9 a pop for hanger lime & soda  Upstairs is a good place to kick it with the crew Nice mixed crowd

5GpOt6sv-fGZkNKxJFhVow.review_text: Lush Lounge is a place we can all get down.  I wouldn't make a destination of this place, but some of my best nights in SF have been at Lush Lounge. There is something so warm and comforting about the decor and when you're at the bar drinking a bellini being treated like gold by the bartenders and listening to LCD soundsystem and Debbie Gibson's "only in my dreams" comes on you realize you're in a special place.  Crowd tends to be an eclectic fun mix of gays, polk gulch regulars, russian hill peeps, and then there's always a couple people from the marina out there slumming it.   Big downside is there is one regular bathroom and it's hot as hell in there and there's always people hogging doing god knows what.  The drinks are deeelicious.  The crowd immediately outside the bar is not so savory.  Go here, cross over to Blur, and head down to 800 larkin and you got yourself a night my friend.

0tUcFr3FJDtfRA0uyytKpA.review_text: Thia bar gets me laid. I think it is the good drinks and the fact that as someone else has commented this bar is a crossroads for many communities. hence i am always meeting someone who has ended up there looking not just for a drink but for an adventure. you get the idea. plus english tourists get sent here by the hotels and i love me some english :).

zMCGoJQatu8fjgfvx4xeCQ.review_text: Not too fond of fruity drinks but you have to try their blended watermelon martini along with another one (don't remember what it was called but it was a white blend)!  Friendly, kick back vibe...worth checking out and cheap!

1Nl_Gw84Q8lrIY20P_wm_A.review_text: Classy Joint.  nice bartenders.  I love that they use fresh grapefruit for their greyhounds - not that shit from a bottle.  I also recommend the sweet home alabama tea... Delicious!

rtTpEZSTIDSurdw12xZK1Q.review_text: Been to Lush a couple times and its the spot on Polk! I love the variety of the crowd. Upstairs can be a bit crowded at times, but overall, I like this place!

I-0Be1dHEacp293TeRUDpw.review_text: Been here a couple times. Its nice, fun. Mixed crowd which is great. I would go again.

EMUp5b3Fzw3hd_y2vZtqyw.review_text: Who knew such a nice bar could be in a place like this? I love this place. It's small, intimate and cozy. Everyone is pretty friendly here, even the bartenders. The cocktails are delicious and the drinks specials are great.  I've always had a good time here just chatting it up with friends and strangers as I watch the people of Polk walk by. It's one of the few places where you can sit with regular, good looking folks and watch the transvestites and prostitutes get picked up and do crack deals. Good times...

PvK_Gq7vYqaYCzv5CyAGgg.review_text: Lush lounge is so lovely! Svetlana is awesome for a Friday happy hour, and it seems as if everyone who enters relaxes a bit, watches a minute of a classic film, enjoys some stale popcorn, and starts talking to the person sitting next to them. Leave it to raspberry slushy daiquiris to bring San Franciscans together. Congrats on Hanks as well-can't wait to check it out! PS-they make a killer martini here. Yuuummm.

h1EEmDWDHpy9aRUKeMC8OQ.review_text: Bewildered that I never wrote a review before. Old location had a shady scene but always entertaining to watch the "working ladys of night." Bartenders performance is phenomenal. They always seem to control the crowd and keep cool.  The rasberry truffle cocktail with real shaved chocolate is "Awe" ......"Some" The new location is devine. with pool tables upstairs and cozy fireplace downstairs. I even like the gothic front door that resembles a castle. good investment to move. but the douchebags may be more prevalent on weekends. wait im done writing. I think I'll grab a few libations at Lush now!

LlNd-JM-fxmXr22a4lT3vA.review_text: Thank god my favorite lush opened its doors right before NYE.  It was crowded on that Wednesday night and the space was great.  What can i say, i love this place unconditionally.  The fireplace adds a quaint charm and it is so nice to have the option to go upstairs to get away from it all.  I love the long communal bar table down the center.  It is just so much bigger and more open than the last location.  I didn't recognize any of the old bartenders, so i am hoping they might return soon!  Great bar...i love this bar

N25XbMni2oNugGBkO85Baw.review_text: When I see "lounge" I don't think of jampacked like sardines can't get through the door. I am not into shitshow bars, but it may have just been the night we were there. I like the decor and the space of this place, but I don't like the name. We only stayed for one drink, so I can't really review it much.  Communal sink in the bathroom is a little awkward. Hello, the bathroom is where the girls go to do girl talk!!!

KXSzTO-bi6_Fcysm0mEHpg.review_text: love the drinks but wasn't fond of their cash only policy (really :/?) the drinks were fairly priced and decent but the place is quite small.

z7KsQ_nfTZq6mm6ZPAk_Mg.review_text: Cool bar on Polk Street. Drinks are priced well, crowd is pretty relaxed. My friend had his birthday party here and he is a regular so anytime we go out we usually come here. Definitely a place to check out.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: Great girly drinks, hot bartenders, and the best, gayest decor ever. Would make Bobby Trendy proud. If you even know who Bobby Trendy is, then you're just as cheesy as I am. Let's be friends!  For those of you who don't know, this is a gay bar & you'll often be sitting next to very well dressed drag queens sipping mojitos. The vibe on the weekends can get very annoying so I prefer this place when it's quieter, when you can marvel at all of the classic film memoribila, chat with the friendly bartenders and sing along to Madonna. Occasionally you can chat up one of the old gay locals, who will reminisce about what the neighborhood used to be.

GfB6sC4NJQvSI2ewbQrDNA.review_text: The drinks are still great but it's not like what it used to be when they used to have live music on the stage above the bar.  Without the music it's just a standard bar with good drinks and a movie decor.   There's a bunch of bars in the area which are walking distance which is a good thing too.  Update: 8/12/06- Went there with some friends of mine and I ended up seeing 2 groups of friends by coincidence.  I had a great time.  The bartenders are great (gave me a free beer at the end) and it's never too loud so you can talk.  A great hang it is.

s1DSkbdFEuO3ODbMWQqSvw.review_text: Really fun drinks, but they definitely have that "concocted" feel - this is not a fresh pure juice drink place. The mojitos are too sweet for me, but I do enjoy the chocolatey martinis - there are several good ones. The bartenders can also be really big jerks - so watch out.

xyTgJUyW9nPV1wbnr9u-_A.review_text: All I can say is blueberry martini! The bartender here is awesome. Perfect blend of blueberry vodka, bit of lemon juice, and 3 berries. They also had these tasty slushy vodka mixes- I highly suggest the mango. I love the quirky art hanging all over the wall and ceiling. Very kitschy. Music wasnt too loud. This place has an air of history, very nice. Nice to get away from Castro sometimes..

JgPUVaNG4vArVLVO7uR9nw.review_text: September 5th, 2010 @ 12am. What does that mean? I AM LEGALLY 21!  First stop to pop my legal drinking cherry? LUSH LOUNGE! I happily showed me ID to the bouncer who wished me a happy birthday and my friends began to buy me drink after drink. They all came so fast and I downed them so fast, which meant the bartenders were quick! Greatly appreciated! They have a lounge area upstairs, which is where we spent most of our time before hitting up the bar next door. I really loved the ambiance here and I actually liked the crowd...at least from what I can remember.

dl9Czk44TOVBLOmTXjB1qA.review_text: Lush gets a solid 5 on consistency alone.  I've never had a bad time here.  I've never brought anyone here that didn't love it too.  Lush is the place I bring everyone with full knowledge that any and all will be pleased.  I like it less crowded than more crowded.  Most recently, I brought 7 folks from all over the place.  We were accommodated easily.  I've never used it as a pickup joint, but I can see how someone could easily do so.  Bonus points for the trannies outside who hit on my 100% oblivious straight friend who is new to SF.  Lush is MY bar.  Great all-purpose meetup spot.  The drinks are creative, the bartenders are awesome, and it's convenient and easy to find.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: The name Lush Lounge couldn't be more perfect for this hip bar in the Tenderloin. I hadn't been since they changed locations and let me tell you, what a difference the new venue has made.   The decor is over-the-top awesome and most definitely feels like you've stepped in to some sort of lush haven. With quotes on the wall from Dorothy Parker like, "I wish I could drink like a lady. I can take one or two at the most. Three and I'm under the table. Four and I'm under the host," the walls provide you with perpetual amusemetn.   Happy hours are pretty darn good:  $2 PBR and Tecate, $3 glasses of wine, $4 glasses of champagne and a $5 selected martini. Don't take my word for it, check it out!

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: During out night out for Last Comic Standing we went bar hopping on Polk and Van Ness.  Lush Lounge was the best bar we stopped at.  It was early around 5 or so but the bar was lively but not crazy, the music was good but you were still able to talk, rustic bar, brick wall, upper level with a very nice clean atmosphere.  The place was nicely decorated with lots of chotchkies but everything was show cased perfectly.  And for happy hour pricing you can't beat $2 Tecate beers in the city.  Next time I'm back in that area I must try one of their special martini's.  They had flavors I haven't seen before, like cucumber and melon.

y_3K7pFI0hqlsOA97DUcaA.review_text: love it. when i want a girly drink this is the spot for me to go. twice tonight.  i've been really diggin' margaritas lately, but i sprang for the cucumber gimlet (delicious!) because i need to branch out...but when i came back for the second time i got that margarita and needless to say it did not let me down (divine) and bartender Jack is super awesome (and way cute! think sylar from heroes just even better looking) will i be back? yes. especially for happy hour.  the ONLY reason i didn't give this place 5 stars is because i am poor. so really it should have 5 stars and i should have 2. so im gonna fix that before i send my review.

clFehAg0EJkBuTuOb5exKw.review_text: Came by this neighborhood hot spot yesterday while waiting for my classmates to meet me which they failed to do so. Well, it's still happy hour and I'll have a few drinks anyways. I love their cantaloupe martinis but they're mandarin happy hour cosmos are just as good. I have to say the place can get a bit rowdy with mid-day drunk revelers but it's wonderful to stop by when walking around the Polk.

5j3u2aipdabEQ9hYCOQjLA.review_text: Great music, great decor, great drinks!  I mean there aren't may places in the city you can find fresh squeezed lemon drops for $ BUCKS!  Yep, that is it, $5 BUCKS I will be back!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Um, came here drunk.  But I do remember they have really good specialty martinis and mixed drinks.  Reading other Yelp reviews, I think I need to go back here again.  Had fun here with other drunk friends.  I think we were definitely THOSE people that night, the ones people laugh at.

MATQEGmQcVVT2ASAYTfWfg.review_text: This bar is great! Jack the bartender rocks ! Me and my Uncle and GF come to this bar everytime we are in San Francisco. The drinks are as good as they get. Its like eating at a candy store so many choices.

gG-Qc3fFtixrZFOCjyc2Dg.review_text: This is a pretty upscale bar for the area. In general, the clientele was more typical bar goers  and less crackhead chic. I was a bit confused though about who I was talking with...She/he seemed like a fairly attractive female but had a surprisingly deep voice. Interesting conversation. They didn't have a cover on new years and it was a pretty good place to be. There are plenty of places to stand around and rest your drink...and some good lighting. Fairly clean if that is important to you.

R_S07piLpe_LHU0yKyYOzg.review_text: I probably spent a whopping thirty minutes in here after loading up on other alcoholic beverages at another lounge up the street.  I had a good buzz going and that came to an end after Lush Lounge's juke box played Miley Cyrus.  Instant. Buzz. Kill.  Even more so when four twenty-somethings decided to start dancing.  For the record, I was not one of them.   Had I had one more martini at the other place, maybe I would have been the fifth person dancing...or not.  Lush Lounge has one bathroom stall for the women (and one too for the guys of course) and a community sink to share with the boys.  I might come back here if I'm checking out other joints on Polk and want to try one of your specialty martinis...or not.

VM_5lJvlN1GFQXbg_iZx2A.review_text: Out of all the Polk Street bars I visited one night, I have to say that the boys at this bar were the cutest. Except for one guy who thought he was Barney from How I Met Your Mother.   I would have really liked to stay and drink... but you just made it impossible! Let me see if I can explain this well: There is a divider (was it a table or something?) in the middle of the space parallel to the bar. The space from the bar to the divider was about 20 ft? Maybe more but I couldn't tell with all the people crammed together. This meant that in order to have access to the bar you would have to maneuver your way around the divider. Unfortunately, Californians are lazy and they refuse to leave the bar after they've received their drink making this little area a freaking mosh pit. This divider also conveniently located in the walkway to the bathroom.   I really wanted to stay, Lush, but you just weren't laid out right.

7tEUgFoRzy_TkOgzPQzCkA.review_text: Your "run of the mill" lounge/bar.  I don't even really know what to say, they have a decent happy hour and the bar is clean.  The bartenders were average.  They only have two, single restrooms, which kinda bugs since it isn't a small place.  Anyhoo, three stars.

XmedPAJrptlUt9ZoaF3FNQ.review_text: Loved the old Lush but the new one makes me want to become a lush! I love this new spot it is fabulous and one that should be a destination for the after work crowd or when you just feel like having a cocktail. I am in love with the cucumber kissed cocktail. Don't even know the exact name of it but yummy! In fact the cucumbers can be used for the eyes when finished as you can see from my photo.   I have been twice in the same weekend and will be back three and four and five and eighteen more times!   Oh and the help isn't too bad on the eyes either. You may need those cucumbers for the puffiness caused from the eye candy!

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: WG: Weird Guy next to me. Me: Me.  WG: Hey, you from around here? Me: Yep, born and raised. WG: Where'd you go to school? Me: Up the hill, at SH. WG: Looks like you got a lot of guys here for just one girl. Me: *WTF?* Uh, yeah, I guess we'll work on that. WG: So how'd a Catholic school boy end up at a tranny bar like this? Me: Uhhhh, it's just a bar. WG: *looks around as if to hint I hadn't noticed where I was* Not really, kid. Me: Uh, well, it is Polk St. It's not exactly a big deal. WG: *turns away, apparently disappointed that I wasn't scared of The Gays (TM)*  Fun times.  If it helps you picture this, WG looked like Daddy Warbucks.  Lush is one of those places where my closeted musical theater diva can come out.  Everything about this place is gay in both senses of the word, yet somehow it's really not a gay bar.  IIRC, the bartenders can be iffy, but everything else about this place- the decor, the drinks, the clientele- is friendly and fabulous.

swz3xh7FW-_jLOmuaR2_BA.review_text: I live nearby so I walked by Lush's new place to see the progress of construction pretty much everyday. We were all worried (or I was) that new bigger place may loose the cozy cuteness full of pretty stuff feeling the old Lush had. I was peeking from the window to see what kind of table they will have and bar stools... interiors...and mmmm....  Now I went 3 times since they reopened. Weekday and weekends. First of all, I really like the new heavy wood door. It's like going into a castle. New Lush makes me proud! I would still name Lush is the best bar in San Francisco and Sami's Coconut Mojito is the best in the city. I truly can not wait to see their new menu! Hurry up!  It's a bit weird to compare but just it's just like going to Starbucks to make sure you get (or Peet's if you prefer) a good cup of coffee, if I want to make sure I get great cocktail, I go to Lush.  You can tell the bar and bartender there loves cocktails. They always inventing new stuff and they are creative and all tasty. Not only that, they are nice and friendly, too. How about that!  Anyway, We Lush lovers are so happy the new Lush is giving us the satisfactions of comfort and fun time and alcohol cravings. You know!

hXa7kc9pcLP9U3AQ5gyk0A.review_text: A friend and I walked into this place for happy hour one day.  It looked like a cool dive but at the time we didn't know it was a gay hangout, so be warned if you're not into that sort of thing.  But it isn't all gay, hell I went there strictly for the drinks because they were so damn delicious!  The bartenders would take forever to make your drink, but at least I could see that he was making everything from scratch --- squeezing the limes, peeling the lemons.    They used to have a lounge piano player every Friday night.  He was an old man, and we used to sip on our pina coladas and wonder how much longer he could play before arthritis got the better of him.  Last time I went I think a few of the bartenders had left and the drinks didn't taste as good anymore.  But yeah, totally chill, totally mellow if you are looking for a downbeat place.

NNhzAqtzKABQKmVp7vJTlw.review_text: Seriously one of my all-time fav's, this place is awesome b/c it has two modes, crazy busy w/ peeps on a Sat & Fri night, or chill'n and down to earth on every other night, the fact that they don't hassle you at the door w/ ID's and crap helps but the real gem is the fact they have a kick ass bartender in Barry, who also has a thick Irish accent, overall the place makes you feel at home while still feeling like an upper class bar/lounge. Go there, get a nice Old Fashioned for yourself and a Sweet Tea cocktail for your lady. Oh but remember, Cash Only... Yo*

lfVoeeBiBj-PNdeNTupoTw.review_text: something is wrong with me. I can't stop drinking...

rx0fVqzQUB6LNfKEKJ5hqQ.review_text: Ever tried an oatmeal-cookie martini? If not, head over to Lush Lounge immediately.  The chocolate shavings on top help this (incredibly potent) martini taste uncannily like a cookie. But there are lots of reasons to try Lush - the mojitos (also very strong), the free bowls of popcorn, the great happy hour prices, the leafy hanging plants, the long polished bar, the big windows made for people watching the corner of Polk and Post, and the friendly bartenders who know the locals by first name.  You want to be where you can see the troubles are all the same...

s3XmVL8UT5duKjPaQp43cg.review_text: Such a great place to spend a sunny afternoon enjoying a perfect Bloody Mary or two... Wonderful decor, good music, cozy size, good location, fun clientele, great bartender.  Considering I enjoyed Lush Lounge so much during the day, I certainly need to see what the story is at night. I will update...

XiowopmvOieITqbnRyeS8A.review_text: Homemade margaritas @ The Lush Lounge are fantastic. Fresh lime, agave, and tequilla in the heart of San Francisco, what's not to like? Remember to bring cash... No cards.

iFVzps70vJVc7Ss3xhsxSA.review_text: Came here with some newly single girlfriends to scope out the sea of male prey, and boy, was the sea vast.  The male to female ratio at this place was about 5:1, and yet my girlfriends somehow left with their dignity intact.  Bachelorette #1 wanted someone tall, dark, and handsome.  What a surprise.  Bachelorette #2 wanted someone she'd like to include as a character in her book.  Bachelorette #3 wanted someone hairy.  Really, really hairy so she could have something to grab.  I just wanted a stiff drink for less than $20.  I love the Alabama Sweet Tea and the bouncer who told me I look just like my 16-year-old self on my driver's license.  I'll drink to that.  That and a bar bathroom I actually want to pee in!

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: Yummy drinks like chocolate martinis and grasshoppers are perfect for girly girls and guys.  Cozy and popular without being so crowded you can't hear your conversation.  Wish it was in a better neighborhood but it's really not that big of a deal.  Cheap drinks and decent bartenders make me forget panhandlers and transients anyway.

IDhcaHM7KG4EDmWf9b3c0A.review_text: Came far a birthday party - the party took over the upstairs. The space was fantastic -the drinks even better.  I loved my mojito and my friend's cantaloupe margarita was amazing as well.

--4q8EyqThydQm-eKZpS-A.review_text: What a cool, hip, nice place. I've walked past this place millions of times and never thought to go in. The old ugly super cheap sign sent out vibes of dirty, divey, sketchiness. The GNC and the dark doorway don't help.  A few weeks ago I actually looked inside and saw a good mix of people including a fair amount of scantily clad BeBe dressed Marina bitches and popped collared Jaegar bombing douche bags - so I thought, this place can't be that sketchy if these ex-sorority and fraternity gods took it upon themselves to travel down from Mount Olympus and mingle with us normalings.  Checked it out last weekend during the afternoon. What a nice place.  Wonderfully decorated. Nice chill music. Huge windows and window seating, perfect for people watching while sipping your $6 Sweet Home Alabama Tea deliciousness.  Last night I went back again. My friends were having a joint birthday party. Man, was it packed?! Great mix of people. Good music. Nice bartenders and bouncers. Despite the huge crowd, I had no problem getting a drink.   Good place. Yep, I am a fan!

2l0O1EI1m0yWjFo2zSt71w.review_text: If I lived in one of the houses on Scenic Dr. in Carmel by the Sea or Pebble Beach my house would be named Lush Lounge, so fitting.  Yes, a lot of the houses by the beach have names like "Sea Urchin" or "Periwinkle".  Awesome bar with a kick-back and relax feel. It was cold out so I stood with my drink in hand by the fireplace and it warmed me to my bones, perfect.  The bartender was very warm and inviting and seriously pleasing to the eye. I enjoyed a shot of Blood Orange infused vodka and a glass of Champagne. Great place to get to know someone (lady friends were flirting it up with the boys) and thus place works because it not too rowdy or loud so you can hear everyone around you. Killer bar to chillax.

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: This is a cool venue to rent out for parties or events. They provide a 30 person seating area at the front of the bar or a bigger area in the mezzanine. I went for their blood orange cosmo, which might have had a little too much bitters because it was bitter and sweet at the same time. I did enjoy it, but one was enough for me. I also really liked the music they were playing. It's not the normal dancing music on the radio, which is refreshing. The place had people coming and going all night. All of my friends had a great time and I heard the mojito was delicious!!

MEvU_vgvK1Vq5Bown2OVUg.review_text: Fun bar on a Saturday night.  It's not as packed as a lot of the similar bars because it's pretty big and has two levels.  Came here with about a dozen friends for my birthday and we all had a great time.  The only thing I wish they had was credit card acceptance - cash only is a killer.  Place has good sangria and specialty drinks for girls.  Beers selection is okay.  Most importantly, you can actually hear other people talk!  Most of these types of lounges blast music so loud you can barely hear yourself think.  It's impossible to talk to anyone without screaming.  While there is music playing it's not overpowering - other bars should take notice.

7zluAZzHmt2THQjvAkQbNQ.review_text: Pretty fun bar. Always old movies on. Tons of specialty drinks, especially martinis. Kind of small but its usually not hard to get seats when people leave. ATM inside. Two bathrooms, one of which is Mens only.   Only real bummer is the excessive amount of bums that bother you when you go out to smoke. Personally I find an enjoyment of interacting with bums after a bunch of drinks, but one time some crazy tried to rob me and my friends...with some nail scissors. Too bad he didn't realize there was a cop standing 5 ft. away, who batted the scissors out of his hand and frisked him and told him to get lost.   But the corner of Post & Polk offers a variety of interesting characters, namely the trannies. Last time i was at the Lush I witnessed a great fight between the bartender and a tranny, who claimed that she was ripped off by the bartender. Not so much a fight as he just did his best to take the punches while pushing her out and locking her out until the cops got there. But hey, its the Tenderloin! If crazy but fun is your kind of thing, this is your kind of place.

TEECUlSuWsbsPOlTmcDL_A.review_text: The bar is pretty okay, but the staff is awful. the bartender not only did scream to me and my friends saying that he could not give us a beer because the bar was going to close in 20 minutes but also he was treating everybody around us pretty bad.

fwtwvFZdlykzQVMLcKE22g.review_text: Pretty relaxed bar, I went on a Sunday (early evening). Quick and efficient service. My drink came in a cute mason jar mug. Will definitely have to come on a busier night next time.

O8i10nA3Dh1bfqF1IWWvrA.review_text: If I could give .5 of a star lush would get 3.5. I highly recommend the mojito...supposedly one of the best in the city, hot damn, I agree! I have this friend who thinks I put too much pressure on the joint and the drinks and set my expectations too high...I totes disagree and think people should go to yelp expecting a damn fine mojito and that's what they will get. Oh, and the bartenders were uber cute. The space is a tad small and I started to feel all claustrophobic...but clearly I should have had another beverage. the jungle atmosphere was a bit disturbing but the old movies playing in the background was a great touch.   3.5 stars all the way.

_j1KnsWLVz3AU1mmm0G0JQ.review_text: A cool and fresh place to stop and get a drink.  As many of it's other patrons may say, this place is "Hip", "Yummy", "AWEEESSSSSOOOOOMMMMEEEE!!", and "Chillin" which I think anyone who's in the area should really stop by and check it out.   If I was to compare it to a place (Or places) in LA, then it's a mix of Velvet Margarita and Cafe 24 (which are also both within a block of each other!)  Def check it out and get a drink, if you can get a spot by the bar, there's plenty of space. And their libations are on average $8 also note try to park close to this place, or any of the locations near here (it lessens your chance of getting your car broken into).... OR.... you can go New Yorker style and take BART and walk the 20 blocks.  Enjoy!

lOvuUhY1_ujlT6uNW3u0AA.review_text: Liked this place a lot!  Right on Polk street where a lot was going on already,  it had a little bit of a rustic feel (in a California way if that makes sense) with lots of exposed wood. They had a good selection of drinks (negroni - my fav), eclectic crowd and friendly bartender.

tMOuv9A8TC-rvMQ5KrD3hw.review_text: Ahh, I love this place! Every drink on the menu sounds delicious so if you're feeling a cocktail, I'd definitely check this place out. Despite being busy, the bartenders are really attentive and I didn't have a problem flagging one down. The only downsides were that it gets really crowded (a lot of times I just end up skipping Lush when we're out on Polk because it's way too crowded) and they only take cash.

nHnNraNUct25HJJTRAGYkA.review_text: Lush had super friendly bartenders, super friendly customers, and super friendly drinks! Their signature mojito was out of this world, as well as some crazy margarita (I forgot the name - see the picture). It's a little on the small side so it gets crowded quickly, but the people are chill enough to make it bearable. I also want to comment on all of the plants in the window! Huh??

9ho6UZdAr4KeLmSKYq90mw.review_text: Lush Lounge will make you a drag queen spotting, green thumb growing, crafted and built cocktail craving fool.  This place has charming bartenders, a wonderful peaceful atmosphere - pleasantly contrasting the neighborhood outside.  The cocktail list is impressive and they have fresh garnishes and a juice press.  Their gourmand enablers will provide you with a watermelon, canteloupe or apple martini.  If you haven't had dessert yet try a chocolate martini.  Ask for a special margarita.  You will not be sorry, but you will leave with a smile.  The fabulous rainforest plants adorn the place with a little life, ommiting the bleak tenderloin.  Drag queen watching is a plus - with the fabulous DIVAS parading accross the street.  Everything beautiful indeed.  Did I mention that the bartenders are fantastically nice?  Get off your websurfing butt and grab a cocktail.  You go GIRL!

zfeER0mpm5M1U3gEgjnpdw.review_text: They don't strain the mojitos, so you get shredded mint stuck in your teeth. Some people like that.

ybnJoXphDsVeg299y5A3hQ.review_text: I came on Saturday night on the night of Santacon, to join up with a friend's bar/lounge crawl. The place was literally packed with bodies. The line was the length of the place, but unlike my friends, I came later and managed to get in twice, never waiting that long either time.  Did not get any drinks as I was already quite sloshed, so no comment there.  They have good music here and a good atmosphere for dancing. I may have done the most public pooping of my life, accompanied by cheering, because there was no stall, just a room with 2 urinals, a sink and a toilet -_-

58v49MNYAJXxzxNsJvsoKA.review_text: Really Cozy, Fun little spot. Great for pub crawling down polk/geary.  They started charging a cover on Halloween... luckily we got in before that! I like the little staircase that leads to nowhere in there. It's hella random and a cute little nook. It got a little too crowded though so we took off. But I'll definitely go back!

jkr3YVCEoRNKkxinUZpW6A.review_text: Polk Street has really blown up lately, hasn't it?  But I still love the lower Polk for a bar crawl, and Lush Lounge is my absolute favorite on the block.    It's a chill place, drinks are cheap(er) and oh, the sweet tea vodka!  Try it, you will love it too.

efeXIVU3KSA18bBU8egnEg.review_text: My homegirl decided to celebrate her birthday at Lush Lounge last Friday night, so I went there for the first time and I must admit I had a pretty good time there.  Our party was chilin' in the upstairs area which, in spite of being a small space, suited our gathering pretty well seeing that there was adequate room to accommodate all of my my friend's guests.  However, the bar area is rather small and was pretty cramped, mainly because of the set-up; there is a counter right in the area by the bar, which creates a small space on both sides of it that one must navigate through in order to get to the upstairs lounge or the restrooms.    The fact that there was no cover charge and that the dress code doesn't seem to be too strict were both definite pluses.  Although I didn't try many different drinks, the tequila sunrise I had was tasty; since I'm a lightweight, it also gave me the buzz i needed to relax.  The bottom line is that I would say the Lush Lounge is a cool place for hitting up when you're in the mood for chillin' with your friends and enjoying a drink.

5qhe-dxEj_7kpyqQcPU-iw.review_text: I dropped by Lush on a recent Saturday night. The area is a little sketchy, but you can find parking within a few blocks. The cocktails were pretty good. The shots were a little pricey ($9-10 avg).   I can't say much for the crowd. It was about 80% guys that night, but probably due to a friend's birthday celebration. It was a little cramped in there, but there were a bunch of seats all around.   fyi - Someone tried to pay with credit card and they said cash only!

vAfCCm-sJ-fZCi6PrC38Uw.review_text: The right place for the right time. It all depends on what you are looking for. They have a great variety of drinks, some great specials, and plenty of room with a pretty unique environment. Great place to catch up for happy hour, but also seems to be good for the late night partiers too.

RDwgEc8o15O2wqu-YQu29Q.review_text: In memory of some of the coolest bartenders ever.. Rami and Sammy (brothers/bartenders/SF Legends) Ok maybe not legends but they are some cool mofos no less...  So a year and a half ago I moved to the City.  Not wanting to rush into things, I put myself up in a hotel off Van Ness.  The first night I wondered around the neighborhood... Route 101?  Damn, I see 7 people 6 doods all older than my pops.. nope not tonight... I keep on keepin on, make a left on Post, crossed Polk and what did I run into?  LUSH.  I headed in and feel like I  never left the place, until I moved to the Western Addition.  I must have went back every night... that's how much I enjoyed Lush.  I still head back every so often... usually, when I don't want to bring a lady to my area or to say hello to these magnificent bartenders.... I had one of the most amazing nights at Lush... sitting talking it up for like 3 hrs about anything and everything with this person.  I was blown away that I'd met someone like this on that particular corner (no not the trannies)... It was so crazy I had to tell my co-workers about it the next day.. Co-worker,"So who is this amazing woman?" Me,"Umm.. actually his name is Barry and he's gay" CW,"Umm Gabe you might want to move back to Oakland" Me,"not like that not like that" CW,"yaa,, that's how it starts.. next you'll be bring him to the company party" Never that never that...  I'll enjoy myself anywhere I'm at, even if it's a lounge that use to have drag queen shows upstairs... (didn't know that until I read a review about the place sometime later) I love the old classic movies, the martini's, the ladies, people watching, and everything else about Lush.  At least I know I'm attractive to men and women.. lol I think my head just got a little bit bigger.  Thank you Lush. I've been told the brothers moved back to Italy.  If so, Lush will never be the same!

-JXgni3R6U_AQ4vx0KMRWA.review_text: Had a buddy of mine in town and decided to hit Polk for a change.  Heard about Lush and decided to give it a go.  The Sazerac is one of my favorite drinks, but few if any seem to do it right in this town.  Absinthe is about the only place I've had a good Sazerac.  Well, they got it pretty correct here.  Decent Rye whiskey (Rittenhouse?).  A touch of anis liqueur.  Peychaud bitters (critical - as the hint of anis is very important to the flavor profile and develops further with the addition of Peychaud).  Touch of sugar.    Lemon twist (oils into the glass and rub the rim).  Our bartender also made sure to stir (and not shake), which is also important.  Then ... the only mistake in my mind.  A martini glass was used.  It needs to be a tumbler glass.  But all was forgiven as the drink turned out fine.  Recommended.  Good atmosphere.  Spacious.  Low key crowd.  Fireplace.  Upstairs area as well.  Smiling bartender.  All good.

xik_WJSFN61tDVwYORq7OA.review_text: Meh. Would not return. There are way better places in SF/south bay/peninsula. Went there on a Saturday and they were playing the news on TV. I'm all for the news but at a bar/lounge?  - The crowd. Lots of dude bros. Kind of a skeevy feel. - No dance floor but it was way too loud to have a conversation. Ended up spending the whole night yelling at people who were a foot away from me. Also, not enough seating nor standing room. What's the point of having really loud (also, bad) music playing when no one is dancing and no one can talk? - Only one bathroom.   + No cover.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: They have this incredible Bloody Mary that looks like a whole freakin' salad - the giant celery stick plus about twenty other acoutrements!  I like this place, it's low-key and fun, and last time I was there they were playing "Mommy Dearest" on the TV.

P9Y602xjKtSXwU72EwrMGA.review_text: Very cool bar in my hood, McTeagues is my local haunt but Lush is up there & definitely a contender. Great wood finish to the bar & follow that up with awesome bar staff & your in for a great nights drinking.

1oesrOIBYtaJUr2Ug5aioQ.review_text: Lush is probably my favorite spot in the Polk Gulch/Tendernob area. The bartenders are friendly and efficient, the drink selection is great, and the people watching is entertaining to boot. The crowd here is definitely a motley crew: gay and straight, young and old... you name it, Lush has it! One of my favorite cocktails here is the Cantaloupe Martini: citrus vodka, watermelon schnapps, and orange juice. It's sweet, but not overly so, and tastes remarkably like cantaloupe! The proximity of this bar to Divas across the street (yelp.com/biz/aVO_-SlozVu…) ensures that a night at Lush is never boring. Be sure to check out the movie memorabilia covering the walls.

17dx_x9W_7QBT-3oiQQEQQ.review_text: Absolutely gorgeous space, unfortunately lost a bit of previous charm in the process.  Two huge losses:  First off, what's with the big screen TVS blaring the sports? If my memory serves me correct, the old location would play old movies- It was really great that it didn't draw that sports crowd...  Also, what made Lush a standout in its round 1 location was its phenomenal drink menu.  When I rounded up a group of people to come check out the new digs, I wasn't able to remember any of the good drinks, there was no menu, and a new bartender who didn't know the old drinks?   I'm sure there's a menu on the way, but it was a letdown for the group I had persuaded to come try the most creative and delicous drinks in town.  On the plus side, the new space is beyond gorgeous with a fireplace to boot, the best bartenders from the old location are back in town and serving up the works (unfortunately just not for said experience)  All in all, still one of the best bars on Polk- I anticipate this becoming a new hotspot once word gets out it's re-opened.

QzWHRRZGzYkhdrQRCzb1Yw.review_text: if it weren't for the rudest most stuck up bartender i have ever been in the presence of i would say this place wasn't so bad.  yeah, you know who you are (skinny, dark straight long hair, braces).  "We all make margaritas the same way."  No you don't.  If you weren't too busy flipping your hair around and sticking your nose up to the air high on yourself you would have taken a minute to listen to my request.  Your very nice male counterpart had made me two top shelf margaritas with very little sugar and other ingredients that I am sensitive to.  the next time some once kindly says to you, " I don't mean any disrespect, but would you mind if the other bartender makes my drink" you might want to get off your high horse and think about someone other than yourself.  instead you slammed down the well tequila and started pouring my drink pissed off and ego hurt like blabbing about how you all make them the same at the same time pouring something completely different from what i was drinking.  such a B.... that I had to walk away from you because I can't handle that bad energy from someone serving me something i am about to ingest.  when i tell you how i feel you then snap your fingers at the bouncer to throw me out because you can't handle being wrong.  not sure how you even have a job treating people that way.

cVErDLDF4I0N3pikaQzWwA.review_text: ********************edit 7/6/07*************************************** Wow.  I can't believe I had to take away my original 5-star rating and put it at 1.  This is how angry I am at the way I have been treated the last two times I've been there.  I don't know what happened to the nice bartender, perhaps he works a different night.  But last Friday took the cake.  I guess you are getting your wish, Lush--maybe if you continue to treat *shock* *gasp* straight, cute women like dirt and make a point of ignoring them while they wait to be served at your empty bar, they will stop coming.  I know I will.   Even nicer was how the bartender looked at me with my money out, ignored me and went to talk to his friends at the end of the bar.  I also love how the 2nd bartender or barback, saw me, then proceeded to vaccum the floor behind me for 5 minutes, then ask two guys next to me if they wanted anything else.    When I was a bartender, I only ignored patrons that stiffed me or were rude and obnoxious.  As I had just arrived and did not do either of these things, I can only think of it as discrimination.  Nice bar, you jerks. __________________________________________________­__ Friendly bar staff.  One bartender always remembers me and that is cool after only being there what 3 times?  Yummy, cheap frozen martinis (made with grain or Velikoff I'm sure) that give you a quick buzz.  Good mojitos, love the yummy Mango margaritas.  Popcorn and movies during happy hour. Not bad.

VQXCtGSsfUHtrzj7_VNQmA.review_text: This place is pretty stupid. But it doesn't suck. This is like a fifteen-year-old kid's idea of a fifty-five-year-old gay man's lifestyle. Which somehow winds up being the actual lifestyle of a fair number of fifty-five-year-old gay men. Hence the crowd here, sipping frozen martinis in all their cartoonish glory.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: cute unique corner bar with a lot of style and a fun crowd. i came here with a friend of mine who is gay, so i expected it to be mostly men, but it wasnt. the crowd was mixed equally with both gay and straight people. its dark and cozy with a nice decor and good windows for people watching all the trannies across the street at Divas.

LFNh1R6I2rcMvWmD5QlMgA.review_text: Ended up at this bar  while searching for a place to sit and relax with a drink to ease our post-Day-2-of-Outside-Lands fatigue. We passed it the first time, assuming it wouldn't be so great judging from the dark, run-down feel of the outside. However, we noticed there was a constant flow of people wanting to go in, so we decided to give it a try. I think it was a bit early in the evening -- around 10? -- so there was ample seating upstairs. We scored the corner booth seat and grabbed a couple beers (mediocre variety to choose from) from downstairs. The music isn't so loud that we would have to yell to be able to hear each other yet just loud enough to give it the divey feel to mark it a good night. As the night progressed and each time we went downstairs to get more drinks from the bar, it was getting increasingly more (very much more) crowded. We ended up having a lot more fun than we had expected and will definitely be trying Lush again in the future.

Ym2XTrrFjXkoyauSRNbo5g.review_text: We went here before a concert and really liked the ambiance.  The drinks were mixed really well (believe me - a LOT of places don't know how to make a proper drink) and the bartender was really nice and cool.  Bummer they don't have a funky food item (like chips or cheese curls) I think that would make it kitchier.    There weren't a lot of people when we got there (again, before a concert) but I will have to check it out later at night when I'm back in SFO.  All in all, great drink combinations.

J5MJGJr939qH0XfBqEC81A.review_text: I love this bar, I really do. It's got a good vibe. It took me about 4 visits to realize it had a rainbow outside. Either way, there's such a good mix of peeps here. I always meet some foreigners here and Katie M. knows how I feel about accents. They've always got some fruity cocktail on special and they've got a decent selection of drafts as well. There is always some random movie playing on the TV.   Minus one star for being a cash only bar. They do have an ATM in the back, but that just adds $4 in fees to my evening.   Minus another half star for always being so damned crowded, but I'm not going to dock them for that! I like to round up.

6tgKc3hK1qi1l3SFE1DTug.review_text: Updated 2/9/08: No more David, the bartender :( This makes me pretty sad actually. I still come here now and then during the week but steer clear on weekends. It's way too packed and the crowd is weird. I use this place as more of a sit and have a drink alone while thinking at the bar. Basically, Sunday-Wednesday would be the night to go for me. ------ My friends and I found this bar while on a Tenderloin Pub Crawl. A year later and we have become regulars.
