Maybe it's because my best friend and her sister live right across the street or maybe it's because the bartenders are hot and nice and well--when the bartenders think you are cool, all in the world is right for a drunkard, if ya know what I mean.  There are tons of girly drinks, including two slurpie machines that are contantly churning cheap chilled boozie goodness. I've done more shots here than I can count though so you aren't relegated to the foo foo stuff. I usually just trust the bartenders to get me drunk off whatever they want to pour and I've never been let down.   Go here. Say hi to David. Maybe you'll see me and my clan of drunk girl friends sometime.

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: The whiteboard in the front window of Lush Lounge advertises their signature libations, with a strong emphasis on strong martinis: Watermelon, Lemondrop, Raspberry Truffle.  They all sound so fruity and delicious--healthy, really--that I'm tempted to stop in on my walk to work in the mornings.  It's a temptation I resist, though, until the sun sets or the weekend arrives, and then I find Lush to be a reasonably priced and proximally convenient place to get a Polk Gulch Appletini.  Extra draw for streetside eye candy: Lush sits kitty-corner from Divas, everyone's favorite transgender dance club.

kf7LReNOwTBndcQlwxO6sg.review_text: i don't get it.  this place isn't "almost gay" at all b/c there really isn't anything gay about straight girls awkwardly making out with other straight girls, especially while looking like they hope to be perceived as adventurous and thus, turn men on.  speaking of dudes, the men here on a friday night were as sleazy as we expected the men here on a friday night to be.   it's ok if you're straight and live in sf... you don't have to pretend that a place is "sort of gay" so you feel more trendy going there.  have some confidence in your mainstream sexuality, and acknowledge you're at yet another hetero-late-20's-verging-on-yuppie tl spot.

zuQVsFDlTwu15L1jcpo3Iw.review_text: Chill atmosphere, great drinks and in the middle of everything. Great for small gatherings and meetups!

_KDforIDsQS6bIaJi0_V0g.review_text: I enjoyed the music here, but holy shit it's super louuuud so prepare for that kind of vibe. The drinks are REALLY cheap, but it's CA$H only.  It's like stupid crowded with no ventilation and I want to say 40% of the crowd is RATCHET, another 40% is douche-baggy, and the remaining 20% is just trying to get through the ratchet and douche-bag crowd without getting harassed.

JVL0eReGF-IPtiMypmuqSw.review_text: -$10+ for a specialty drink  PROS - Nice place to go for a casual night cap on a Thursday night - Male: Female ratio is in favor of the straight female - Atmosphere reminded me of "Bullit," very cozy - Attracted many young (20s-30s) professionals - Strawberry cooler= refreshing!  CONS - Upstairs lounge area closed off - Had to stand due to lack of seats

P9D0oyIduE2g8LpgsrfgZw.review_text: Eclectic decor, never too crowded, delicious cocktails. I love this bar!

Dw6yia0s2PgLOzaFTBNGwA.review_text: The bouncer is nice, spacious, cozy, interesting drinks, cool bartenders, there's good looking folks, plays very good music, and it's chill. Perfect spot to start the night, end the night? Maybe not.

xdjhKDIy9AMCqxebBv69nw.review_text: One of the few places open on thanksgiving...  This place is the shit!  And 2 blocks from the house  I would have given it 5 stars as it is one of my favorite neighborhood bars but they don't take credit cards!  And who carries cash anymore these days?!

omrCjG2LidihfnMTDcdNng.review_text: Just ok nothing earth shattering here. Crowd was a bit cold, heard great things about it, but left after one beer.

KbJp5kb-AMB7ixBPref8WA.review_text: Wow, as if it weren't bad enough that this place only takes cash, Lush also takes short-changing customers to a whole new level. I came here last night and handed my bartender a $100 bill for two drinks -- she came back with $8 in change... Needless to say, I got the ADDITIONAL $80 back, but that was just criminal.   Summary - This is San Francisco, there are plenty of other bars to visit where you won't get ripped off and that take credit. Go elsewhere.

5CXIyYCit2qa2d-MlXGobQ.review_text: I forgot that we had ventured into this place weeks ago. Out with a few friends from dinner and was in the area. I prefer wine bars and lounges in different areas but depending on what group I'm with...I can try to enjoy it.  Not a bad place, reminds me of my college years. And I still was drinking beyond recognition that night. Haha. Honestly, depends on your crowd and your idea of a good night. Could be amazing for some people. But not for me.

a-qpJIQ893rJzxXGzDzNSg.review_text: This is just a great, chill bar.  My brother and his wife had a pub crawl birthday party last Friday where we came to Lush as our last stop.  I called Lush a couple days in advance and asked if I could drop a cake off early in the night.  They were super friendly and accommodating.  I've been to Lush a few times and every time I go, I have a great time.  Great drinks, friendly staff, and great energy all around.

1XqO594cIJbfiwWnqByNYQ.review_text: Love the luscious lounge. Great martini menu varying from the usual suspects to crazy key lime concoctions. Great atmosphere with 80's music playing in the background -- think Madonna. Very gay friendly, but doesn't scare off the straight guys either. It's a great spot for after-work drinks or before/after drinks when you grab dinner in the 'loin.

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: Whenever I don't feel like waiting the interminable 20-30min until I get home to drown my sorrows and/or the voices in my head encouraging me to kick puppies, I'll often wander over to Lush Lounge for a frou-frou drink or 3.  I nearly had a heart-attack when they "closed" for awhile as I had just discovered the place, but my fears were unfounded since they moved just up the street to a much bigger location a few weeks later.     Like many places on Polk, it can get insanely crowded on Friday & Saturday nights, and it can also get incredibly warm so I tend to go early on those days, but happy hour is otherwise pretty chill and they're open in the afternoons (at least on weekends anyway - it'd be nice to find out for myself if they're open during the day as it'd make work more entertaining...for me anyway...until I'm unceremoniously fired which would be bad...but I digress).    Nice staff, solid drinks, decent prices...I'm always going back.

OC2JAIK2SAzih5tbFFkO7Q.review_text: There is no cover which is a plus. The bartenders are very friendly and quite fast and efficient in helping each customer, even when the bar is packed. The bar is very small compared to most others in the area and therefore it was jam packed, making it slightly difficult to walk through and creating a long line for the restrooms. There is a private area upstairs which was nice for people watching and to escape the crowd.  The drinks are fairly priced and there were many good specials. The bar is cash only which is a bummer, but luckily I knew beforehand so I came prepared. The men and ladies' restrooms share a common sink area which made it even more crowded because the sinks had twice as many people using it.  The environment was very casual and relaxed. Most customers were young adults and there were a lot more men than women.  I definitely enjoyed my experience here and would return.

HXHVEg2a2QIkPcoIThGM6Q.review_text: The first stop on my list of the Polk Street nightlife has to be Lush Lounge. Great drinks, great bartenders, and a nice mix of people that make this place a great lounge to start the night off right. I went on a Saturday night and the place was packed with a little elbow room to wiggle around but that didn't hinder me from getting my drink in a good amount of time. If you really want to get away from the crowd you can actually go upstairs area which overlooks the bar. It's much more relaxing there and you can carry on a conversation there without screaming in your date's ear. Up above the bar you'll see the list of mixed drinks and cocktails that are their specialty. If you choose any of those, I assure you that you won't be disappointed. Most of the drinks are girly, I'll admit but damn are they delicious.  Overall great place with good drinks that are reasonably priced. The bartenders are sweethearts and know you're there. Next time I head over there I am definitely going to try whatever they have on display on their drink menu. And you should too!

PDiJYUQZ8QILb23-n8HzGw.review_text: Nice friendly neighborhood bar where dogs can come hangout. By dogs I don't mean guys.   Happy Hour is 7 days a week!!  Round 1: Decided on the Sky Cucumber Ginger Gimlet! Probably the best Gimlet I've had in SF. Gimlet was nicely shaken and frosty with little tiny ice bits.  Round 2: Mojitos were pretty good! Bartender was on it.  Overall, this was a nice place for Happy Hour. They have a warm fireplace. Best seat in the house! I will definitely be back. Drinks are well mixed at an awesome price.  Bathrooms are nice and modern. They have communal sinks outside the mens and womens bathroom...so you can wash your hands and maybe strike up a conversation with a cute guy.   Don't forget to bring you CASH ONLY. There is an ATM inside.

0hrC-VcO7ZpxI7rX9gNOuQ.review_text: Checked out Lush based on the yelp reviews, but those that I read didn't mention the roughness of the blocks immediately around Lush.   Sure, being on a block loaded with pan handlers and drug addicts is hard on a business, but the bar tender at Lush has a unique approach for keeping the patrons feeling... er....safe.  When a man who appeared hungry and in need of a bath walked in, our bartender shouted "GET OUT" and then leapt onto the bar, and jumped down to confront the unfortunate beggar.    I was reminded of the way I ran whooping after seagulls on the beach as a child, but only because of the way our bartender flapped his arms during his leap from the bar.    Why does this story belong in a yelp review?  Forewarned is fore armed... you might see some homeless people here, but don't invite them inside, unless you'd like to hear some shouting!

D1Q99Q9EKAKAWFiubV4_yA.review_text: I love this place! The bartendars are great and the atmosphere is just right!

E_1rVCWq4NgbXhEjMC651Q.review_text: This is my favorite bar on this part of Polk. The vibe reminded me of old hollywood mixed with tiki if that makes any sense. The huge list of cocktails is mesmerizing and the bartenders really craft the drinks here versus just mixing a few ingredients.  They were playing the fantastic late 60s movie Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice which was really great as background visuals to our evening. Natalie Wood and that dude from Ocean's 11? Alright!  I went in on a weekday, but I can imagine the scene here on a weekend is out of this world.  Definitely worth a trip if you're in the area and looking for a great cocktail!

g26gCqtBZpiHtqKF7LjbIw.review_text: Lush is my fave place for cocktails before 11pm on this side of Market.  Good good drinks, great bartenders, good people.

B8oano0xLoqG7P5XJhxjDg.review_text: uh-huh. yep. i like this place. i've come here to start a night, end a night, all night-you name it and i've done it and liked it. the drinks are superb. delicious. i can never decide what to have and with everything i try the first words out of my mouth are omg! this is my new favorite drink! it's really rather obnoxious. so...... good bar, delicious drinks, and killer people watching-the perfect mix for a good night.

qoYZ6QbVczMo3Dtyaeubhg.review_text: Fellow yelpers liked this place so I thought I would check it out with some friends. 5 stars for the best Margarita I've had in a long time! Really, they put little blueberries in the bottom of your glass. Even if you don't like blueberries, it's so entertaining to try to retrieve them with your straw. My friends also really liked their drinks.   I just wasn't feeling the vibe on a Saturday night. The crowd was a little older than my group (aka late 20s, early 30s). Not saying that in a bad way, please don't be offended. It was just more subdued than what we wanted that night. --Maybe the "Lounge" in the name would have given me a clue. It is a small place. Literally, there's a bar and then a few tables and some nice bartenders. So if that's what you want, then Lush is the place for you.

g8Omu6Bfutvw6dpbCZ5swQ.review_text: When they moved it was the best thing that could have ever happened to them. I love this place! Definitely a shining star on the nob hill side of Polk. The fireplace is a major plus. Bartenders are cool. You should go here.

x1ge7K9dt2yo3G7aQRRHqg.review_text: As far as it goes, a bar is just a bar.  The best way to stand out is to make a decent coctail and have a friendly staff which is exactly whas Lush Lounge does.  I hit this place with my coworkers to take the edge off a day from f*ing hell time and time again.  A little free popcorn and a few cocktails and I'm back to my calm self.  One of the best features isn't in the bar but, outside the windows.  It's Polk, it's at night... it's a show to say the very least.

mx-dFZZ75kGi9aQk0vY4Pw.review_text: "I don't know where we wrong but the feeling's gone and I just can't get it back."  I was never a regular at the old Lush Lounge.  I've gone maybe 6 or 7 times in the past couple years.  But it was a reliable place to get a drink with a diverse crowd in a cozy space.  While the new space is certainly beautiful, it didn't feel like "Lush Lounge".  It was too big, and the crowd was kind of douchey.  But it was crowded so I'm guessing the owners got what they want.  It seems like a nice enough place but it's lost it's charm.  Sad.

Bp-TQEtc6Vs6ldnLgjqglg.review_text: while doing some research for the magazine i'm editing today, i came across the lush lounge's website. splashed across the front page was the quote: "voted best pick up bar in san francisco"  wtf? really??   i don't see it. every time i come here, there's usually a group of really nice older gay men sipping on lemon drops and dirty martinis. there is also the tenderloin/polk gulch resident young-ish crowd situated along the counter or lounging at the tables toward the back having private conversations over their bloody marys and g&t's.   everyone seems pretty cool.   actually, it's kind of interesting to hang by the window facing divas. someone tried to sell me contraband through the window once, and the hookers on the corners are always fun to watch. they also play classic films on television screens and my friends and i usually fill in the dialogue and sound effects. our exchanges get pretty funny after the first couple of rounds.  it's no wonder i'm missing out on the pick up scene. i'm having way too much fun!

wDzVVCChqZ3jXPa1ayHu7g.review_text: I miss the tranny hookers from the old location.   Don't get me wrong - I totally get them moving. They probably do 10 times as much business being a block north. And they still retain that whole edge of polk street not quite as douche-y vibe. And it's a bigger cooler space.

Z4Fkz0ET2vqvjr-Cijo9Tg.review_text: Ok, so I was told that the garnish was a long-forgotten work of art. I mean, half the time you go to a bar and they attempt to throw in a 1/58th piece of lime. And they're like, "Ok...with the garnish, that's 8 bucks." And you think, "Why don't I garnish your face asswipe?"  Well, my friend talks and talks and talks about this place and the magical garnish. So, I'm like "What...they give you two limes?" The first time I go, I got nothing. Nada. No garnish. Come to find out that this particular bartender isn't a big garnisher.  Second time I go, I order a cactus margarita. Well, hot damn and hallelujah. They garnished the fuck outta this thing. Seriously, they used blueberris, raspberries, pieces of orange, strawberries, and I believe a few blackberries, and the guy made a bridge around my drink with these fruits and some toothpicks. A frickin bridge! I mean, we were joking that I was disappointed in the garnish last time. Perhaps he went crazy on me? But seriously, I was like..."Wow." We sat near the window staring at it, afraid to drink the Sistine Chapel of alcoholic beverages. It was...truly magical.  Now, I paid for the damn thing so I did drink that. Don't think I'm wasting perfectly good liquor cause it's "pretty." The drink was rather tasty, and I had three woman ask me what it was so they could order one themselves.  Awesome place. A little small, but in that neighborhood, I'd call it cozy. :)

M7PNEjG6XUC0jSoD4YF_Cw.review_text: Not a bad place for a Friday night. Loud, crowded, clean bathroom. Nice upstairs if you want to sit and talk.

asUXa8IyivYFWVNQkGWWvQ.review_text: i love lush lounge on weekends. probably my fave place on lower polk.  +cool, relaxed vibe, and they play good music.  +drink specials, like tequila + tecate for ridiculously cheap ($10 or less, depending on the night) +it never gets THAT crowded. seems like the crowd comes and goes, but i never feel like a stuffed sardine here  -one toilet for women, and one for men. I've never had to wait in line that long, though.  i've only been upstairs once, and it was for a private party. it's nice up there, and I know you can rent it out for a nominal fee. perfect for a birthday party!  FYI cash only.

Dxr0oCHoALgCmi6NUOjVlg.review_text:
Sometimes you wanna go where everybody knows your drink's name. The bartenders here can make all manner of flavoured martini drinks, and they do it damn well. The lemondrop is always perfect, and the chocolate martini is like dessert with a buzz. There's drink specials on martinis each night... yay for me! Cuz I hate beer.
  I love this place for being the polar opposite of a dump like Zeitgeist: no tragically annoying hipsters with bedhead and Chuck Taylors, no stinky port-o-lets, no cig smokers, no questionable BBQ, no bearded bikers. The bar has a casual, mellow atmosphere and its perfect for hanging out. It's not a meat market, and the indoor bathroom is clean.  You can sit by the window and watch the parade of humanity cruise on by, placing bets as to whether that dude from South Bay realizes he just picked up a tranny hooker instead of a genetic female. This beats reality tv any day. 
  Lush Lounge is one of the few spots on that stretch of Polk Gulch that is not full of about-to-barf drunken 20-somethings. I hate dives, in case you haven't noticed. A year in NYC in the company of gay men cured me of any tolerance of places where they'd sooner spit in my glass than make me a martini. I am in my 30s and do not consider a fun night out to be one where I sit on a wooden bench and swig PSR during inclement weather. I appreciate a place where I can have a good drink, hear my friend talk to me without shouting, and can safely stagger the 2 blocks home at closing time.  Plus, the bartenders are cute and friendly.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: At this point I was pretty sauced so I'm giving them four stars.    Nice drinks and great variety.  Props to the cute bartenders who must be from Florida b/c it was f*ing hot in this place and they didn't even break a sweat.   If they turned up the air in this place I'd give it a 5 for sure.  Not the place you'd go to meet someone, but bring someone you meet from another bar for something that isn't the usual vodka-redbull/rum and coke we are seeing so much of these days.  Nice change of pace.

P9JgzhCAyuXpZRjUMz6QcA.review_text: I've generally not been a fan of this place because of the annoyance of it being cash-only, but yesterday confirmed that I will never go back.  I was out with my husband and some friends, joining in SantaCon festivities, and we were making our way up Polk Street. We tried to go into Lush, and the bouncer said that anyone in costume was not allowed in. We were not overly drunk nor rambunctious. It was a very un-San Francisco move on their part, and I prefer not to give my business to places that so blatantly go against the fun-loving, laid back vibe of this city.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I wanted to like this place--One cute bartender..and a nice fire place against the wall...but the crowd and the vibe was way random (weird)...we felt as it we had arrived at twilight zone..  Will go back again during the week and hopefully have a better experience...

PlNYOwihoRTeEoQa5t-YbA.review_text: The name of this place is confusing, because it's not really a lounge, and the only lush references are framed on the walls. But still, a fun stop for the evening. Drinks seem to lean in the fruit direction, which is fine by me. A few more seats would be welcome, though.

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: I have toured their bar menu and it was pleasing.  A plethora of delicious, refreshing drinks await discovery.  It was a tall container of Raspberry Lemon Drops that winked at me as I passed along the sidewalk.  Wait, that brings back memories of Vegas - we must go in.

94Vdm34IzLwC-FK3p6bGsw.review_text: I'm in love with Lush. Great ambience, great music, great layout -- just an overall good time.   I love bars with a loft setup, which means you can sneak away upstairs to have a quieter conversation, or in my case, gawk and make faces at everyone downstairs. Music definitely sounds like it's coming from an employee's personal collection. Good thing, in this case, because it's a cool kid mix of R&B, hip hop, and dance -- meaning it's laid-back but still party-worthy.  Definitely looking to come back for happy hour and check out some of the specials.

0rNlGgPIoQyI0FEzawc0uw.review_text: Great decor!  The Cucumber Kiss is awesome! Service is good. Overall, a good experience for my first time. Will definitely return again and bring friends to try it out.

bFX5ImF8Jm-0vrBh9vY5AQ.review_text: I joined Yelp just to let the world know how terrible Lush Lounge is.  This place is especially rude to their customers for no apparent reason, and to make matters worse, the bouncer allowed some girls that were clearly underage inside last Saturday night.  Coincidentally, he also let in some sketchy dude that skeezed on one of the girls and must've put something in her drink.  I saw the whole thing happen and she was basically carried out by this creep, and hopefully her friends got her back from being essentially abducted.  Very sad story, and even more sad that the butthole bouncer was such a dick about it.  All that aside, try the Disaronno on the rocks there, it's fantastic.

1plHNQOKKiwDU4g-_c0JAw.review_text: Was there last night with a couple of friends. This is a cool bar with friendly people behind the counter. The bar had lame music till midnight but it got louder as more people starting pouring in around midnight. Overall a pretty chill place but the music could get louder and better

jOP-fnqoNI06w2UJ5lPNNw.review_text: Well apparently Lush Lounge is kind of a flamboyant gay hang out according to the other reviews. (?). For whatever reason I didn't seem to notice. Now that I think about it, no dudes bought me a drink there and it was pretty crowded. But then again, this was the last stop of the night, so it very well might have happened. Either way, I do remember the place had a great vibe and I left there blowing probably around a .18, so the drinks must have been good. Though it was a bit crowded, it wasn't too difficult to get a cocktail. I'll hit it up again for sure.

xsMd6OnEJ6_Np6Es0uxOIg.review_text: The lady bartender was friendly. She mixed my surfer on acid pretty good. I know I'm at a great bar/lounge when the jukebox has a excellent amount of music selection in general and a great selection of electronic music including some dubstep!

2Dg4fbWB1uqouXC2X48E6g.review_text: Once upon a time, my friends were born.  Which means they have birthdays.  Which means they, and I, drink heavily on those days.  As a result of this, I found myself at Lush Lounge on Saturday evening, along with a zillion of my closest friends.  Or mostly people I've never met before.  However, after my knob creek manhattan on the rocks (which, at $9 for essentially a double bourbon was a STEAL), they BECAME my closest friends.  WHEE!  It gets a little loud and a little warm, but the fireplace is a nice touch.  I'll be back.

auU2dt62RbnGaQpprzHrVQ.review_text: there is a little stairway in the back of the bar that leads to a casual looking bookcase.  but if you look very closely, the bookcase is an actual, real-life secret revolving door.  its just like the one you dreamt of having when you were little, after seeing it on scooby doo when freddie, daphne, velma, and shaggy  solved mysteries in haunted houses.  it is glorious.  we stood and stared at it for a good minute, frozen in awe.  then we tried to open it and sneak a peek.  BAD IDEA.  the owner came out of nowhere behind us and barked for us to mind our own business.  (we totally deserved it.)  flushed and wide eyed, we backed away from the "bookcase" and went back to sipping our stellas at the bar.  we glanced back at it a couple times.  it taunted us with its mysterious presence.  nick k. thinks its the door to narnia.  he says the owner is mad because he doesn't believe anymore, so he can't go back there.  and if he can't go, no one can.  i believe him.

w5D3YHeYFBh-pqR3pYaO7Q.review_text: This place is cute and dark. Here is a nice fireplace and a counter for you to drink and people watch! This is not a place for you to come and get rowdy but a place to come with a couple of close friends or a date and have a couple of drinks. Their happy hour drinks are excellent, my favorite is the blueberry martini which has an actual blueberry in it! The prices for the drinks are decent. I don't live in SF but when I am in the city I think of Lush Lounge!

NOmAy-MwUgr_v8dwKBAJNw.review_text: This place is pretty solid.  A little loud with the music but its a great spot for going out among friends or even a date spot if you have a loud voice.  The drinks are cheap to fair pricing and can be a bit stiff with the pour ratio which I don't mind but some of the ladies might.
